original: @234b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @234b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya buddha bh'u mi by'a khy'a na /
analyzed: a'arya buddha bh'u mi by'a khy'a na /
translated: Ārya-buddhabhūmi-vyākhyāna

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: Explanation of the Noble Buddha Ground

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha and all Bodhisattvas.

original: gang dag chos dbyings ma lus thugs su chud gyur la //
analyzed: gang dag chos dbyings ma lus thugs su chud gyur la //
translated: Those who have realized the entire dharmadhātu

original: tshig gam yang na blo yis brjod par mi nus kyang //
analyzed: tshig gam yang na blo yis brjod par mi nus kyang //
translated: Cannot be expressed in words or by the intellect,

original: sa yi yon tan nyid skyes rnams la de 'chad pa //
analyzed: sa yi yon tan nyid skyes rnams la de 'chad pa //
translated: Yet they explain it to those born with the qualities of the grounds.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas de dag rnams la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas de dag rnams la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to those sources of good qualities.

original: bla ma rnams kyi dgongs pa yid ches dag mthong nas //
analyzed: bla ma rnams kyi dgongs pa yid ches dag mthong nas //
translated: Seeing the intentions of the gurus with confidence,

original: gang dag bdag pas blo zhan rnam par rmongs pa rnams //
analyzed: gang dag bdag pas blo zhan rnam par rmongs pa rnams //
translated: Those who are more ignorant than me, confused,

original: de dag rnam par dag pa mchog rab skyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag rnam par dag pa mchog rab skyed pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to generate supreme, perfect purity in them,

original: thub pa rnams kyi sa ni rnam par dgrol bar bya //
analyzed: thub pa rnams kyi sa ni rnam par dgrol bar bya //
translated: I will explain the stages of the Sage.

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni phun sum tshogs //
translated: The perfect buddha field

original: yon tan dang ni phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: yon tan dang ni phun sum tshogs //
translated: The perfect qualities

original: sangs rgyas sa rnams gzhag pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa rnams gzhag pa ste //
translated: The stages of the buddhas are set forth.

original: de ltar mdo don bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar mdo don bsdus pa yin //
translated: Thus the meaning of the sutra is summarized.

original: chos nyid ye shes me long dang // mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: chos nyid ye shes me long dang // mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: The mirror-like intuition, the equalizing intuition, the individually discerning intuition, and the accomplishing intuition

original: sa yi bsdu ba nges pa yin //🔽grangs rnams dang ni ming nyid dang // bsdu dang rab tu dbye ba dang // ye shes rdzogs la bye brag gis //
analyzed: sa yi bsdu ba nges pa yin // grangs rnams dang ni ming nyid dang // bsdu dang rab tu dbye ba dang // ye shes rdzogs la bye brag gis //
translated: are the definitive summary of the stages.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni sa bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni sa bshad do //
translated: The stages of the buddhas are explained in terms of their number, their names, their summary, their differentiation, and their intuition.

original: mdo sde 'di las /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las /
translated: In this sutra,

original: mdor na bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / sa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: mdor na bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / sa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan te /
translated: in brief, the perfection of the abode of the Lord, the perfection of his qualities, the perfection of his retinue, and the arrangement of the stages are taught.

original: gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa dang / sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de rim gyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa dang / sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de rim gyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Where, what kind, and how many are present, and how the stages are arranged are taught in order.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzhal med khang chen po na ste /
analyzed: gzhal med khang chen po na ste /
translated: In the great palace.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Its perfection is called the array of the seven supreme jewels blazing in all directions.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Bhagavat,

original: de'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: whose perfection of good qualities is called endowed with the mind of complete understanding.

original: ji lta bu dag dang zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu dag dang zhe na /
translated: With what is it associated?

original: de'i 'khor nyan thos chen po rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams te /🔽mdo sde gzhan las dul ba /🔽'khor dul ba /
analyzed: de'i 'khor nyan thos chen po rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams te / mdo sde gzhan las dul ba / 'khor dul ba /
translated: With his great śrāvaka retinue and his great bodhisattva retinue.🔽Because in other sūtras it is said, “The retinue is disciplined,”

original: grol ba / 'khor grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / @235a * //
analyzed: grol ba / 'khor grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / @235a * //
translated: “The retinue is liberated,”

original: 'di las kyang nyan thos tshad med pa 'di dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa dag dang thabs cig go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las kyang nyan thos tshad med pa 'di dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa dag dang thabs cig go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because this sūtra also says, “With the saṅgha of immeasurable śrāvakas and innumerable bodhisattvas.”

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni thams cad kyang cad shes pa zhes bya ba dang thams cad kyang gnas pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni thams cad kyang cad shes pa zhes bya ba dang thams cad kyang gnas pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Its excellence is that all are called omniscient and all are called engaged in the great stage, and so on.

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Like the disciples and bodhisattvas, respectively.

original: sa rnam par gzhag pa'i chos lngas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa rnam par gzhag pa'i chos lngas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The five dharmas that establish the stages, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni mdo'i ming don dang ldan par btags te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni mdo'i ming don dang ldan par btags te /
translated: The stage of the Buddha is designated as the name of the sutra, which is consistent with the meaning.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lta bu dang / rin po che phrogs pa lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lta bu dang / rin po che phrogs pa lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen like dependent origination and like the theft of jewels.

original: de la gang du don rnam par nges par sbyin par byed cing sbyor bar byed pa'am phan tshun rnam par nges pa sbyin pa 'byung ba de ni gleng gzhi ste de nyid gnas yin no //
analyzed: de la gang du don rnam par nges par sbyin par byed cing sbyor bar byed pa'am phan tshun rnam par nges pa sbyin pa 'byung ba de ni gleng gzhi ste de nyid gnas yin no //
translated: There, where the meaning is ascertained and given, or where mutual ascertainment arises, that is the nidana, the basis.

original: de thog ma nyid du bstan pa'i dgos pa ni 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas yin no zhes yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thog ma nyid du bstan pa'i dgos pa ni 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas yin no zhes yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose of teaching it at the very beginning is to show that it is the abode of omniscience, which transcends all worlds.

original: de bstan pas yang gdul bya rnams de la mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bstan pas yang gdul bya rnams de la mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: By teaching it, disciples generate interest in it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar smon lam 'debs par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dga' ba yang dag par bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar smon lam 'debs par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dga' ba yang dag par bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: They make aspirational prayers to be born in a pure buddha field, and bodhisattvas who are interested in the vast generate true joy.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa la mos pa rnams lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtan par bya ba'i phyir dang / gang du bzhugs te chos rab tu ston par mdzad pa de yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa la mos pa rnams lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtan par bya ba'i phyir dang / gang du bzhugs te chos rab tu ston par mdzad pa de yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are interested in the element of the superior attitude stabilize their superior attitude, and they also correctly demonstrate where the Buddha resides and teaches the Dharma.

original: gzhan du na gang du bzhugs te rab tu ston mi shes pa kun la the tshom du gyur pas de'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan du na gang du bzhugs te rab tu ston mi shes pa kun la the tshom du gyur pas de'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: Otherwise, since it is not known where the Buddha resided and taught, there would be doubt about everything, and so the Buddha spoke in this way in order to eliminate that doubt.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus have I heard is stated in order to eliminate doubt.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba tshig phrad 'di ni dpe dang lung 'bogs pa dang / dris pa rnam par nges pa dang / dam bca' ba dang / tshig gi lan dag la 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba tshig phrad 'di ni dpe dang lung 'bogs pa dang / dris pa rnam par nges pa dang / dam bca' ba dang / tshig gi lan dag la 'byung ste /
translated: The expression thus have I heard occurs in similes, in the recitation of scriptures, in the ascertainment of questions, in promises and in replies to questions.

original: dpe la ni rnam thos ltar phyug pa rnam thos dang 'dra bar shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dpe la ni rnam thos ltar phyug pa rnam thos dang 'dra bar shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: In similes, it is like the simile of the wealthy man, who is like Vaiśravaṇa.

original: lung 'bogs pa la 'di skad thon cig ces @235b bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa la 'di skad thon cig ces @235b bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the recitation of scriptures, it is like the statement, “Recite thus.”

original: dris pa rnam par nges par bya ba la ni bdag gis 'di skad thos so //🔽'di skad du bshad do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dris pa rnam par nges par bya ba la ni bdag gis 'di skad thos so // 'di skad du bshad do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the ascertainment of questions, it is like the statement, “I have heard thus.”

original: dam bca' ba la ni de bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba la ni de bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In promises, it is like the statement, “I will explain thus.”

original: tshig gi lan la ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshig gi lan la ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In replies to questions, it is like the statement, “It is thus.”

original: 'di ni dam bca' ba kho na la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dam bca' ba kho na la blta bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as a mere assertion.

original: yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de kho na bzhin du bshad par gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpas bdag gis thos pa de kho na bzhin du smra bar bya'o khas 'ches pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de kho na bzhin du bshad par gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpas bdag gis thos pa de kho na bzhin du smra bar bya'o khas 'ches pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are the compilers of the sutra request the Buddha to teach, saying, “Please teach just as you have heard it.” The bodhisattva promises to teach just as he has heard it.

original: yang na ji skad du smras pa de kho na bzhin du bdag gis thos te /
analyzed: yang na ji skad du smras pa de kho na bzhin du bdag gis thos te /
translated: Or else, just as he has taught it, he has heard it in that way.

original: de bzhin du bstan par bya'i gzhan du ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan par bya'i gzhan du ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: He teaches in that way, not otherwise.

original: yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa yongs su spangs nas snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa yongs su spangs nas snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: He thinks that he will teach, having completely abandoned exaggeration and deprecation by other branches.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du yin gyi /
translated: “By me” means that he has heard it directly from the Bhagavat himself,

original: gud nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gud nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de ma yin pa'o //
translated: not from someone else, by way of a succession of individuals.

original: thos pa ni nyan nus pa'i rna ba'i dbang pos zin pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni nyan nus pa'i rna ba'i dbang pos zin pa'o //
translated: Hearing is the possession of the ear faculty, which is capable of hearing.

original: 'dis kyang yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa yongs su spong ste /
analyzed: 'dis kyang yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa yongs su spong ste /
translated: This also completely avoids the fault of misapprehending and denying other factors.

original: byis pa gang dag mi nus pa de dag ni yan lag la skur ba 'debs pa'am sgro 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: byis pa gang dag mi nus pa de dag ni yan lag la skur ba 'debs pa'am sgro 'dogs par byed do //
translated: The childish, who are incapable, either misapprehend or deny the factors.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig gi tshe na ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig gi tshe na ste /
translated: At one time means at one time,

original: nyan pa'i tshe bar chad med pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa kho nas dus gcig yin no //
analyzed: nyan pa'i tshe bar chad med pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa kho nas dus gcig yin no //
translated: at the time of hearing, because there is no interruption, it is at one time in the sense of continuity.

original: de lta ma yin na yi ge dang / tshig dang ngag 'dzin pa'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yi ge dang / tshig dang ngag 'dzin pa'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be one, since the time of apprehending the letters, words, and speech are different?

original: yang na gzungs thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig la chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzungs thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig la chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, because one who has attained retention perfectly apprehends all Dharma teachings in a single letter.

original: yang na rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag pa thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig yongs su bshad na gzhan la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag pa thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig yongs su bshad na gzhan la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, because he has obtained the pure ear faculty, he can explain a single syllable without impediment to others.

original: yang na dus ni tshogs pa yin te dus tshogs pa gcig na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na dus ni tshogs pa yin te dus tshogs pa gcig na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, time is a collection, and the time of the collection is the time of the assembly.🔽The word bhagavat occurs in the sense of self-control,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang dbang dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang bdag @236a * //🔽nyid chen po la 'byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang dbang dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang bdag @236a * // nyid chen po la 'byung ste /
translated: pliancy, good appearance, fame, glory, and greatness.🔽Self-control, pliancy, good appearance, fame,

original: rang dbang shin tu sbyangs pa dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang bdag nyid che stsogs pa //🔽drug la skal ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang dbang shin tu sbyangs pa dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang bdag nyid che stsogs pa // drug la skal ba zhes bshad do //
translated: glory, greatness, and so on,

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: are explained as the six kinds of good fortune.

original: de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad dang mi 'bral bar mnga' bas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad dang mi 'bral bar mnga' bas /
translated: Since the Tathāgata is endowed with all of these in every way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bcom ldan 'das yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bcom ldan 'das yin no //
translated: he is called the Blessed One.

original: ji lta zhe na rang dbang nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na rang dbang nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? It is independent, because it is not subject to the afflictions of others.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa nyid ni ye shes kyi me'i gdung bas yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa nyid ni ye shes kyi me'i gdung bas yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well purified, because it is purified by the fire of wisdom.

original: gzugs bzang ba 'di ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba 'di ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is beautiful, because it possesses the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: grags pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is famous, because it is endowed with all the special qualities.

original: dpal ni 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsnyen par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽che ba nyid tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: dpal ni 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsnyen par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // che ba nyid tshogs pa ni /
translated: It is glorious, because it is revered by all beings.

original: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa'i sbyor ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa'i sbyor ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great, because it is the means of achieving the welfare and happiness of all beings in every way.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na bdud bzhi bcom pas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na bdud bzhi bcom pas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Or else, it is the Bhagavat, because it has conquered the four demons.

original: bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
translated: The four demons are the demon of the aggregates, the demon of the Lord of Death, the demon of the afflictions, and the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the place is the complete purification of the Buddha land.

original: de yang phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bco brgyad kyis phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bco brgyad kyis phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is perfect through eighteen perfections:

original: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of color, the perfection of shape, the perfection of size, the perfection of land, the perfection of cause, the perfection of effect, the perfection of master,

original: phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang / zham 'bring phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang / zham 'bring phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The perfection of direction, the perfection of attendants, the perfection of teacher, the perfection of action, the perfection of benefit, the perfection of fearlessness, the perfection of abode,

original: lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / @236b sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / @236b sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: the perfection of path, the perfection of vehicle, the perfection of gate, and the perfection of basis.

original: go rims bzhin du tshig bcu dgus yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du tshig bcu dgus yongs su bstan to //
translated: These are taught by nineteen words in order.

original: de la mchog tu 'bar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang la rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba dag gis bkod pa brgyan pa'i bye brag yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la mchog tu 'bar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang la rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba dag gis bkod pa brgyan pa'i bye brag yod pa'o //
translated: Therein, “supremely blazing” and so on refers to the particular ornament of the array with the seven supreme precious substances.

original: yang na gzhal yas khang gi khyad par de nyid rin po che de dag gis mchog tu 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhal yas khang gi khyad par de nyid rin po che de dag gis mchog tu 'bar ba'o //
translated: Or, that very special celestial mansion is supremely blazing with those precious substances.

original: rin po che sna bdun ni gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / spug dang / rdo'i snying po mu tig dmar po ste /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun ni gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / spug dang / rdo'i snying po mu tig dmar po ste /
translated: The seven jewels are gold, silver, beryl, crystal, red pearls, white coral, and emerald.

original: dmar po ni srog chags kyi rigs so //🔽de las byung ba'i phyir bye brag med par nye bar btags te /
analyzed: dmar po ni srog chags kyi rigs so // de las byung ba'i phyir bye brag med par nye bar btags te /
translated: Red pearls are a type of animal.

original: mu tig dmar po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu tig dmar po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called red pearls because they are attached to the body of an animal without distinction.🔽White coral is a type of plant.

original: ke ke ru ni bdun pa ste /
analyzed: ke ke ru ni bdun pa ste /
translated: Emerald is the seventh.

original: de ltar na ni mchog tu 'bar ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ni mchog tu 'bar ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is the supreme light.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag rgyas pas 'gengs pa khyab par byed pa des na 'od zer chen po dag rab tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag rgyas pas 'gengs pa khyab par byed pa des na 'od zer chen po dag rab tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: Because he fills and pervades immeasurable world-realms, he emits great light-rays.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'od zer rnams mnga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'od zer rnams mnga' ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, he is the possessor of light-rays.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa yang yin la /🔽'od zer chen po dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa yang yin la / 'od zer chen po dag kyang yin te /
translated: He fills immeasurable world-realms and is great light.🔽He emits that light.

original: gang la de dag rab tu 'byung ba yod ces tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la de dag rab tu 'byung ba yod ces tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattva is the supreme light because he emits great light-rays.

original: de lta bas na tshig 'di gnyis kyis kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshig 'di gnyis kyis kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bshad do //
translated: Thus, these two terms explain the perfection of color.

original: de ltar kha dog phun sum tshogs pa'i dbyibs ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar kha dog phun sum tshogs pa'i dbyibs ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the shape of the perfection of color?

original: gnas tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Sūtra says, “The various sites are well-arranged.

original: gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba tshad med pa dag rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba tshad med pa dag rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: The various sites are well-arranged, immeasurable, and well-ordered.

original: 'di la rnam par gnas pa bye brag tu'am rnam pa sna tshogs su'am mchog tu gnas pa yod pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par gnas pa bye brag tu'am rnam pa sna tshogs su'am mchog tu gnas pa yod pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term “well-arranged” is to be supplied in each case.

original: tshad med pa nyid ni grangs tshad med pa'i phyir dang yul tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid ni grangs tshad med pa'i phyir dang yul tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are immeasurable because their number is immeasurable and their extent is immeasurable.

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba ni blo sngon du btang ba'i cha rnam par gzhag pas bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba ni blo sngon du btang ba'i cha rnam par gzhag pas bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are well-ordered because they are arranged in a manner that is governed by the mind.

original: ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i ngo bo la blo sngon du btang ba'i cha rnam par gzhag pa srid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i ngo bo la blo sngon du btang ba'i cha rnam par gzhag pa srid ce na /
translated: How is it possible for the various sites of a pure buddha-land to be governed by the mind?

original: de'i phyi rol gyi dngos po bsgrub pa la yongs su grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi dngos po bsgrub pa la yongs su grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The accomplishment of the external things is not the perfected nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pas shes rab kyi rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'byung @237a * //🔽ba la spyod pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pas shes rab kyi rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'byung @237a * // ba la spyod pa na /
translated: The Lord, when he was a bodhisattva, practiced the arising of wisdom with the formative forces,

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de lta de ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de lta de ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and through the power of his vow, he formed the buddhaverse in such and such a way.

original: sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis spros pa med pa'i gnas skabs na yang de kha na bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis spros pa med pa'i gnas skabs na yang de kha na bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir la /
translated: And even in the state of the absence of formative forces, it arises just as it was formed earlier,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rnam par rig pa snang ba 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rnam par rig pa snang ba 'gal ba med de /
translated: and it is not contradictory that the buddhas and bodhisattvas have the appearance of cognition.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: de ltar dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa de'i tshe ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa de'i tshe ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of shape like at that time?

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas rgya yongs su mchad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas rgya yongs su mchad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: With reference to that, he says: “it is extensive”.

original: gang gi rgya 'di tsam mo zhes bya bar yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rgya 'di tsam mo zhes bya bar yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not limited in the sense that it is this much.

original: rgya ni kun nas khon che ba yin no //
analyzed: rgya ni kun nas khon che ba yin no //
translated: The seal is very extensive.

original: yang na gang gis rgya srid la sogs pa'i tshad yongs su ma chad pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang gis rgya srid la sogs pa'i tshad yongs su ma chad pa ste /
translated: Or, it is not limited in extent, such as the extent of the seal of the ocean, etc.

original: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs cha tha dad pa yongs su chad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs cha tha dad pa yongs su chad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not limited by the different directions, such as the east, etc.

original: de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called that.

original: de ltar tshad yongs su chad pa de ci khams gsum na spyod pa zhig yin nam zhe na ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshad yongs su chad pa de ci khams gsum na spyod pa zhig yin nam zhe na ma yin no //
translated: Thus, is that extent experienced in the three realms? No, it is not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Then, what is it?

original: khams gsum pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin te /
translated: It is the domain that completely transcends the three realms.

original: gang la khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul lam gnas sam yul yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul lam gnas sam yul yod pa'o //
translated: It is that which has the domain, abode, or object of the complete transcendence of the three realms.

original: khams gsum pa ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas brtas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas brtas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The three realms are expanded by means of the objective support and the concomitant.

original: rang gi sa pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gis byas pa dang / de'i rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gis byas pa dang / de'i rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: The craving of the same stage is the cause of the arising of the palace, and the palace is the effect of the craving.

original: de ni des bdag gi ra ma byas pa'i phyir dang / de'i rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni des bdag gi ra ma byas pa'i phyir dang / de'i rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: The palace is not the effect of the craving of the second meditation, etc., because it is not produced by this craving, and because it is not the ripened effect of this craving.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like nirvana.

original: 'o na ni rgal ba de gzhal med khang rnam par smin pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du rgyu med pa can yin no //🔽'on te rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin na ni de'i khongs su 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rgal ba de gzhal med khang rnam par smin pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du rgyu med pa can yin no // 'on te rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin na ni de'i khongs su 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then, since the palace is beyond the stage of the ripened effect, it would be without cause, like nirvana.🔽If you admit that it has a cause, you must then admit that it is included in the three realms of existence.

original: yang na ni de'i rgyu khams gsum pa la gtogs pa zhig brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ni de'i rgyu khams gsum pa la gtogs pa zhig brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: Or else, you must say what is the cause of the palace.

original: bden te 'di'i rgyu ni khams gsum pa las 'das pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bden te 'di'i rgyu ni khams gsum pa las 'das pa kho na yin no //
translated: The Vaibhāṣika: The cause of the palace is beyond the three realms of existence.

original: rgyu de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is this cause?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhe bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhe bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra says that the palace arises from the roots of good which are beyond the three realms of existence.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The supramundane is the nonconceptual intuition.

original: de'i bla ma'i @237b dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de'i rjes la thob pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bla ma'i @237b dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de'i rjes la thob pa ste /
translated: The root of the wholesome which is its antecedent is the subsequently attained intuition.

original: rgyu de las byung ba yin gyi rgyu med pa can yang ma yin la dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de las byung ba yin gyi rgyu med pa can yang ma yin la dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It arises from that cause, but not without cause, nor does it arise from a cause such as a divine creator.

original: ji ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i chos khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i chos khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How can the subsequently attained pure mundane intuition, which is the aftermath of the nonconceptual intuition, be the cause of the evolutionary development of beings, since it transcends the three worlds?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be said that it is the cause of evolutionary development.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de las gzhan pa gang srid pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gang srid pa ste /
translated: It is the cause of the other, which is possible,

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs kyi 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs kyi 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog bzhin no //
translated: like the mundane supreme virtue which is the group of the receptivity to the knowledge of the teaching of suffering.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'jig rten las 'das pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam mo //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'jig rten las 'das pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam mo //
translated: Or, alternatively, the supramundane is the path of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de'i bla ma dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa med pa rnams te /
analyzed: de'i bla ma dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa med pa rnams te /
translated: The gurus of those are the roots of virtue of the transcendent lords, which are uncontaminated.

original: rgyu de las byung ba ni de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu de las byung ba ni de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which arises from that cause is said to be by its power, which means by the power of those gurus.

original: de ltar rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ji 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ji 'dra zhe na /
translated: If the result is perfect in terms of cause in that way, what is it like?

original: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be characterized by extremely pure, sovereign cognition.

original: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni 'di'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni 'di'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That which is extremely pure and sovereign cognition is its characteristic.

original: de ni rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa lam gtogs rin po che la sogs pa med pas rnam par rig pa shin tu rnam par byang ba de nyid de ltar snang ste sngar ji skad du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa lam gtogs rin po che la sogs pa med pas rnam par rig pa shin tu rnam par byang ba de nyid de ltar snang ste sngar ji skad du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Since it is merely cognition, there are no jewels and so on apart from cognition. Therefore, that extremely pure cognition appears in that way, just as it was previously explained.

original: yul dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu yin te /
translated: It is a result because it is similar to its object.

original: zad par sngon po la sogs pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyis de'i rnam par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zad par sngon po la sogs pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyis de'i rnam par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of the meditative absorption of the totality of blue, etc.

original: gzhal med khang ni bdag pos yongs su bzung ba'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhal med khang ni bdag pos yongs su bzung ba'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag po gang yin zhe na /
translated: Since the palace is owned by the master, what is the perfection of the result of the master?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te de ni bdag po'i khyad par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te de ni bdag po'i khyad par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pa'am /
translated: The abode of the Tathagata is stated. It is the abode of the Lord Buddha, not of others, since it is the abode of the master.

original: des de byin gyis brlabs shing zhe la gzung ba yin gyis gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: des de byin gyis brlabs shing zhe la gzung ba yin gyis gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the abode of the Tathagata, not of others, since it is blessed and accepted by him.🔽Since the master is the one who possesses the region, the perfection of the master is stated.

original: bdag po ni phyogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir de ltar bdag po phun sum tshogs pa'i phyogs dgos pas byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun rjes su song bzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag po ni phyogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir de ltar bdag po phun sum tshogs pa'i phyogs dgos pas byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun rjes su song bzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The immeasurable assembly of bodhisattvas is stated as the region of the master.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun rjes su song ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun rjes su song ba yod pa'o //
translated: This is the region of the immeasurable assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: @238a * // gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba de ni de'i phyogs zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' bgrang ba las 'das pa rnams kyang de'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: @238a * // gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba de ni de'i phyogs zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' bgrang ba las 'das pa rnams kyang de'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Those who follow after him are called his faction.

original: de dag kho na dgra rnam pa thams cad du phyir bzlog nus pas de'i phyogs yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kho na dgra rnam pa thams cad du phyir bzlog nus pas de'i phyogs yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since only they are able to completely turn back his enemies, they are his faction, but not the Sravakas, etc.

original: de ltar phyogs phun sum tshogs pa'i zham 'bring ba dgos pas de'i 'og tu lha la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs phun sum tshogs pa'i zham 'bring ba dgos pas de'i 'og tu lha la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the retinue is perfect in terms of faction.

original: lto 'phye chen po ni sbrul chen po'o //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po ni sbrul chen po'o //
translated: The great nagas are the great serpents.

original: 'o na ji ltar khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bshad /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bshad /
translated: But how can it be said to be the domain transcending the three realms?

original: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul na ni lha la sogs pa ni mi srid de /
analyzed: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul na ni lha la sogs pa ni mi srid de /
translated: The gods, etc. are not possible in the domain transcending the three realms,

original: de dag ni khams gsum na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni khams gsum na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they are active in the three realms.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa rig pa snang ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa rig pa snang ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the fact that the Buddha has the appearance of a cognition that apprehends the appearance of the world.

original: yang na de dag ni sprul pa yin la de ltar kun du bstan pa ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na de dag ni sprul pa yin la de ltar kun du bstan pa ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, they are emanations, and this demonstration is for the sake of the maturation of those sentient beings who are to be converted,

original: ka pi nag dul bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor kun du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ka pi nag dul bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor kun du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the retinue of a universal monarch is demonstrated for the sake of the conversion of the kapiśa people.

original: yang na de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' kho na yin te /
translated: Or else, they are only bodhisattvas,

original: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir lha la sogs pa'i lus su mngon par sprul nas rnam par gnas par zad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir lha la sogs pa'i lus su mngon par sprul nas rnam par gnas par zad do //
translated: who, in order to worship the Lord, have manifested in the bodies of gods, etc., and are present.

original: de lta zham ring ba phun sum tshos pa cis bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta zham ring ba phun sum tshos pa cis bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how is their greatness of distance demonstrated?

original: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is demonstrated by great joy and bliss in the taste of Dharma.

original: 'di na chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chen pos bstan pa yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //🔽zas ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'di na chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chen pos bstan pa yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // zas ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the joy and bliss of the taste of Dharma” is to be supplied here.

original: des kyang gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Food is that which sustains, and this sustains.

original: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it said that the object of the transcendent lords is beyond the three realms?

original: ji ltar na de'i zas yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i zas yin /
translated: How can it be food?

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang de'i zas yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang de'i zas yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that uncontaminated states are its food,

original: zas ni srid pa gso bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir la de dag ni srid pa spyod pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zas ni srid pa gso bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir la de dag ni srid pa spyod pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: because food sustains existence, and those states are not the cause of the experience of existence.

original: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'i khams su zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'i khams su zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This would be like the food of one who has entered the uncontaminated meditative states of the form realm.

original: de dag 'das pa'i zas kyis zas dang @238b bcas pa zhes brjod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'das pa'i zas kyis zas dang @238b bcas pa zhes brjod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not correct to say that the transcendent lords have food that is past,🔽because the past does not exist.

original: 'das pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'di la yang de thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'di la yang de thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the past does not exist, and this consequence would also apply to that.

original: de lta ba na des de dag de na gnas par 'gyur pas /
analyzed: de lta ba na des de dag de na gnas par 'gyur pas /
translated: Therefore, since they would abide in that,

original: gnas pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said that the Buddha is not the cause of their abiding.

original: nye bar ston pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar ston pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of teaching.

original: de ltar ston pa phun sum tshogs pas phrin las ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa phun sum tshogs pas phrin las ci mdzad ce na /
translated: What activity does the one who is perfect in teaching perform?

original: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed par nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed par nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said that he abides in order to bring about the attainment of all the aims of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed par nye bar gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ram don thams cad yang dag par sgrub par nye bar gnas pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed par nye bar gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ram don thams cad yang dag par sgrub par nye bar gnas pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because he abides in order to bring about the attainment of all the aims of all sentient beings, or because he abides in order to accomplish all aims.

original: zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyang sngon mngon par 'du byed pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyang sngon mngon par 'du byed pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even those who are absorbed in the concentration of peace perform the aims of sentient beings through the power of their previous volitions.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i phrin las phun sum tshogs pa'i phan thogs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i phrin las phun sum tshogs pa'i phan thogs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of the perfect activity as explained?

original: de yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, he said, “free from all harm of the stain of the afflictions.”

original: nyon mongs pa dag nyid dri ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag nyid dri ma yin no //
translated: The afflictions themselves are the stain.

original: de dag kyang gnod pa'i rgyu yin pas de med pa'i phyir de las gyur pa'i gnod pa med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang gnod pa'i rgyu yin pas de med pa'i phyir de las gyur pa'i gnod pa med do //
translated: Since they are the cause of harm, there is no harm that results from them.

original: 'o na de'i tshe ci zhig phan btags she na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe ci zhig phan btags she na /
translated: Well then, what benefit was provided at that time?

original: nyon mongs pa la gyur pa'i gnas pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid phan btags pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la gyur pa'i gnas pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid phan btags pa yin te /
translated: The very absence of the basis of the afflictions is the benefit.

original: dper na jo bos phun ma btags kyang /
analyzed: dper na jo bos phun ma btags kyang /
translated: For example, even though a master does not provide any benefit,

original: gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir bdag la jo bos phan btags so zhes tha dad 'dogs pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir bdag la jo bos phan btags so zhes tha dad 'dogs pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: because he does not cause harm, one says, “The master provided me with benefit.”

original: yang na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma las dben pa'i ye shes rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma las dben pa'i ye shes rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, one obtains the pristine wisdom that is isolated from the stain of the afflictions.

original: de ltar na gang gi gnod pa med pas phan pa mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa la phyi rol gyi 'jigs pa'i rgyu yang med pas /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi gnod pa med pas phan pa mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa la phyi rol gyi 'jigs pa'i rgyu yang med pas /
translated: Thus, since there is no harm to him, he has the perfect benefit. Since there is no external cause of fear,

original: bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa zhes 'jigs pa med pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa zhes 'jigs pa med pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: he is shown to have the perfect fearlessness, since he has completely abandoned all demons.

original: bdud thams cad ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud rnams te de dag gis de yongs su spangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud thams cad ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud rnams te de dag gis de yongs su spangs pa'am /
translated: All demons are the demons of the aggregates, afflictions, death, and the son of heaven. He has completely abandoned them,

original: gang gis de dag yongs su spangs pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis de dag yongs su spangs pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: or he has completely abandoned them by means of him.

original: de dag kyang 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: They are also causes of fear,

original: de dag thibs kyis mnan te rgyal bas na 'jigs pa med pa yin no //🔽de ltar 'jigs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas @239a * //
analyzed: de dag thibs kyis mnan te rgyal bas na 'jigs pa med pa yin no // de ltar 'jigs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas @239a * //
translated: since he has conquered them by means of his meditative concentration, he is fearless.

original: kyi khyad par ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: kyi khyad par ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: Thus, what is the special abode of the perfect fearlessness?

original: thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bkod pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bkod pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The array of the Tathagata's blessing is said to surpass all arrays.

original: 'di na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dam /🔽gzhan dag gis bkod pa gang dag yin pa de dag pas lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bkod pa yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dam / gzhan dag gis bkod pa gang dag yin pa de dag pas lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bkod pa yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Here, the array of all Bodhisattvas🔽or others is surpassed by the array of the Tathagata's blessing.🔽The words are to be connected in this way.

original: de'i byin gyi rlabs kho nas de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gnas thams cad pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs kho nas de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gnas thams cad pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir /
translated: It is said that the array of the Tathagata's blessing is superior to all other arrays because it appears in that way by the power of the Tathagata's blessing alone.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the place is due to its superiority to all other places.

original: de ltar gnas phun sum tshogs pa der bgrod par bya ba'i lam ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gnas phun sum tshogs pa der bgrod par bya ba'i lam ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the path to be traversed in that perfect place?

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtog pa chen po nges par 'byung ba yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtog pa chen po nges par 'byung ba yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The path of the great memory, understanding, and resolve is said to be the means of going.

original: 'dis nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dis nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of going is the path of going to that place.

original: dran pa la sogs pa 'di dag gis de dag nges par 'byung bas na dran pa la sogs pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa 'di dag gis de dag nges par 'byung bas na dran pa la sogs pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Since they definitely emerge through these mindfulnesses, etc., the mindfulnesses, etc. are the definite emergence.

original: de ldan pa chen po ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de ldan pa chen po ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: The great possession is the wisdom arisen from hearing,

original: thos nas don phyin ci ma log par mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos nas don phyin ci ma log par mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having heard, one expresses the meaning without error.

original: blo gros chen po ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: The great intelligence is the wisdom arisen from contemplation,

original: thos pa rigs pas nges par sems pa'i sgo nas nges par 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa rigs pas nges par sems pa'i sgo nas nges par 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one definitely obtains it through the rational ascertainment of what one has heard.

original: rtog pa chen po ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rtog pa chen po ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: The great thought is the wisdom arisen from meditation,

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one realizes reality through the power of meditation.

original: dran pa la sogs pa'i chen po nyid ni thig pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / des bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa'i chen po nyid ni thig pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / des bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of the mindfulnesses, etc. is the result of the great thought, because it arises from the objective support of the great thought, and because it is included in that.

original: de ltar lam phun sum tshogs pa nas gang la zhon te /
analyzed: de ltar lam phun sum tshogs pa nas gang la zhon te /
translated: Thus, having the perfect path,

original: lam de nas 'gro ba'i bzhon pa de dgos pas de'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: lam de nas 'gro ba'i bzhon pa de dgos pas de'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: The path is the vehicle for going on that path.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chen po bzhon pa yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chen po bzhon pa yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that “great serenity and insight are the vehicle.”

original: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Serenity is meditative concentration.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab bo //🔽de gnyis rang gi ngang gi 'ju pa ni bzhon pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab bo // de gnyis rang gi ngang gi 'ju pa ni bzhon pa ste /
translated: Insight is wisdom.

original: de gnyis de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those two are the vehicle because they are the means for going there.

original: chen po nyid ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de ltar bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa gang gis na der 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sgo dgos pas /
analyzed: chen po nyid ni snga ma bzhin no // de ltar bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa gang gis na der 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sgo dgos pas /
translated: Greatness is as before.🔽Since the door is necessary for entering there,

original: @239b de'i 'og tu sgo phun sum tshogs pa de'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: @239b de'i 'og tu sgo phun sum tshogs pa de'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: immediately after that, the perfection of the door is presented.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said that “the great door of liberation is entry into emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.”

original: sgo ni sgo mo'o //🔽rnam par thar pa ni rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: sgo ni sgo mo'o // rnam par thar pa ni rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: A door is a doorway.🔽Liberation is freedom.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the goal.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo yin te /
translated: Emptiness, etc. are the doors of liberation.

original: de la stong pa nyid ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: Emptiness is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i chos med pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i chos med pa'o //
translated: It is the non-existence of imagined phenomena.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: The samadhi that has that as its object is the door of liberation called emptiness.

original: mtshan ma ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams dang / skyes pa dang bud med dang skye ba dang / rga ba dang 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams dang / skyes pa dang bud med dang skye ba dang / rga ba dang 'chi ba ste /
translated: Signs are form, sound, smell, taste, and the tangible, and male and female, birth and death.

original: mtshan ma 'di gang la med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o /
analyzed: mtshan ma 'di gang la med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o /
translated: The absence of those signs is signlessness.

original: // de yang mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: // de yang mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that is nirvana,

original: de ni mtshan ma thams cad bsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma thams cad bsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the elimination of all signs.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin no //🔽smon pa ni smon lam ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin no // smon pa ni smon lam ste /
translated: The samadhi that has that as its object is the door of liberation called signlessness.🔽Wish is a vow,

original: don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: that is, a desire.

original: khams gsum pa sdug bsngal nyid du stan mi smon te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa sdug bsngal nyid du stan mi smon te /
translated: One does not wish for the three realms to be suffering.

original: 'di la smon pa med pas na smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la smon pa med pas na smon pa med pa'o //
translated: It is wishless because it is not associated with wishes.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa yin no //
translated: The concentration that focuses on that is the wishless gate of liberation.

original: 'di la stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo de dag gi 'jug pa yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo de dag gi 'jug pa yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “because they engage those” should be applied to each of the three gates of liberation.

original: de dag gis der 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis der 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage those.

original: chen po nyid ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de ltar sgo phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhal med khang phral bzhin du de gang la brten pa'i gzhi dgos pas de'i phyir 'og tu gzhi phun sum tshogs pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas brgyan
analyzed: chen po nyid ni snga ma bzhin no // de ltar sgo phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhal med khang phral bzhin du de gang la brten pa'i gzhi dgos pas de'i phyir 'og tu gzhi phun sum tshogs pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas brgyan
translated: The greatness is as before.

original: pa'i bkod pa la brten pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: pa'i bkod pa la brten pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the celestial mansion, which is the perfection of the gate, is like a house. Since it is necessary to explain the basis on which it is supported, therefore, below, in terms of the perfection of the basis, it is said that it is supported on a great king of jeweled lotuses adorned with immeasurable collections of good qualities.

original: dper na sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten pa'am /
analyzed: dper na sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten pa'am /
translated: For example, it is like the support of the circle of earth and so on by the circle of water and so forth.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gzhal med khang sa la brten pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gzhal med khang sa la brten pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the celestial palaces of the worldly gods are supported by the earth,

original: rin po che chen po'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas brgyan pa gang yin pa de'i bkod pa chen po 'di ni gzhag pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: rin po che chen po'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas brgyan pa gang yin pa de'i bkod pa chen po 'di ni gzhag pa'i khyad par te /
translated: so the great palace of the buddhas is supported by the great king of lotuses, which is made of great jewels and is adorned with an immeasurable collection of virtues.

original: de ni 'di'i rten yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i rten yin no //
translated: This is the special support.

original: chen po nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i bkod pa la ltos pa'i phyir te /🔽de ni rin po che chen po'i rgyu @240a * //
analyzed: chen po nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i bkod pa la ltos pa'i phyir te / de ni rin po che chen po'i rgyu @240a * //
translated: It is great because it is the support of the other arrangements.🔽It is the great king of lotuses, which is made of great jewels.

original: las byung ba'i padma'i rgyal po chen po de la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: las byung ba'i padma'i rgyal po chen po de la brten pa yin no //
translated: It is the support of the great palace of the buddhas.

original: yang na padma chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs las byung ba rnams yin la /
analyzed: yang na padma chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs las byung ba rnams yin la /
translated: Or else, the great lotuses are those that arise from the blessings of the bodhisattvas, etc.

original: de dag gi rgyal po ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyal po ste /
translated: They are the king of lotuses.

original: de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the support of the great palace of the buddhas because they arise from the roots of virtue of those who are superior to them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi rgyal po yin la de ni de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba de dag gi bdag po yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi rgyal po yin la de ni de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba de dag gi bdag po yin no //
translated: The Tathagata is the king of Dharma, and he is the lord of those who have arisen from the roots of virtue.

original: de nyid dkon pa'i phyir dang / rin po che thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rin po che chen po yin no //🔽de rin po che chen po yang yin la /
analyzed: de nyid dkon pa'i phyir dang / rin po che thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rin po che chen po yin no // de rin po che chen po yang yin la /
translated: It is a great jewel because it is rare and because it is superior to all other jewels.

original: padma'i rgyal po yang yin te /🔽de'i bkod pa chen po'o //
analyzed: padma'i rgyal po yang yin te / de'i bkod pa chen po'o //
translated: It is the king of lotuses because it is the best of all lotuses.

original: de la brten pa'i gzhal med khang na ;
analyzed: de la brten pa'i gzhal med khang na ;
translated: It is the array of that great jewel, the king of lotuses.

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
translated: The Blessed One dwells in the palace which is based on that.

original: de'i 'og tu de las gzhan pa'i ston pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de las gzhan pa'i ston pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa las brtsams nas /
translated: After that, in order to distinguish the Blessed One from other teachers and in order to generate faith in others, the excellence of the Blessed One's qualities is presented beginning with the perfection of his body.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bstan to //
translated: The excellence of his body is indicated by twenty-one of its special qualities.

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: The phrase, “he is endowed with a mind that fully comprehends,” indicates a special quality of his enlightenment.

original: 'di la 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas thugs su chud par bya ba ji snyed yod pa de snyed thugs su chud pas thugs su chud par bya ba la legs par rdzogs par ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di la 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas thugs su chud par bya ba ji snyed yod pa de snyed thugs su chud pas thugs su chud par bya ba la legs par rdzogs par ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir dang /
translated: He is endowed with a mind that fully comprehends all that is to be comprehended, because he comprehends all that is to be comprehended, whether conditioned or unconditioned, without exception, and in a perfect manner.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / snying rje yod pas thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / snying rje yod pas thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He comprehends in a manner that is both true and compassionate.

original: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa med pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa med pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: The phrase, “he is free of the two kinds of obscurations,” indicates a special quality of his absence of obscurations.

original: byis pa dang nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa sgrib pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa dang nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa sgrib pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two kinds of obscurations are those of the childish and those of the disciples.

original: de la byis pa'i kun du spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la byis pa'i kun du spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The childish are those who are afflicted by the addictions of the life-cycle.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abide in the nature of that.

original: nyon thos kyi kun du spyod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyon thos kyi kun du spyod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu nges pa nyid de /
translated: The disciples' conduct is fixed on nirvana alone,

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they turn their backs on working for the benefit of others.

original: 'di la ni kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga'o //
translated: But the Buddha has no such conduct.🔽This shows the quality of his method of training beings.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya 'dis ni 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan ston te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya 'dis ni 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan ston te /
translated: He is the one who leads to the supreme teaching that is devoid of characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos 'di mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bzhed la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos 'di mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bzhed la /
translated: He is the one who teaches that the supreme teaching is devoid of characteristics,

original: der theg pa gsum gyis sems can skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du @240b gdul ba'i thabs yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du yang ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der theg pa gsum gyis sems can skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du @240b gdul ba'i thabs yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du yang ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: because he knows the methods for training beings in accordance with their spiritual capacities through the three vehicles, and because he teaches accordingly.

original: 'di la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu 'gro bar mdzad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu 'gro bar mdzad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who leads to the supreme teaching that is devoid of characteristics.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gdul bya la so so rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /🔽thugs rje chen pos nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten la gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gdul bya la so so rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te / thugs rje chen pos nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten la gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the future.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the future.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the future.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the future.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the future.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam nyid brnyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang / phrin las mdzad pa 'dra ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las 'dra ba mdzad pa'i phyir de dag dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam nyid brnyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang / phrin las mdzad pa 'dra ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te / sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las 'dra ba mdzad pa'i phyir de dag dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
translated: This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the future.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the future.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i rtog pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i rtog pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the present.🔽This shows the special quality of the buddhas' knowledge of the past.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa las dben pa'i ye shes mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir dang / sgrub pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
