analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa las dben pa'i ye shes mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir dang / sgrub pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has actualized the intuition that is isolated from all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to the knowable, and because he has abandoned all the obstructions to the practice.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan te /
translated: The phrase endowed with the Dharma of non-regression indicates the special quality of his superiority over the heterodox,

original: de dag gis phyir bzlog mi nus pa'i phyir dang / de dag zil gyis mnan nas yang dag pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis phyir bzlog mi nus pa'i phyir dang / de dag zil gyis mnan nas yang dag pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cannot be turned back by them, and because he can teach the true path after having suppressed them.

original: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: The phrase not carried away by the domain indicates the special quality of his superiority over Mara,

original: spyod yul ni yul te /
analyzed: spyod yul ni yul te /
translated: because the domain is the object,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as form, etc.

original: yul de nyid sems 'khrul par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bar chad byed pa nyid kyis bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: yul de nyid sems 'khrul par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bar chad byed pa nyid kyis bdud ces bya'o //
translated: That very domain is called Mara because it is the cause of the confusion of the mind and because it creates obstacles to virtue.

original: bcom ldan 'das la ni yul shin tu yid du 'ong bas kyang bar chad byed par mi nus la ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ni yul shin tu yid du 'ong bas kyang bar chad byed par mi nus la ;
translated: The Bhagavat cannot be obstructed even by very pleasant objects.

original: de dag ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dag zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: de dag ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dag zil gyis gnon te /
translated: He conquers the bases of subjugation that are very complete,

original: spyod yul gyis dbrog mi nus pas spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod yul gyis dbrog mi nus pas spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and he is called “unconquerable by the sphere of activity” because the sphere of activity cannot rob him.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This statement, “the inconceivable is established,” shows the special quality of establishing the teaching of the Dharma,

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established as completely beyond the sphere of sophistry.

original: dus gsum la mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis dus lung ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: dus gsum la mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis dus lung ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par te /
translated: This statement, “he has completed equality in the three times,” shows the special quality of prophesying the three times,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus lung ston pa la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus lung ston pa la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is unimpeded in prophesying the past and future in the present time.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa @241a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa @241a * //
translated: He has a body that pervades all world-realms.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This shows the special quality of displaying the descent from the Tuṣita heaven,

original: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du cig char sprul ba'i skus khyab par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du cig char sprul ba'i skus khyab par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he pervades all the world-realms of the four continents simultaneously with his emanation body.🔽He has the knowledge that is free from doubt about all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This shows the special quality of eliminating all forms of doubt,

original: chos thams cad la the tshom ma lus par bsal ba'i ye shes brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la the tshom ma lus par bsal ba'i ye shes brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the pristine wisdom that completely eliminates all doubt about all phenomena.

original: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis theg pa thams cad kyis gdul bar bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis theg pa thams cad kyis gdul bar bya ba la /
translated: He has the mind that possesses all practices.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This shows the special quality of displaying a body that is similar to those to be trained by all vehicles,🔽because he has the mind that possesses all practices.

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su skyen pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du yang sku kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su skyen pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du yang sku kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the one who generates the conduct of all sentient beings, and likewise, because he is the one who displays the body.

original: chos mkhyen pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba'i 'dis ni shin tu rnam par nges pa'i ye shes kyis ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: chos mkhyen pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba'i 'dis ni shin tu rnam par nges pa'i ye shes kyis ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This is the special quality of his bestowing instructions in whatever way is appropriate through his perfectly ascertained intuition.

original: chos rnams la ne ma nur dang ldan pa ni ci rigs par gdams ngag sbyin mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la ne ma nur dang ldan pa ni ci rigs par gdams ngag sbyin mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is uncertain about the teachings is not able to bestow instructions in whatever way is appropriate.

original: gang zhig chos 'di thugs su chud cing de mkhyen pa la shin tu rnam par nges pa yin pa de ni gdams ngag phyin ci ma log par ston nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig chos 'di thugs su chud cing de mkhyen pa la shin tu rnam par nges pa yin pa de ni gdams ngag phyin ci ma log par ston nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: One who has realized these teachings and whose intuition with regard to them is perfectly ascertained is able to reveal the instructions without error, but not anyone else.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This is the special quality of his maintaining a body that is not discriminated.

original: sku rnam par rtog pa las ma 'khrul ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' pas 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku rnam par rtog pa las ma 'khrul ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' pas 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body is not confused about conceptualization, it is not afflicted by afflictions, karma, and birth, and so it is not analyzed by the afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas gdung rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas gdung rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This shows the special quality of the application of the unbroken lineage of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir sbyor gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir sbyor gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas apply themselves to the unbroken lineage of the buddhas, but others do not.

original: de'i phyir de dag kho na ye shes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kho na ye shes yang dag par len to //
translated: Therefore, they alone take up wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin pa'i skus bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin pa'i skus bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: This shows the special qualities of the Buddha's abode in the nondual, supreme perfection of the nature body.

original: @241b de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @241b de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of the Tathagata's Dharma Body is nondifferentiation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The Buddha's nondual abode is the Dharma Body,

original: de bzhin nyid do de mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid kyis gnyis su rnam par rtog pa kun du 'byung ba ma lus pa byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do de mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid kyis gnyis su rnam par rtog pa kun du 'byung ba ma lus pa byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: suchness. It is nondifferentiation, because it is the total removal of the occurrence of all the conceptualizations of duality.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir dang / de'i yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir dang / de'i yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme perfection of that, because it is the constant abode of the concentration which has that as its object.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: The enjoyment body of the Tathagata is the cause of the enjoyment of the great vehicle Dharma by the retinue of bodhisattvas.

original: so so'i rgyud kyi sgo nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad rnam par thar bar mdzad pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'i ye shes de'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dag tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su /
analyzed: so so'i rgyud kyi sgo nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus / de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad rnam par thar bar mdzad pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'i ye shes de'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro // sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dag tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su /
translated: The enjoyment body of the Tathagata is the cause of the enjoyment of the great vehicle Dharma by the retinue of bodhisattvas.🔽The enjoyment body of the Buddha is the wisdom that causes the enjoyment of the great vehicle Dharma by the retinue of bodhisattvas in the circles of the retinue in the pure buddhafields.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa so sor nyams su myong bar mdzad pa'i ye shes gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa so sor nyams su myong bar mdzad pa'i ye shes gang yin pa ste /
translated: The enjoyment body of the Buddha is the wisdom that causes the enjoyment of the great vehicle Dharma by the retinue of bodhisattvas in the circles of the retinue in the pure buddhafields.

original: de'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because he has perfected that, he is so called.

original: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ston te //
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ston te //
translated: The comprehension of the equality of the buddhas who are devoid of periphery and center indicates the distinctive excellence of his reality.

original: mtha' dang dbus med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
translated: He is devoid of periphery and center because he is the transcendent lord,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / yul yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / yul yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is characterized by the abandonment of the extremes of the conditioned and the unconditioned, and because he is characterized by the non-division of the objective realm.

original: mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / de la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / de la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The comprehension of equality is due to his thorough knowledge of the conditioned and the unconditioned, and also because there is no defilement in that.

original: chos kyi dbyings dam pa can zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dam pa can zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston te /
translated: The one who possesses the purity of the realm of the Dharma indicates the distinctive excellence of his attainment of the result.

original: 'di la chos kyi dam pa rnam par dag pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la chos kyi dam pa rnam par dag pa yod pa ste /
translated: He possesses the purity of the supreme Dharma here,🔽because he is the transcendent lord.

original: de ni lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of the path of cultivation.

original: yon tan rnams mi zad pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan rnams mi zad pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inexhaustibility of the qualities, he says:

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /🔽phyi ma'i mtha'i phur thug pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa / phyi ma'i mtha'i phur thug pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the basis of the benefit and happiness of all beings.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i gzhi @242a * //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i gzhi @242a * //
translated: It is the basis of the benefit and happiness of all beings because it is the basis of the benefit and happiness of self and others.

original: yin pa'i phyir yon tan mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ro //🔽ji ltar nam mkha' 'jig pa dang / chags pa dag na zad mi shes pa nyid de bzhin du 'di'i yon tan rnams gtan du mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir yon tan mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ro // ji ltar nam mkha' 'jig pa dang / chags pa dag na zad mi shes pa nyid de bzhin du 'di'i yon tan rnams gtan du mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The quality of inexhaustibility is a special quality.🔽Just as space is inexhaustible in the beginning, in the middle, and in the end, so too are the qualities of the bodhisattva inexhaustible, because they are never exhausted forever.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid par sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa dang bshad pa'i sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid par sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa dang bshad pa'i sgo nas ston te /
translated: And just as space is inexhaustible in destruction and formation, so too are the qualities of the bodhisattva inexhaustible, because they are inexhaustible for as long as cyclic existence lasts, since they benefit sentient beings.🔽The other aspects are taught by way of demonstration and explanation.

original: dang po bstan pa'i don lhag ma rnams kyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po bstan pa'i don lhag ma rnams kyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The demonstration is in the first half of the verse, and the explanation is in the second half.

original: de ltar na yon tan gyi khyad par nyi shus ni legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yin pas chos nyid legs par bshad pa yin te /🔽shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa yon tan gyi khyad par gyis ni ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi shes pa yul dang dus kyis bskal pa'i don rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa dag pa la shes pa ma 'jug pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ltar na yon tan gyi khyad par nyi shus ni legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yin pas chos nyid legs par bshad pa yin te / shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa yon tan gyi khyad par gyis ni ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi shes pa yul dang dus kyis bskal pa'i don rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa dag pa la shes pa ma 'jug pa'i phyir la /
translated: Thus, since he possesses the mind that fully comprehends these twenty distinctive qualities, he is the one who fully explains reality.🔽The distinctive quality of unobstructed knowledge of all objects of knowledge is that, unlike the knowledge of sravakas, which does not engage objects and times that are distant, nor the infinite classifications of the Buddha's Dharma,

original: la lar thogs pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa pa rnams kyi ni yul dang dus dang rnam pa tha dad pa'i dngos po mtha' yas pa thams cad la chags pa'i mi mnga' ba dang thogs pa mi mnga' bar 'jug pa'i phyir de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: la lar thogs pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa pa rnams kyi ni yul dang dus dang rnam pa tha dad pa'i dngos po mtha' yas pa thams cad la chags pa'i mi mnga' ba dang thogs pa mi mnga' bar 'jug pa'i phyir de lta ma yin te /
translated: the knowledge of the tathiigatas engages all things that are distant in terms of place, time and type without attachment or obstruction.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa dang / kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba'i phyir kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa dang / kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba'i phyir kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba yin te /
translated: Thus, because he does not have the two kinds of practice, the thorough knowledge of the nature of entities and the non-thorough knowledge of the nature of entities, he does not have the two kinds of practice.

original: des na legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des na legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who has the mind that thoroughly understands.

original: mchog tu rnam par dag pa khong du chud pa'i yon tan gyis ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyis dri ma ma lus pa las dben pa'i de bzhin nyid rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal ba'i ngo bo bdag nyid kyis rtogs nas gzhan dag la yang khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu rnam par dag pa khong du chud pa'i yon tan gyis ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyis dri ma ma lus pa las dben pa'i de bzhin nyid rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal ba'i ngo bo bdag nyid kyis rtogs nas gzhan dag la yang khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: By the virtue of understanding the supreme purity, having realized suchness, which is isolated from all stains characterized by the duality of entity and non-entity, the nature of which is the removal of all conceptualization, he causes others to understand it as well.

original: sangs rgyas mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod pa'i yon tan gyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa dag rgyun mi gcod par lhun gyis grub par 'phags pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa dag gis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod pa'i yon tan gyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa dag rgyun mi gcod par lhun gyis grub par 'phags pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa dag gis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of the uninterrupted performance of buddha activities is the spontaneous and uninterrupted performance of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: chos kyi sku la brten pa dang / dgongs pa dang phrin las khyad par mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni rnam par dag ba'i ye shes dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i dgongs pa can dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sku la brten pa dang / dgongs pa dang phrin las khyad par mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni rnam par dag ba'i ye shes dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i dgongs pa can dang /
translated: The quality of the absence of difference in the enlightened intent and activity of the buddhas is due to the fact that the suchness of all the buddhas is the same in terms of the wisdom of complete purity, and that they all have the enlightened intent to bring benefit and happiness to all sentient beings.

original: longs spyod rdzogs @242b pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa la /🔽khyad par mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs @242b pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa la /🔽khyad par mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The enlightened intent and activity of the buddhas are the same in terms of the benefit they bring to others through the two kayas of enjoyment and emanation.

original: sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan gyis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam goms pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las dben pa'i rtogs pa khong du chud ces bya ba thugs su chud pa brnyes🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan gyis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam goms pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las dben pa'i rtogs pa khong du chud ces bya ba thugs su chud pa brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of having cultivated the antidote to all obscurations, he has realized the realization of being isolated from all obscurations, that is, he has attained the realization of having cultivated the arya path, the antidote to all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience.

original: mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan gyis ni bstan pa dang thugs su chud pa'i chos gzhan dag gis phyir bzlog mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan gyis ni bstan pa dang thugs su chud pa'i chos gzhan dag gis phyir bzlog mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of being unassailable by any tirthikas, he is unassailable by others with different doctrines and realizations.

original: 'jig rten du skyes na ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan gyi rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis 'phrogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten du skyes na ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan gyi rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis 'phrogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of not being carried away by worldly things, he is not carried away by the eight worldly dharmas such as gain and loss, for he has been born in the world but is not of the world.

original: chos rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyis ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyis ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos /
translated: By the quality of establishing the Dharma, he has the Dharma of the twelve branches of excellent speech.

original: rtog ge las 'das pa phyis pa'i blos khong du chud par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rtog ge las 'das pa phyis pa'i blos khong du chud par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not to be understood by a later mind that transcends discursive thought,

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod pas rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod pas rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by expressing its own and general characteristics.

original: lung ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni dus gsum na yod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba tshe rabs brgyud pa lung ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni dus gsum na yod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba tshe rabs brgyud pa lung ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of prediction, it is the cause of the prediction of the past and future of things that exist in the three times, because it predicts the succession of lives.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sku bee d'urya la sogs pa'i mdog lta bu kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sku bee d'urya la sogs pa'i mdog lta bu kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of displaying the enjoyment and emanation bodies in all world systems, it is the cause of displaying the bodies in all world systems, such as the color of beryl, in accordance with those to be trained.

original: the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan gyis bdag la nges pa bzhin gzhan la nges pa skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan gyis bdag la nges pa bzhin gzhan la nges pa skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of resolving doubts, it is the cause of generating certainty in others, just as one has certainty in oneself.

original: spyod pa sna tshogs dag gis mdzad pa'i yon tan gyis ni gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du skal ba 'dra ba'i lus kun du ston pas 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma 'ongs pa na chos 'byung ba'i mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyis ni rdo phrag gser gyi sa bon yod pa lta bu /
analyzed: spyod pa sna tshogs dag gis mdzad pa'i yon tan gyis ni gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du skal ba 'dra ba'i lus kun du ston pas 'dzud pa'i phyir ro // ma 'ongs pa na chos 'byung ba'i mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyis ni rdo phrag gser gyi sa bon yod pa lta bu /
translated: By the quality of his deeds in various ways, he guides beings by showing them bodies similar to their fortune, just as they are to be guided.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon phra mo nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul las 'das pa yang phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon phra mo nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul las 'das pa yang phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of his knowledge of the appearance of the Dharma in the future, he knows even the smallest seeds of virtue that are beyond the scope of sravakas and so on, like a gold nugget in a rock.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar mi rtog kyang /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi mdog @243a * //
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar mi rtog kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi mdog @243a * //
translated: By the quality of showing himself according to the aspirations of beings, he is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: la sogs pa lta bu mthong ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa lta bu mthong ste /
translated: Without conceptual thought, by the power of the Tathagata's blessing and the power of the aspirations of beings, the Tathagata's body is seen as golden in color and so on.

original: mdo las ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtog par mi mdzad rnam par rtog par mi mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //🔽lus tshad med pas sems can gdul bar bya ba'i yon tan gyi sa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus tshad med pa dag gis sems can gdul ba'i phyir sbyor ba gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtog par mi mdzad rnam par rtog par mi mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o // lus tshad med pas sems can gdul bar bya ba'i yon tan gyi sa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus tshad med pa dag gis sems can gdul ba'i phyir sbyor ba gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang /
translated: As a scripture declares, The Tathagata does not conceive or discriminate.

original: sems pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi khyad par thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan btags pa dang yongs su gtad pa dag gis rgyun mi 'chad par brgyud mar byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi khyad par thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan btags pa dang yongs su gtad pa dag gis rgyun mi 'chad par brgyud mar byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The stage of good qualities to be developed by immeasurable bodies is the application of bodhisattvas to developing immeasurable bodies in order to develop sentient beings. It is the continuous transmission of the good qualities of the Dharma to bodhisattvas who have attained special intuitive wisdom through listening, reflection, and meditation on the holy Dharma by the power of the Tathagata, through the assistance and entrustment of the bodhisattvas.

original: chos kyi sku la pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid du grub pa'i yon tan gyis ni chos kyi sku gnyis su med par sangs rgyas kyi sa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mtshungs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid du grub pa'i yon tan gyis ni chos kyi sku gnyis su med par sangs rgyas kyi sa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mtshungs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the quality of the dharmakāya being established as the sameness of the perfections, the dharmakāya is nondual, because on the buddha level all the perfections such as generosity are equally established.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa mos pa ji lta bu bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni sems can gyi mos pa la ltos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa 'dres pa med par kun du ston pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa mos pa ji lta bu bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan gyis ni sems can gyi mos pa la ltos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa 'dres pa med par kun du ston pa'i phyir ro
translated: By the quality of the buddha field being shown according to one’s aspirations, the buddha field is shown to be of the nature of gold and so on, according to the aspirations of sentient beings, without mixing it up.

original: // sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum char yang yul yongs su mchad pa'i yon tan gyis ni /
analyzed: // sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum char yang yul yongs su mchad pa'i yon tan gyis ni /
translated: By the quality of the three buddha bodies being the complete purification of the object,

original: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi bdag nyid rnams sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su thams cad du yul yongs su chad pa med par mnyam pa nyid du gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi bdag nyid rnams sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su thams cad du yul yongs su chad pa med par mnyam pa nyid du gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The buddhas, whose nature is the three bodies, are free from beginning, middle, and end, and they go everywhere in the buddha-fields, without any discrimination of objects, in a state of equality.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad par nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan gyis ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad par nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan gyis ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: The quality of remaining to benefit and gladden all beings for as long as samsara lasts is the extreme purity of the dharmadhatu, which remains for as long as samsara lasts.

original: de rgyu mthun pa mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams gdul ba rnams kyi dus ji lta ba bzhin du phyis dang / de'i tshe nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyu mthun pa mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams gdul ba rnams kyi dus ji lta ba bzhin du phyis dang / de'i tshe nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The natural outcome of that is the sutras and other teachings, which remain for as long as there are disciples, and the buddhas’ activities, which remain for as long as there are disciples.

original: mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan gyis ni chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam par bkod pa'i yon tan rnams nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan gyis ni chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam par bkod pa'i yon tan rnams nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The quality of inexhaustibility is the extreme purity of the dharmadhatu, which is like space, without end.

original: chos kyi dbyings las 'khor ba ji srid par 'gro ba mtha' yas kyi don byed pa'i sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir yon tan mi zad pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las 'khor ba ji srid par 'gro ba mtha' yas kyi don byed pa'i sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir yon tan mi zad pa nyid do //
translated: The inexhaustible quality of the qualities is due to the uninterrupted application of the activity of benefiting the infinite world of beings for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: mi zad kyi yon tan des na legs par thugs su @243b chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste bar ma chad pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi zad kyi yon tan des na legs par thugs su @243b chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste bar ma chad pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The one who possesses the mind that is well trained in those inexhaustible qualities is the Bhagavat.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the perfection of the retinue,

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun thog mar smos pa ni theg pa chen po la the tshom za ba rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams kyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / 'khor na spyod pa rnams btul bas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun thog mar smos pa ni theg pa chen po la the tshom za ba rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams kyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / 'khor na spyod pa rnams btul bas /
translated: the śrāvaka saṅgha is mentioned first because it dispels the doubts of those who doubt the Mahāyāna and because it is a condition for those bodhisattvas of unfixed lineage and because it is a condition for those bodhisattvas of fixed lineage.

original: de'i sgo nas dul bar 'khor rnams dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / nyan thos rnam par dag pa rnams bdag nyid nga rgyal byed pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpas ni /🔽nyan thos rnams la gus par mi bya ba yang ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dag la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir de las gzhan pa dag kyang de la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de
analyzed: de'i sgo nas dul bar 'khor rnams dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / nyan thos rnam par dag pa rnams bdag nyid nga rgyal byed pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpas ni / nyan thos rnams la gus par mi bya ba yang ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dag la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir de las gzhan pa dag kyang de la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de
translated: Because the retinue is disciplined through his discipline, because the pure sravakas abandon pride in self, and because🔽the bodhisattvas do not disrespect the sravakas.

original: dag yon tan brjod do //
analyzed: dag yon tan brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in order to generate respect for the sravakas, the bodhisattvas praise their good qualities.

original: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it explained that the characteristics of the pure and powerful vijiiapti are the characteristics of the Buddha?

original: ji ltar na de na nyan thos rnams srid de /
analyzed: ji ltar na de na nyan thos rnams srid de /
translated: How can the sravakas exist there?

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because that is contradictory.

original: 'gal ba ci yod byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs par mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba ci yod byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs par mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: What is the contradiction? It follows that they would be seen as equal to the bodhisattvas.

original: gal te de dag gis kyang mthong ngo zhes bshad par gyur na ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis kyang mthong ngo zhes bshad par gyur na ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If they were to say, “We see it,” that would be contradictory.

original: de dag de na 'khod mod kyi 'on kyang de mthong bar 'gyur ba'i tshogs dang bral ba'i phyir long ba bzhin du 'byor pa de lta bu de mi mthong bas 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de dag de na 'khod mod kyi 'on kyang de mthong bar 'gyur ba'i tshogs dang bral ba'i phyir long ba bzhin du 'byor pa de lta bu de mi mthong bas 'gal ba med de /
translated: But even though they are present there, they do not see that wealth, like the blind do not see form, because they lack the collection of causes for seeing it.

original: gser la sogs pa la sol ba la sogs par mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa la sol ba la sogs par mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: It is like seeing gold and so on as coal and so forth.

original: rang gis gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They see it as something other than it is.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyi byin rlabs kyi sa cung zad cig mthong ngo //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyi byin rlabs kyi sa cung zad cig mthong ngo //
translated: Or else, they see it by the power of the Buddha’s blessing.

original: cang shes pa ni bslab pa rnams 'gal bar mi byed pa rnams kyis dmu rgod ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: cang shes pa ni bslab pa rnams 'gal bar mi byed pa rnams kyis dmu rgod ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are not wild, because they do not violate the trainings.

original: rta cang shes bzhin no //
analyzed: rta cang shes bzhin no //
translated: They are like well-bred horses.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gi stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gi stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: They are the Buddha’s sons, because they generate the ārya path by the power of the Tathāgata’s prophecy.

original: de'i rigs 'tsho ba pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rigs 'tsho ba pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not sons by birth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sras gsung las skyes pa chos las nges par skyes pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sras gsung las skyes pa chos las nges par skyes pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the Bhagavan’s son was born from speech and born from the Dharma.

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags las rnam par grol ba'i phyir te /🔽'dod chags la 'dod @244a * //
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags las rnam par grol ba'i phyir te / 'dod chags la 'dod @244a * //
translated: His mind is completely liberated because it is liberated from attachment to the three realms.

original: chags dang bral ba'i sems rnam par grol ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags dang bral ba'i sems rnam par grol ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “The mind liberated from attachment is the liberation of attachment.”

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir te /
translated: His wisdom is completely liberated because it is liberated from all afflicted ignorance.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas shes rab rnam par grol ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas shes rab rnam par grol ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said, “When ignorance ceases, wisdom is liberated.”

original: tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa ni yan lag drug gi tshul khrims kyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa ni yan lag drug gi tshul khrims kyis te /
translated: His ethics are completely pure because of the ethics of the six pāramitās.

original: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: 4) to view even the slightest misdeed as dangerous,🔽5) to take up the bases of training,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la yang dag par blangs te /
translated: and 6) to train in the precepts.

original: slob pa zhes mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa zhes mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba'o //
translated: As it says in the sūtras, “One who has taken up the precepts is called a trainee.”

original: rnam pa gcig tu na zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In another way, it is because one has attained uncontaminated morality.

original: chos 'dod pa rnams bde bar phrad pa ni klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir dang / spyod lam ngan pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'dod pa rnams bde bar phrad pa ni klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir dang / spyod lam ngan pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who desire the Dharma meet with happiness because they are free of the intention to find fault and because they have abandoned bad behavior.

original: thos pa mang po ni mdo sde du ma dang po dang bar dang tha mar thos shing bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa mang po ni mdo sde du ma dang po dang bar dang tha mar thos shing bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those with much learning have heard and retained many sūtras in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: thos pa kun du 'dzin pa ni de'i don kun du 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thos pa kun du 'dzin pa ni de'i don kun du 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Those who retain what they have heard retain the meaning of those sūtras.

original: thos pa'i don kun du 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i don kun du 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it holds the meaning of what is heard.

original: thos pa'i don bsam pa ni gnyis kas tshig dang / don bstan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i don bsam pa ni gnyis kas tshig dang / don bstan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of what is heard is reflected upon because both of them teach the letter and the meaning.

original: legs par bsam pa sems pa /
analyzed: legs par bsam pa sems pa /
translated: Well-reflected upon is reflection.

original: legs par smra ba brjod pa /
analyzed: legs par smra ba brjod pa /
translated: Well-spoken is speech.

original: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa ni byis pa rnams ni nyes par bsam pa sems pa nyes par smra ba brjod pa nyes par byed pa'i las byed pa dag yin na /
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa ni byis pa rnams ni nyes par bsam pa sems pa nyes par smra ba brjod pa nyes par byed pa'i las byed pa dag yin na /
translated: Well-done is action.

original: 'phags pa rnams de'i chos las 'das pas de med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams de'i chos las 'das pas de med par bshad do //
translated: The noble ones are said to be beyond that because they transcend that dharma.

original: shes rab myur ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'dul ba la myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab myur ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'dul ba la myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Swift wisdom is the swift engagement of the Tathāgata’s Dharma and Vinaya.

original: shes rab mgyogs pa ni de nyid kyi don mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab mgyogs pa ni de nyid kyi don mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Quick wisdom is the engagement of many meanings in that very Dharma and Vinaya.

original: mang po la 'gro ba ni mgyogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mang po la 'gro ba ni mgyogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Going to many is called quick.

original: shes rab rno ba ni don cha phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba ni don cha phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sharp wisdom is the engagement of subtle meanings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wisdom of definite emergence is for the sake of attaining the wisdom of definite emergence from cyclic existence.

original: nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab can ni dgongs pa mya ngan las 'das pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab can ni dgongs pa mya ngan las 'das pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who have the wisdom of definite realization have the wisdom of definite realization that is directed toward nirvana.

original: gtan la dbab par rtogs pa ni nges par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gtan la dbab par rtogs pa ni nges par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Realization of the conclusion is definite realization.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana.

original: @244b gang dag la de dgongs pa can nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab yod pa de dag la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: @244b gang dag la de dgongs pa can nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab yod pa de dag la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have the wisdom of definite realization that is directed toward that are said to be those who have the wisdom of definite realization.

original: shes rab che ba ni dris pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa la yongs su gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab che ba ni dris pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa la yongs su gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great wisdom is for the sake of the complete exhaustion of questions and answers.

original: shes rab yangs pa ni mngon par shes pa rgya chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab yangs pa ni mngon par shes pa rgya chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vast wisdom is for the sake of the complete perfection of the vast superknowledges.

original: shes rab zab pa ni gzhan dag gis gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab zab pa ni gzhan dag gis gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Deep wisdom is for the sake of the difficulty of fathoming it by others.

original: shes rab mnyam pa med pa ni nyan thos dbang po rtul po rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab mnyam pa med pa ni nyan thos dbang po rtul po rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: His wisdom is unequaled because it is superior to that of the disciples of duller faculties.

original: shes rab rin po che dang 'dra ba ni don gyi mchog thob par byed pas /
analyzed: shes rab rin po che dang 'dra ba ni don gyi mchog thob par byed pas /
translated: His wisdom is like a jewel because it obtains the highest aim,

original: rin po che dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is like a jewel.

original: rig pa gsum dang ldan pa ni mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rig pa gsum dang ldan pa ni mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: He possesses the three knowledges because he has obtained the three knowledges of the adept.

original: mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa dang /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa dang /
translated: The three knowledges of the adept are: the knowledge of the superknowledge that realizes the knowledge of recollecting former lives, the knowledge of the superknowledge that realizes the knowledge of death and rebirth, and

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the superknowledge that realizes the knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: tshig 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog thob pa ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog thob pa ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this verse, the attainment of the highest state of ease is the attainment of concentration that is not subject to degeneration.

original: zhing gshin pa bzhin du 'bras bu myur zhing mtha' bzang ba'i phyir dang / spyod lam thams cad du shes bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa nyid kyis 'drogs na /
analyzed: zhing gshin pa bzhin du 'bras bu myur zhing mtha' bzang ba'i phyir dang / spyod lam thams cad du shes bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa nyid kyis 'drogs na /
translated: Because they are like a fertile field, the result is quick and has a good end, because they abide with introspection in all their activities, and because they are not agitated by suffering.

original: bde ba'i phyir dang / bslab pa rnams la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du yon yongs su sbyangs pa chen po //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir dang / bslab pa rnams la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du yon yongs su sbyangs pa chen po //
translated: They are respectively great in purifying generosity,

original: spyod lam rab tu zhi ba phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: spyod lam rab tu zhi ba phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: they are perfect in the peacefulness of conduct,

original: bzod pa dang des pa chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bzod pa dang des pa chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: they possess great patience and gentleness,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams kyis rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams kyis rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o /
translated: and they are well engaged in the Sugata's words.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dgos pa ni /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dgos pa ni /
translated: The purpose of teaching the qualities of the bodhisattvas is

original: nyan thos tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dud par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de dag la kha cig brnyas pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / re zhig byang chub sems dpa' kho na yang de lta bur gyur pa yin na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes skad cig rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dud par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de dag la kha cig brnyas pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / re zhig byang chub sems dpa' kho na yang de lta bur gyur pa yin na / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes skad cig rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in order to prevent some from despising them and in order to generate faith in them, it is said that the bodhisattvas are superior to the disciples and solitary realizers.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' bsngags @245a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' bsngags @245a * //
translated: The praise of the bodhisattvas

original: par bya ba la che ba nyid gsum gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chen po nyid brjod de /
analyzed: par bya ba la che ba nyid gsum gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chen po nyid brjod de /
translated: The greatness of the bodhisattvas is described in terms of three greatnesses.

original: grangs phal che ba nyid kyis ni dpag tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs phal che ba nyid kyis ni dpag tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of their number is their immeasurability.

original: yon tan che ba nyid kyis gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan che ba nyid kyis gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of their qualities is indicated by such phrases as “they are fully engaged in the great stages” and so on.

original: las che ba nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: las che ba nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: By its greatness, it pacifies all the harms of all sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa las ni sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa las ni sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa yin pas so //
translated: because the bodhisattvas' stages are for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas tha dad pa nas 'dus pa smos pa ni don du mi gnyer ba dang / le lo dang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis chos nyan du nye bar mi 'gro ba de'i gnyen por byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas tha dad pa nas 'dus pa smos pa ni don du mi gnyer ba dang / le lo dang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis chos nyan du nye bar mi 'gro ba de'i gnyen por byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of the different assemblies of the Buddha is for the purpose of countering the lack of interest and laziness of those who do not go to hear the Dharma out of pride.

original: chos nyan pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid gzhan dang gzhan nas 'ongs kyi /
analyzed: chos nyan pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid gzhan dang gzhan nas 'ongs kyi /
translated: Because they are interested in hearing the Dharma, they come from other places and other realms.

original: gzhan gyi ngo mi chogs pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo mi chogs pa ni ma yin la /
translated: They do not come for the sake of others.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas thag ring po nas kyang 'ongs shing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas thag ring po nas kyang 'ongs shing /
translated: They come from far away, from other world systems.

original: mthu chen po yang yin na gzhan dag ji ltar nye bar 'gro bar mi bya bar lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam pa'o //
analyzed: mthu chen po yang yin na gzhan dag ji ltar nye bar 'gro bar mi bya bar lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam pa'o //
translated: If they have great power, what need is there to mention that they will go to hear the Dharma?

original: yon tan che ba nyid ni chen po nyid rnam pa dgus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan che ba nyid ni chen po nyid rnam pa dgus rig par bya ste /
translated: The greatness of its virtues should be understood in terms of nine greatnesses.

original: brtson 'grus chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is endowed with great effort, because it is engaged in the great objective of protecting all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: de yang theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: And that is the Great Vehicle.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa'i brtson 'grus ni de'i ched yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa'i brtson 'grus ni de'i ched yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effort of engagement is for that purpose.🔽It is endowed with a great cause, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great result, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great benefit, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.

original: rgyu chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa chen po'i chos sa bcu la sogs pa mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa chen po'i chos sa bcu la sogs pa mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with a great practice, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great objective, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great wisdom, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great accomplishment, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great result, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great benefit, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great practice, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great objective, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great wisdom, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great accomplishment, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great result, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great benefit, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is endowed with a great practice, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.

original: dmigs pa chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pas /🔽byams pa la sogs pas mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pas /🔽byams pa la sogs pas mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with a great objective, because it is the cause of the great result, the attainment of the great enlightenment.🔽It is

original: dus chen po nyid kyis ni dus thams cad la skad cig ma gcig bzhin du 'jug pas /
analyzed: dus chen po nyid kyis ni dus thams cad la skad cig ma gcig bzhin du 'jug pas /
translated: By the greatness of time, because he engages in all times as if they were a single moment.

original: bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa thams cad spags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa thams cad spags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has eliminated all conceptual thoughts of eons and non-eons.

original: 'dod pa med pa nyid chen po nyid kyis ni yongs su gzung ba thams cad btang bas bdud thams cad bcom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa nyid chen po nyid kyis ni yongs su gzung ba thams cad btang bas bdud thams cad bcom pa'i phyir te /
translated: By the greatness of being without desire, because he has conquered all demons by giving up all possessions.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe @245b yongs su gzung ba thams cad don du mi gnyer ba yin pa de'i tshe bdud kyi phyir rgol ba bcom pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe @245b yongs su gzung ba thams cad don du mi gnyer ba yin pa de'i tshe bdud kyi phyir rgol ba bcom pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Sāgaramati, when bodhisattvas have no interest in any possessions, at that time they have conquered the demons and opponents.

original: yid la byed pa chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa rgyangs bcad de spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa rgyangs bcad de spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the greatness of attention, because he has eliminated and abandoned attention to the lower vehicle.

original: nye bar ston pa chen po nyid ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde bas nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar ston pa chen po nyid ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde bas nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Greatness of teaching is because of the joy and bliss of the taste of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: yongs su dag pa chen po nyid kyis ni las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pas 'jigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir te /🔽ngan song gi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu 'chal ba'i tshul /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa chen po nyid kyis ni las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pas 'jigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir te / ngan song gi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu 'chal ba'i tshul /
translated: Greatness of purification is because of the purification of the three actions, and the transcendence of all fears.

original: khrims la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrims la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the fear of miserable states of existence and so on is the absence of morality and so on.

original: 'jigs pa lnga ni 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga ni 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
translated: The five fears are the fear of having no livelihood, the fear of disrepute, the fear of death, the fear of miserable states of existence, and the fear of being timid in the midst of the assembly.

original: de dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa thob pa kho nas med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa thob pa kho nas med par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are absent only for one who has attained the stage of pure universal responsibility.

original: rtog pa chen po nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: rtog pa chen po nyid kyis ni /
translated: Greatness of imagination is because of the imagination of the Dharma Body.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lung bstan pa'i sa thob pas bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lung bstan pa'i sa thob pas bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he has attained the stage of prophecy of omniscience, he has become one of the single vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'byung ba'i phyir bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'byung ba'i phyir bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the seven bodhisattva stages occur with manifest effort, they are not the single vehicle.

original: bgrod pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: bgrod pa ni lam mo //
translated: Vehicle means path.

original: de thob pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because he has attained that, he is of the single vehicle with other bodhisattvas.

original: gang la la dag la phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la la dag la phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “those who have the stage of nonregression of the single vehicle” is to be analyzed.

original: gang dag la 'di nas gang gis sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa gang gi rgyu rgyu mtshan can la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rab tu zhi bar byed pa mngon sum du gyur pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag la 'di nas gang gis sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa gang gi rgyu rgyu mtshan can la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rab tu zhi bar byed pa mngon sum du gyur pa yod pa'o //
translated: Those who have the pacification of all the harms of all sentient beings, which are caused by the causes and conditions of that, have the actualization of that pacification.

original: sa de ni snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po ste /
analyzed: sa de ni snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po ste /
translated: That stage is great compassion and great love.

original: de gnyis kyis gnod pa bsal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dang / dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis gnod pa bsal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dang / dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two pacify all harm, such as the removal of harm, and because they pacify the suffering of poverty, etc.

original: de gnyis kyis phal cher sems can gyi don bya ba byed pas de thob pa las chen po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis phal cher sems can gyi don bya ba byed pas de thob pa las chen po nyid yin no //
translated: Because those two perform the function of benefiting sentient beings for the most part, they are called the great.

original: yon tan kun du rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'dus so //
analyzed: yon tan kun du rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'dus so //
translated: The concentration of the perfection of all virtues is extremely collected.

original: de thob pa'i phyir @246a * //
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir @246a * //
translated: Because it attains that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is called by that name.

original: mtshan ni chos nyid kyis rab tu phye pa'i phyir byams pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan ni chos nyid kyis rab tu phye pa'i phyir byams pa bzhin no //
translated: Because the name is distinguished by intrinsic reality, like Maitreya.

original: de'i mtshan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mtshan bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of his name is

original: de ni 'khor de'i nang na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'khor de'i nang na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the chief in that assembly.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shin tu 'dus pa la bka' stsal pa de ni bshad pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shin tu 'dus pa la bka' stsal pa de ni bshad pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement to the extremely collected bodhisattvas is the basis of the teaching.

original: ci'i phyir / nyan thos rnams gnas ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / nyan thos rnams gnas ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the sravakas not the basis?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang mngon par 'dod pas chos kyi rnam pa de lta bu de la mos par byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang mngon par 'dod pas chos kyi rnam pa de lta bu de la mos par byed /
translated: Bodhisattvas aspire to the state of omniscience and so they aspire to that kind of Dharma.

original: 'jug par byed /
analyzed: 'jug par byed /
translated: They engage in it

original: nan tan du byed cing nan tan gyis kyang bsgrub bar bya ba yang byed kyi nyan thos ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skal ba med pa'i phyir mos su zin kyang nan tan gyis bsgrub mi nus so //
analyzed: nan tan du byed cing nan tan gyis kyang bsgrub bar bya ba yang byed kyi nyan thos ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skal ba med pa'i phyir mos su zin kyang nan tan gyis bsgrub mi nus so //
translated: and they practice it and they also practice what they have accomplished. But because sravakas lack the good fortune for omniscience, even if they aspire to it, they cannot accomplish it through practice.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir de bzhin du bshad pa'i gnas su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir de bzhin du bshad pa'i gnas su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, why is it explained in that way?

original: 'khor de'i nang du che ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khor de'i nang du che ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it expresses greatness in that retinue,

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it was explained above.

original: yang na der ming de zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad pa yin pas 'gal ba med do /
analyzed: yang na der ming de zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad pa yin pas 'gal ba med do /
translated: Or it is explained from the perspective of bodhisattvas called by that name.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni grangs dang ming dang bsdus pa dang rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni grangs dang ming dang bsdus pa dang rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The stage of the Buddha is established by four kinds of analysis: of number, name, summary, and detailed divisions.

original: rang gi ngo bo bstan pa kho nas grangs kyi bye brag nges par zin mod kyi /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bstan pa kho nas grangs kyi bye brag nges par zin mod kyi /
translated: The specific number is already determined by the mere indication of its own nature.

original: yang smos pa ni nyung ngu dang mang pos ma yin gyi lnga kho nas so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang smos pa ni nyung ngu dang mang pos ma yin gyi lnga kho nas so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is mentioned again in order to show that there are exactly five stages, not fewer or more.

original: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
translated: Dharma means that which holds its own characteristic.

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin ba sdug pa skyed pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin ba sdug pa skyed pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not mean that which produces a pleasant fruition.

original: sangs rgyas ni don dam pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dang rnam pa gsum ste de dag ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni don dam pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dang rnam pa gsum ste de dag ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Buddha has three aspects: the absolute, the enjoyment, and the emanation bodies, which will be explained below.

original: de dag gi sa ni bgrod pa'i yul te /
analyzed: de dag gi sa ni bgrod pa'i yul te /
translated: Their stage is the domain of progress.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang / 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa mi dbye bar chos thams cad de dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang / 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa mi dbye bar chos thams cad de dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all dharmas are the objects of those, without distinguishing their own-being and result.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsdus pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsdus pa zhes bshad de /
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be included,

original: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established in its own nature.

original: gcig tu bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The single activity is included by its own characteristic.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bo dag ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bo dag ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus te /
translated: In this regard, the four foundations of mindfulness are included in the knowledge of discernment,

original: lus la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang dag par sbong ba bzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir la @246b brtson 'grus rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyis yongs su bsdus /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro // yang dag par sbong ba bzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir la @246b brtson 'grus rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyis yongs su bsdus /
translated: because of the discernment of the body, etc.🔽The four right efforts are included in the knowledge of fundamental thought, because they are by nature vigor, and the Tathagatas have vigor in their wisdom.

original: dor ba med cing gzhag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: dor ba med cing gzhag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The four bases of psychic power are included in the knowledge of sameness, because they are by nature meditative concentration, and the Tathagatas have meditative concentration in their sameness.🔽The five faculties and the five powers are included in the knowledge of the knowledge of paths, because they are by nature faith, etc., and the Tathagatas have faith in their knowledge of paths.🔽The seven factors of enlightenment are included in the knowledge of the accomplishment of the goal, because they are by nature mindfulness, etc., and the Tathagatas have mindfulness, etc., in their accomplishment of the goal.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus te /
translated: The four immeasurables and the four bases of supernatural powers are subsumed by individually discerning transcendent wisdom because they are by nature concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyi gnas yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyi gnas yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentrations and so on are the basis of transcendent wisdom because it is said, They are the basis of the doors of concentration.

original: gzhan gang dag bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dag ma gtogs pa mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dag ma gtogs pa mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
