translated: The other superknowledges except for the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants and the superknowledge of supernatural power are subsumed by the individually discerning transcendent wisdom because they are by nature wisdom.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas mkhyen pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / lam mkhyen pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas mkhyen pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / lam mkhyen pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four correct knowledges, the six supernatural knowledges, the great compassion, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of all aspects, and the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants are all included in the knowledge of achieved tasks.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dag ma gtogs pa rnams kyang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dag ma gtogs pa rnams kyang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so // rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The knowledge of extinction of the contaminants and the power of the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants are included in the four knowledges, except for the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The supernatural knowledge of the knowledge of extinction of the contaminants and the power of the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants are included in the four knowledges, except for the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la brjod par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la brjod par 'dod na ni /
translated: If it is said that the knowledge of extinction of the contaminants and the power of the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants are expressed in the continuum of one who has extinguished the contaminants,

original: 'di la zag pa rnams zad pa yod pas zhes bya ba yin pas ye shes bzhi char gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'di la zag pa rnams zad pa yod pas zhes bya ba yin pas ye shes bzhi char gyis bsdus so //
translated: then they are included in the four knowledges, because it is said, In this one, the contaminants are extinguished.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhe na ni /
translated: If it is said that nirvana is the knowledge of extinction of the contaminants and the power of the knowledge of extinction of the contaminants,

original: zag pa rnams zad pa yin pas /
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pa yin pas /
translated: then they are included in the four knowledges, because the contaminants are extinguished.

original: me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The mirror-­like wisdom and the wisdom of equality are included in this.🔽

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs ni ye shes bzhi char gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs ni ye shes bzhi char gyis bsdus so //
translated: The power of knowledge regarding the paths that lead to all destinies is included in all four knowledges.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po dang shes rab kyi stobs ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po dang shes rab kyi stobs ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The faculty of wisdom and the power of wisdom are included in mirror-like knowledge and the knowledge of equality.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment and the limbs of the path are included in the knowledge of equality.

original: shes pa bcu po sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang zag pa med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bsdus so //🔽bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni me long lta bu'i @247a * //
analyzed: shes pa bcu po sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang zag pa med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bsdus so // bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni me long lta bu'i @247a * //
translated: The ten knowledges, such as the knowledge of suffering, and the uncontaminated knowledges are included in mirror-like knowledge and the knowledge of equality.

original: ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The nature of being unforgetful is included in mirror-like knowledge.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The abandonment of all the connections of residual impressions is included in the pure dharmadhatu and mirror wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zag pa med pa rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zag pa med pa rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The uncontaminated perfections are also included in the pure dharmadhatu and mirror wisdom.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni ye shes tha ma gnyis kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni ye shes tha ma gnyis kyis bsdus so //
translated: Those that are contaminated are included in the last two wisdoms.

original: mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The major and minor marks are included in the wisdom that is the accomplishment of the task.

original: ye shes rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs smos pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs smos pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Since the collection of mind and mental factors is illustrated by the wisdoms, the other qualities of buddhahood should be applied to them.

original: chos lnga po dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / de'i rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos lnga po dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / de'i rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The five topics are presented from the point of view of cause, result, and their divisions.

original: de las rgyu ni 'phags pa'i chos skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las rgyu ni 'phags pa'i chos skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The cause is the pure dharmadhatu, because it is the reason for the arising of the noble dharmas.

original: 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The result is the noble wisdom,🔽because it arises by observing that and because it is based on that.🔽Its classification is fourfold.

original: de la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir dang / de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir dang / de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And those are established by way of their occurrence.🔽The cause is the pure dharmadhatu, because it is the reason for the arising of the noble dharmas.🔽The result is the noble wisdom,🔽because it arises by observing that and because it is based on that.🔽Its classification is fourfold.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: And those are established by way of their occurrence.🔽The cause is the pure dharmadhatu, because it is the reason for the arising of the noble dharmas.🔽The result is the noble wisdom,🔽because it arises by observing that and because it is based on that.🔽Its classification is fourfold.

original: de dag kyang ji ltar 'byung ba'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar 'byung ba'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: And those are established by way of their occurrence.🔽The cause is the pure dharmadhatu, because it is the reason for the arising of the noble dharmas.🔽The result is the noble wisdom,🔽because it arises by observing that and because it is based on that.

original: chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pas thos pa ma lus par 'dzin pa dang / sems can thams cad la bdag dang / gzhan mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos rab tu ston pa'i thabs dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pas thos pa ma lus par 'dzin pa dang / sems can thams cad la bdag dang / gzhan mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos rab tu ston pa'i thabs dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Its classification is fourfold.🔽And those are established by way of their occurrence.🔽The cause is the pure dharmadhatu, because it is the reason for the arising of the noble dharmas.🔽The result is the noble wisdom,

original: rnam pa gcig tu na de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: because it arises by observing that and because it is based on that.🔽Its classification is fourfold.🔽And those are established by way of their occurrence.🔽The cause is the pure dharmadhatu, because it is the reason for the arising of the noble dharmas.🔽The result is the noble wisdom,🔽because it arises by observing that and because it is based on that.🔽Its classification is fourfold.🔽And those are established by way of their occurrence.🔽The cause is the pure dharmadhatu, because it is the reason for the arising of the noble dharmas.🔽The result is the noble wisdom,🔽because

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mchog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mchog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The essence of the Tathagata is the characteristic of the purity of thusness and the characteristic of the supreme intuition that focuses on it and is non-conceptual.

original: rgyu ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mchog tu gyur pa tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mchog tu gyur pa tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba yin no //
translated: The cause is the supreme intuition of equality toward all sentient beings, which is extended infinitely.

original: 'bras bu ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The result is the benefit of others.

original: de yang sems can skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa la so sor rtog pa dang de dang mthun pa'i bya ba sgrub bo //
analyzed: de yang sems can skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa la so sor rtog pa dang de dang mthun pa'i bya ba sgrub bo //
translated: Moreover, it is the discernment of those sentient beings who have good fortune and those who do not, and the accomplishment of the activity that is consistent with that.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas rim par byas pas /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas rim par byas pas /
translated: In another way, the Buddha is threefold, in terms of the arrangement of all the Buddhas, in order:

original: rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: the Buddha as essence, as perfect enjoyment, and as creation of manifestations.

original: gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: These are two, two, and one, respectively.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye @247b shes de ni /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye @247b shes de ni /
translated: The gnosis of equality🔽

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: That knowledge of sameness is the objective support of mirrorlike knowledge, because it is the transformation of the afflicted mind.🔽However, it is included in the body of enjoyment alone, while mirrorlike knowledge is included in the Dharma body by reason of its immutability.

original: 'on kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku kho nas bsdus pa yin la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi g-yo ba nyid kyis chos kyi sku bsdus pa de'i phyir mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku kho nas bsdus pa yin la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi g-yo ba nyid kyis chos kyi sku bsdus pa de'i phyir mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of sameness and the knowledge of individual realization are the causes of the body of enjoyment.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi sa ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi sa ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The stage of buddhahood is the state of the result.

original: 'bras bu de yang ye shes dang spangs pa'i bdag nyid do //🔽spangs pa de yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang ye shes dang spangs pa'i bdag nyid do // spangs pa de yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: That result is the nature of knowledge and abandonment.🔽That abandonment is the pure realm of the Dharma.

original: de yang sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the pure realm of the Dharma because all obscurations are abandoned.

original: ye shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is of four kinds: mirrorlike knowledge and so forth.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag ma lus par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag ma lus par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all the qualities of buddhahood are set forth in this,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni 'di snyed cig kho nar zad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni 'di snyed cig kho nar zad de /
translated: there are just this many levels of buddhahood.

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin de la chos kyi rnam grangs mtha' dag thos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pas ma lus pa bsgoms pa rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin de la chos kyi rnam grangs mtha' dag thos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pas ma lus pa bsgoms pa rgyur gyur pa /
translated: As explained above, the cause is the ripening of the habitual tendencies acquired from listening to the entire Dharma and the cultivation of those habitual tendencies without exception.

original: rtag tu sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nyid bskyed par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gzhal du med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rtag tu sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nyid bskyed par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gzhal du med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The result is the constant presence of the bodhisattvas' concentration and powers of retention, which are associated with immeasurable accumulations of merit and wisdom and which are the means for bringing about the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las dben pa chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i chos thams cad nye bar bskyed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las dben pa chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i chos thams cad nye bar bskyed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The ultimate result is the dharmadhatu, which is free of all the obscurations of the knowable and of negative emotions and is the suchness of all phenomena, the unmistaken nature that gives rise to all the noble qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of all the transcendent ones.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las dben pa /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las dben pa /
translated: Mirrorlike wisdom is free from the concepts of “I” and “mine” and of object and subject.

original: dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa /
translated: It is not limited to a specific object or aspect.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang / rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag dang bral ba mi g-yo ba ye shes ma lus pa'i gnas dmigs pa ma lus pa bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba shes bya dang / rnam pa tha dad par ma zhugs pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang / rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag dang bral ba mi g-yo ba ye shes ma lus pa'i gnas dmigs pa ma lus pa bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba shes bya dang / rnam pa tha dad par ma zhugs pa /
translated: It is unwavering, free from all the stains of afflictions and concepts, the basis of all wisdom, and never forgets any object of knowledge.

original: shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan shes pa thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa /
analyzed: shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan shes pa thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa /
translated: It is the cause for the arising of the reflections of all objects of knowledge and the basis for all wisdom.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the essence of the transformation of the abode of concepts and focuses on suchness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi @248a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi @248a * //
translated: Wisdom of equality

original: ye shes ni byang chub sems dpas mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na /🔽bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes thob pa de la dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid gong nas gong dus bsgom pa khyad par zhugs pa dang ldan pas byams pa dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyis la mi gnas pa'i mya
analyzed: ye shes ni byang chub sems dpas mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na / bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes thob pa de la dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid gong nas gong dus bsgom pa khyad par zhugs pa dang ldan pas byams pa dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyis la mi gnas pa'i mya
translated: Gnosis is the object of the bodhisattva's realization at the time of direct realization.

original: ngan las 'das par zhugs pa /
analyzed: ngan las 'das par zhugs pa /
translated: The bodhisattva attains the gnosis of the equality of self and others, and by cultivating that gnosis more and more, he attains great love and compassion and enters the nonabiding nirvana of the Buddha.

original: gzugs dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i thabs su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i thabs su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is posited as the method that displays the body that manifests various forms and colors.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo de nyid kyi phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes dang bye brag yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo de nyid kyi phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes dang bye brag yod do //
translated: It is distinguished from mirrorlike gnosis because it is the nature of the transformation of the afflicted mind.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gzungs dang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gzungs dang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas /
translated: Discerning gnosis is the source of all dhāraṇīs, meditative stabilizations, samādhis, and absorptions.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad la thogs pa med par 'jug pa /
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad la thogs pa med par 'jug pa /
translated: It is the cause for the teaching of the Dharma that cuts through all doubts, since it penetrates without obstruction all aspects of knowable things.

original: sku bee d'urya lta bu la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i thabs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sku bee d'urya lta bu la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i thabs su gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the means for displaying the body that is like beryl, and so forth.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i rgyu'i chos rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i rgyu'i chos rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: It is the cause for the teaching of the Dharma that cuts through all doubts.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul bya'i sems can ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul bya'i sems can ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Accomplishing activity wisdom is the foremost of all that benefits others through the infinite and inconceivable variety of means in order to ripen sentient beings to be trained in all the world systems.

original: thabs sna tshogs dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag gis gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la gcig tu gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thabs sna tshogs dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag gis gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la gcig tu gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the foremost of all that benefits others through the infinite and inconceivable variety of means in order to ripen sentient beings to be trained in all the world systems.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas chos kyi dbyings rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i rab tu dbye ba brgal ba dang / lan du bcas pa ni gal te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas chos kyi dbyings rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i rab tu dbye ba brgal ba dang / lan du bcas pa ni gal te /
translated: In terms of the characteristic of the pure dharmadhatu, the differentiation of the ascertainment of the dharmadhatu is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin la chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin la chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is the nature of the dharma-dhātu, and the dharma-dhātu is the Tathagata himself.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: This is the universal characteristic of all dharmas.

original: de chos thams cad ni tha dad na de dang ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings ji ltar sna tshogs su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de chos thams cad ni tha dad na de dang ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings ji ltar sna tshogs su mi 'gyur /
translated: If all dharmas are different, how can the dharma-dhātu which possesses them not be various?

original: sna tshogs yin na ni ji ltar yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs yin na ni ji ltar yongs su dag ste /
translated: If it is various, how can it be completely pure?

original: shel sna tshogs nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir sna tshogs ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brgal ba yin no //
analyzed: shel sna tshogs nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir sna tshogs ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brgal ba yin no //
translated: It is not that it is not various because it is connected with the various things which are placed near it, such as crystal. This is the objection.

original: de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dpe dang po ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dpe dang po ste /
translated: The first example of space is in order to avoid that.

original: gzugs su gyur pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa thams cad la kun nas yod kyang des brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs su gyur pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa thams cad la kun nas yod kyang des brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Although it is omnipresent in all the aspects of the various things which have form, it is not expressible by them.

original: sna tshogs ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i tha dad pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i tha dad pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Various means different through the distinction of homogeneous and heterogeneous.

original: rnam pa ni 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is similar in aspect.

original: blo la rang gi ngo @248b bo lta bu 'god par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo la rang gi ngo @248b bo lta bu 'god par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is as if it were the very nature of the cognition.

original: gzugs su gyur pa ni gzugs kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs su gyur pa ni gzugs kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The form aspect is the form mode.

original: gyur pa dang tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa'i don dag yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa dang tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa'i don dag yin no //
translated: The terms mode, manner, etc., all have the sense of aspect.

original: kun na yod pa ni lus dang ldan pa thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun na yod pa ni lus dang ldan pa thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is omnipresent because it pervades all embodied beings.

original: des brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzugs su gyur pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa des brjod par bya ba ste /🔽brjod par 'os pa'am /
analyzed: des brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzugs su gyur pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa des brjod par bya ba ste / brjod par 'os pa'am /
translated: It is inexpressible by that, i.e., by the various modes of the form aspect.🔽It is not fit to be expressed,

original: brjod par nus pa'am /
analyzed: brjod par nus pa'am /
translated: or it is not able to be expressed,

original: brnyes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brnyes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: or it is not to be attained.

original: des shes bya ba'i gsum pa ni rgyu'am de lta bu'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: des shes bya ba'i gsum pa ni rgyu'am de lta bu'i dngos po ste /
translated: The third case, the genitive, is the cause or such a thing.

original: gzugs sna tshogs ni nam mkha' sna tshogs su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs ni nam mkha' sna tshogs su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ma yin la /
translated: The various forms are not the reason for the designation of the various forms of space.

original: des de sna tshogs su mtshon pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des de sna tshogs su mtshon pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it indicate those various forms.

original: de ni de lta bu'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not of that nature.

original: 'on te nam mkha' sna tshogs su snang ngo zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa mthong bas sna tshogs su 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha' sna tshogs su snang ngo zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa mthong bas sna tshogs su 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that it is diverse because you see the designation “the sky appears as diverse,”

original: dbyug pa la sogs pa bzhin du tha snyad btags pa bzhin du 'gyur gyi dngos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyug pa la sogs pa bzhin du tha snyad btags pa bzhin du 'gyur gyi dngos ni ma yin no //
translated: it would be like a stick, etc., and would be a designation, not a real entity.

original: tha snyad btags pa tsam gyis ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad btags pa tsam gyis ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not so, just because of a mere designation.

original: ji lta zhe na de ni kun na yod pa yin yang sna tshogs ma yin te ro gcig go //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de ni kun na yod pa yin yang sna tshogs ma yin te ro gcig go //
translated: How is that? Although it exists everywhere, it is not diverse, but is of one taste.

original: gzugs sna tshogs su 'brel pas kyang sna tshogs su mi 'gyur la /🔽rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs su 'brel pas kyang sna tshogs su mi 'gyur la / rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: It is not diverse because of its connection with diverse forms.🔽It does not abandon its own nature,

original: ngo bo nyid gcig pa yang mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig pa yang mi 'dor ro //
translated: its own essence.

original: ro ni snying po dang ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: ro ni snying po dang ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Taste is the essence, the intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not a different characteristic, that is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' dngos po yin yang rung ma yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' dngos po yin yang rung ma yin yang rung ste /
translated: Even though space is a thing, or even though it is not a thing,

original: lus can thams cad dang yang ldan lus can gyis tha dad par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: lus can thams cad dang yang ldan lus can gyis tha dad par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: it is associated with all embodied beings, and embodied beings are not differentiated.

original: de tha snyad du gdags par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: de tha snyad du gdags par yang mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be designated conventionally.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa yod du zin kyang de kho na tsam du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa yod du zin kyang de kho na tsam du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if it is designated conventionally, it is only a mere designation.

original: 'di rang gi ngo bo 'dor zhing ngo bo gzhan nye bar len pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rang gi ngo bo 'dor zhing ngo bo gzhan nye bar len pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not abandon its own nature and take on another nature.

original: ji skad du nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: ji skad du nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes brjod mod kyi /
translated: As it is said, “Space is said to be space,

original: nam mkha' ni brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but space is not something that can be said.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces brjod mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, emptiness is said to be emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: but emptiness is not something that can be said.”

original: de la shes bya sna tshogs kyi rnam pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings shel bzhin du sna tshogs su 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de la shes bya sna tshogs kyi rnam pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings shel bzhin du sna tshogs su 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that the dharmadhātu is various like a crystal, because it is related to the aspects of various objects of knowledge.

original: nam mkha' sna tshogs ma yin @249a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' sna tshogs ma yin @249a * //
translated: Space is not various,

original: ba la yang gzugs sna tshogs dang 'brel ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba la yang gzugs sna tshogs dang 'brel ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but it is seen to be related to various forms.

original: ji ste nam mkha' yang du ba dang / khug rna dang sprin la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir sna tshogs kho nar snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste nam mkha' yang du ba dang / khug rna dang sprin la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir sna tshogs kho nar snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that space appears to be various because it is related to smoke, fog, clouds, and so on,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is also unacceptable.

original: rang gi rtog pa'i dbang gis du ba dang / khug rna la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de nyid sna tshogs yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa'i dbang gis du ba dang / khug rna la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de nyid sna tshogs yin gyi /
translated: What appears as smoke, fog, and so on, through the power of one’s conception, is just various;

original: nam mkha' ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma yin te /
translated: space is not,

original: de ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear.

original: de bzhin du rang gi rtog pas sgro btags pa'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de nyid sna tshogs yin gyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi rtog pas sgro btags pa'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de nyid sna tshogs yin gyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the appearance of form and so on is due to the power of one's own conceptual overlay, and that is the variety, but it is not the pure dharmadhatu.

original: chos kyi dbyings sna tshogs ma yin zhing brjod par bya ba ma yin yang de'i yul can gyi chos ston pa sna tshogs kyang 'jug la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings sna tshogs ma yin zhing brjod par bya ba ma yin yang de'i yul can gyi chos ston pa sna tshogs kyang 'jug la /
translated: Although the dharmadhatu is not a variety and is not an object of expression, the various teachings that are its objects do occur.

original: de sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs nyid du yang thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs nyid du yang thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And because they are a variety, it does not follow that the dharmadhatu itself is a variety.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod pa ni btags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod pa ni btags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an object of expression, and because expression is the domain of imputation.

original: de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i chos don med pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i chos don med pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And because it is the reason for realizing that, it does not follow that the teachings are meaningless.

original: spring yig gi yi ge mthong nas rgyu des don go ba bzhin no //
analyzed: spring yig gi yi ge mthong nas rgyu des don go ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like seeing the letters of a letter and understanding the meaning through that cause.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i rgyu mthun pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i don brjod pas brjod par mdzad pa gang yin pa 'di ni nam mkha' la ri mo sna tshogs 'dri ba bzhin ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i rgyu mthun pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i don brjod pas brjod par mdzad pa gang yin pa 'di ni nam mkha' la ri mo sna tshogs 'dri ba bzhin ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: The Tathagatas' great compassion is the cause of this, and it is expressed by expressions that express inexpressible meanings. This is as amazing as drawing various pictures in the sky.

original: ji skad du blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad du blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste /
translated: As it is said in the Sagaramatiparipriccha-sutra:🔽Sagaramati, it is like this.

original: dper na skyes bu la la zhig nam mkha' gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la la zhig nam mkha' gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
translated: Some people draw pictures in the sky, which is formless, invisible,

original: thogs pa med pa rnam par rig par mi byed pa 'di la tshon sna tshogs kyis ri mo 'bri bar byed pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnam par rig par mi byed pa 'di la tshon sna tshogs kyis ri mo 'bri bar byed pa /
translated: unobstructed, and non-apprehending, using various colors.

original: de bas kyang blo gros rgya mtsho /
analyzed: de bas kyang blo gros rgya mtsho /
translated: Sagaramati,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can gzhan rnams dang gang zag gzhan rnams la brjod pas rnam par rig par mdzad pa ni ches dka' ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can gzhan rnams dang gang zag gzhan rnams la brjod pas rnam par rig par mdzad pa ni ches dka' ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: the Bhagavan Buddhas, having fully awakened to the inexpressible Dharma, make it known to other sentient beings and other individuals through expressions. This is an even greater challenge.

original: pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: as it is said.

original: shel kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yang yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir dper mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shel kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yang yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir dper mi rung ngo //
translated: But a crystal is not a suitable example, because it is the nature of the dharmadhatu and is completely pure.

original: gtan tshigs kyang gnyis ka 'am gang yang rung ba la ma grub bo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang gnyis ka 'am gang yang rung ba la ma grub bo //
translated: And the reason is not established for both parties or for either party.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa shes bya thams cad la yod pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa shes bya thams cad la yod pa nyid yin no /
translated: If the completely pure dharmadhatu exists in all objects of knowledge,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma @249b dang 'brel pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par ma dag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma @249b dang 'brel pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par ma dag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: how can it not be impure, since it is connected with the stains of defilement such as passion?

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni brgal ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni brgal ba'o //
translated: Like the other mind and mental factors. This is the objection.

original: de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dpe gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dpe gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second example of space is in order to completely avoid that.

original: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is like this, for example, space, etc.

original: tha mi dad par zhugs pa zhes bya ba tha mi dad pa ni so so ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad par zhugs pa zhes bya ba tha mi dad pa ni so so ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is said to be nondifferent, i.e., not separate, from the dharmadhatu.

original: de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid de tha dad pa ltar ni de nyid dang gzhan dag du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid de tha dad pa ltar ni de nyid dang gzhan dag du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is included in that, but it is not to be described as either the same or different.

original: tha mi dad par gyur na ni lus can nyid dang mi rtog pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par gyur na ni lus can nyid dang mi rtog pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not different, it would follow that it would have a body and would not be nonconceptual.

original: dper na nam mkha' gzugs can thams cad na yod kyang gzugs kyi nyes pa rnams kyis ma gos te gzugs kyi nyes pa ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu ste sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' gzugs can thams cad na yod kyang gzugs kyi nyes pa rnams kyis ma gos te gzugs kyi nyes pa ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu ste sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs yin no //
translated: For example, space exists in all physical things, but it is not affected by the faults of physical things. The faults of physical things are the causes of the practice of attachment and aversion, which are various such as blue.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sprin dang khug rna dang gzugs nag nog du 'dug pa la sogs pa ni yongs su ma dag pa nyid kyis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba rnam par dag pa skye ba'i bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sprin dang khug rna dang gzugs nag nog du 'dug pa la sogs pa ni yongs su ma dag pa nyid kyis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba rnam par dag pa skye ba'i bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa yin no //
translated: In one way, clouds, fog, and dark forms, etc. are faults because they are to be avoided due to their impurity and because they obstruct the arising of pure vision.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gzhan la grags pa'i ngor shes pa la yod pa shes bya la sgro gdags te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gzhan la grags pa'i ngor shes pa la yod pa shes bya la sgro gdags te /
translated: In one sense, in terms of what is acknowledged by others, consciousness is imputed to exist in objects of knowledge.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir des kyang mi gos pa ltar chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir des kyang mi gos pa ltar chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as that does not sully the completely pure dharmadhatu because it is pure by nature, the completely pure dharmadhatu is also like that.

original: sems can thams cad dang sems mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pas tha mi dad par zhugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su grub pa rnam par dag pa rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing rang bzhin yongs su dag pa ci 'dra
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang sems mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pas tha mi dad par zhugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su grub pa rnam par dag pa rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing rang bzhin yongs su dag pa ci 'dra
translated: The phrase “it is engaged in being undifferentiated because it is completely accomplished as the sameness of mind with all sentient beings” means that the completely accomplished, pure mind is always naturally luminous and naturally completely pure.

original: ba sems can thams cad kyi sems par gyur pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: ba sems can thams cad kyi sems par gyur pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The minds of all sentient beings are also naturally completely pure in the same way.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin de ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin de ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The nature of mind is suchness.

original: des de dag mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: des de dag mnyam pa yin te /
translated: They are the same because of that.

original: ji skad du 'di gang gis mnyam zhi na /
analyzed: ji skad du 'di gang gis mnyam zhi na /
translated: As for the question of what they are the same in,

original: stong pa nyid du mnyam pas 'di mnyam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mnyam pas 'di mnyam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is equal because of equality with emptiness.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin yang sems kyi chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin yang sems kyi chos nyid yin te /
translated: The nature of mind is the reality of mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i chos nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir sems mnyam pa nyid ces ngo bo'i skyon du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i chos nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir sems mnyam pa nyid ces ngo bo'i skyon du byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach its reality, the word equality is used as a synonym.

original: de'i gyur pa ni yongs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gyur pa ni yongs su gyur pa ste /
translated: Its transformation is its complete transformation.

original: yongs su dag pa yin no //🔽de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa yin no // de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: It is complete purity.🔽It is naturally completely pure.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin mod kyi /
translated: It is naturally completely pure.

original: @250a * // de'i tshe glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: @250a * // de'i tshe glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: But at that time, it is posited as being free from adventitious contaminants.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sems mnyam pa kho na yongs su grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sems mnyam pa kho na yongs su grub pa yin te /
translated: In one sense, the equality of mind is the perfected,

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the perfected nature.

original: gsum pa ni de lta bu'i ngo bor yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni de lta bu'i ngo bor yin te /
translated: The third is its suchness,

original: sems can thams cad dang sems mnyam pa nyid kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bur 'di sems can thams cad kyi sems dag la tha mi dad par mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang sems mnyam pa nyid kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bur 'di sems can thams cad kyi sems dag la tha mi dad par mtshon par byed do //
translated: It is the nature of the mind of all sentient beings, which is the perfected nature, the equality of all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na ngo bor yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na ngo bor yin te /
translated: In another way, it is the essence,

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du sems can thams cad kyi sems dag la ngo bo tha mi dad par 'jug par mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du sems can thams cad kyi sems dag la ngo bo tha mi dad par 'jug par mtshon par byed de /
translated: because it is the perfected nature, which is the essence of the mind of all sentient beings.🔽It is not different, because it is not to be expressed as different.

original: tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par bya ba nyid kyis sems can gyi nyes pa rnams kyis kyang mi gos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par bya ba nyid kyis sems can gyi nyes pa rnams kyis kyang mi gos te /
translated: It is not defiled by the faults of sentient beings,

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pure by nature.

original: nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: Faults are desire, etc.

original: sems la skyon chags par byed pa'i phyir dang / dri ma can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la skyon chags par byed pa'i phyir dang / dri ma can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called faults because they defile the mind and make it impure.

original: de dag kyang rtog pa'i dbang gis byung bas /
analyzed: de dag kyang rtog pa'i dbang gis byung bas /
translated: Since they arise through the power of conceptualization,

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir glo bur ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir glo bur ba dag yin no //
translated: they are adventitious, because they are not its nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag spang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are to be abandoned,

original: rang bzhin ni spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the intrinsic nature cannot be abandoned.

original: de nyid las dgongs te chos nyid kyi sems la sems kyi sgrar btags nas /
analyzed: de nyid las dgongs te chos nyid kyi sems la sems kyi sgrar btags nas /
translated: With that very intention, the intrinsic nature of mind is designated as mind in the statement:

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: “This is the intrinsic luminosity of mind.”

original: chos nyid kyi sems ma gtogs par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sems ma gtogs par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no mind that is intrinsically luminous apart from the intrinsic nature of mind.

original: 'o na ji ltar sems can dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sems can dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, how can there be desire, etc., in sentient beings?

original: rang gi rtog pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the power of their own conceptualization.

original: de yang phyin ci log ma spangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log ma spangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: And that is because they have not abandoned error.

original: de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: And that is due to the power of ignorance.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag kyang mig rnam par dag pa rnams la rab rib la sogs pa'i gnod pas rnam par ma dag par snang ba de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang rang gi rtog pas kun
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag kyang mig rnam par dag pa rnams la rab rib la sogs pa'i gnod pas rnam par ma dag par snang ba de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang rang gi rtog pas kun
translated: It is said that just as space, though pure by nature, appears impure to eyes impaired by cataracts and so on, in the same way, the completely pure dharmadhatu is obscured by our own concepts.🔽

original: nas bslang ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyus ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis gnod par byas pa'i mig can rnams la rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag kyang /
analyzed: nas bslang ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyus ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis gnod par byas pa'i mig can rnams la rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag kyang /
translated: This is saying that just as space, though naturally completely pure, appears to those with pure eyes to be impure due to the faults of cataracts and so on, in the same way, though the completely pure expanse of reality is naturally completely pure, it appears in a distorted way to those whose eyes are impaired by the cataracts of ignorance due to the causes of desire and so on that are generated by their own thoughts.

original: phyin ci log tu snang gi rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi mig can rnams ni de ltar mi gos so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu snang gi rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi mig can rnams ni de ltar mi gos so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Those with the eyes of completely pure wisdom do not perceive it in that distorted way.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag cing de bzhin gshegs pa thams @250b cad kyi khyad par med par chos kyi skur brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag cing de bzhin gshegs pa thams @250b cad kyi khyad par med par chos kyi skur brjod par bya ste /
translated: This completely pure expanse of reality is completely pure in every way and should be described as the dharmakāya of all tathāgatas without any distinctions.

original: de nyid dus thams cad du de kho na bzhin du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dus thams cad du de kho na bzhin du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it exists in that way at all times,

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the ultimate thusness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu la yang yod pas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu la yang yod pas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it exists as the cause of the mind of all sentient beings, it is said that all sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata.

original: de ni thams cad la yod kyang sems can rnams kyi rang gi skyid pa'i stobs bskyed pas dmus long gis nyi ma bzhin du ma mthong ste ji skad du snod chag pa'i zla ba bzhin /
analyzed: de ni thams cad la yod kyang sems can rnams kyi rang gi skyid pa'i stobs bskyed pas dmus long gis nyi ma bzhin du ma mthong ste ji skad du snod chag pa'i zla ba bzhin /
translated: Although it exists in all, like the sun for the blind, it is not seen by sentient beings because of the power of their own obscurations.

original: sems can nyes pas mi snang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can nyes pas mi snang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “The moon is not seen because of the fault of the vessel.”

original: de la chos kyi dbyings ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa ma yin no //
translated: The Dharma-element is not pure because it is associated with the stain of passion, etc.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no zhes gang smras pa /
translated: It is like the mind and mental activities.

original: nam mkha' gzugs la sogs pa'i dri ma dang 'brel kyang rnam par ma dag pa med pas ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' gzugs la sogs pa'i dri ma dang 'brel kyang rnam par ma dag pa med pas ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Space is not a definite example because, although it is related to the defilement of form, etc., it is not impure, since it is not subject to change.

original: de bzhin du sems la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rnam par ma dag pa yang ma yin pas dper mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rnam par ma dag pa yang ma yin pas dper mi rung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the reality of mind, etc., is not impure because of its relation to passion, etc., and so it is not a suitable example.

original: bsam pa rnam par ma dag pa'i don ni de'i ngo bo mi gsal ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa nyid du yang 'dod do //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par ma dag pa'i don ni de'i ngo bo mi gsal ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par ma dag pa nyid du yang 'dod do //
translated: The meaning of the impurity of attitude is that the realm of totality is impure because its nature is not clear.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma 'brel pa dang bral ba'i phyir de ltar mi gos so zhes bshad zin to //🔽'dis ni nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du chos kyi dbyings thams cad ni yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma 'brel pa dang bral ba'i phyir de ltar mi gos so zhes bshad zin to // 'dis ni nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du chos kyi dbyings thams cad ni yod pa'i phyir /
translated: It has been explained that those whose attitude is pure are not defiled in that way because they are free from the connection with the defilements of passion, etc.

original: sems can gyi nyes pa dag gis mi gos so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi nyes pa dag gis mi gos so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the realm of totality is not defiled by the faults of sentient beings because it exists like space, etc.🔽The realm of totality is the object of the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: brtags pa'i chos kyis dben pa thams cad ni yod pa nyid ni kun nas yod pa'i phyir bsgrub mi dgos so //
analyzed: brtags pa'i chos kyis dben pa thams cad ni yod pa nyid ni kun nas yod pa'i phyir bsgrub mi dgos so //
translated: All that is isolated from imagined phenomena is established as existent, because it is the nature of the pure dharmadhātu.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin pa /🔽de yang spros pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba med na sems can gyi don bya ba rgyu mtshan ye shes rnams ji ltar 'byung 'on te de 'byung na ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin nyid
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin pa / de yang spros pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba med na sems can gyi don bya ba rgyu mtshan ye shes rnams ji ltar 'byung 'on te de 'byung na ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin nyid
translated: If the Tathāgatas are the nature of the pure dharmadhātu,

original: kyi mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: kyi mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: and that is also the nature of the absence of conceptual elaborations, then if it is effortless, how do the wisdoms that are the causes of benefitting sentient beings arise? But if they do arise, then because it is with effort, how can the Tathāgatas be the suchness that is the characteristic of the Tathāgata?

original: de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /🔽dper na nam mkha' ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las su gyur pa thams cad kyi go 'byed kyang zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir / dper na nam mkha' ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las su gyur pa thams cad kyi go 'byed kyang zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: In order to respond to that,🔽it is said, “For example, space accommodates all actions of body, speech, and mind.”

original: re zhig lus dang ngag gi las ni lus can yin pa'i phyir /🔽go @251a * //
analyzed: re zhig lus dang ngag gi las ni lus can yin pa'i phyir / go @251a * //
translated: First, it is reasonable that the actions of body and speech are accommodated because they have physical form.

original: 'byed pa yang rigs na /
analyzed: 'byed pa yang rigs na /
translated: But how is the action of mind accommodated?

original: yid kyi las la go rims ji ltar te /
analyzed: yid kyi las la go rims ji ltar te /
translated: What is the order of the mental action?

original: lus can ma yin pa la ni gang gis na go 'byed par 'gyur ba thogs pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa la ni gang gis na go 'byed par 'gyur ba thogs pa med do zhe na /
translated: It is not obstructed, since it is not material.

original: de skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa gang yin pa de nyid go 'byed pa yin no //🔽thogs pa dang bcas pa la yang skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa nyid nam mkha' go 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa gang yin pa de nyid go 'byed pa yin no // thogs pa dang bcas pa la yang skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa nyid nam mkha' go 'byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the non-obstruction of the arising of that which is to be obstructed.

original: gang gi phyir de skye ba na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de skye ba na /
translated: Even in the case of the obstructed, the arising of that which is to be obstructed is non-obstruction, since it is the arising of space.🔽Because it arises without obstruction,

original: sgrib pa med par skye ba de'i phyir de go 'byed ces bshad do //
analyzed: sgrib pa med par skye ba de'i phyir de go 'byed ces bshad do //
translated: it is said that space is the obstruction of that.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de nas bsal te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de nas bsal te /
translated: In one sense, the obstructed thing is removed from that place,

original: gzhan gyis go 'byed pas de la yod pa'i chos nam mkha' la nye bar 'dogs pa de bzhin du yid kyi las kyang 'gag pa na gzhan gyi go 'byed pas de la yod pa'i chos nam mkha' la ci'i phyir nye bar mi gdags /
analyzed: gzhan gyis go 'byed pas de la yod pa'i chos nam mkha' la nye bar 'dogs pa de bzhin du yid kyi las kyang 'gag pa na gzhan gyi go 'byed pas de la yod pa'i chos nam mkha' la ci'i phyir nye bar mi gdags /
translated: and another thing arises in its place. The quality of space is designated as existing in that place. In the same way, when the mental action ceases, another arises in its place. Why is the quality of space not designated as existing in that place?

original: de ltar ma yin na thams cad na yod pa'i dngos pos ji zhig go 'byed yod /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na thams cad na yod pa'i dngos pos ji zhig go 'byed yod /
translated: If it were not so, what would space make room for?🔽Space does not make room for anything, because it is not a cause.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space does not make room for anything, because it is not a cause.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.

original: nam mkha' ni rtsol ba yang med mngon par 'du byed pa yang med cing bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'di la ni go dbye'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtsol ba yang med mngon par 'du byed pa yang med cing bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'di la ni go dbye'o //
translated: Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.

original: 'di la ni go mi dbye'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni go mi dbye'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.

original: de bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'od zer dag kyang 'byung ba na de'i rtsol ba med bzhin du byung nas gzugs la sogs pa rab tu gsal bar byed la /🔽yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnams kyang rtsol ba dang bral ba sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du re ba yongs su skong bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'od zer dag kyang 'byung ba na de'i rtsol ba med bzhin du byung nas gzugs la sogs pa rab tu gsal bar byed la / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnams kyang rtsol ba dang bral ba sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du re ba yongs su skong bar byed do //

original: nam mkha' smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad pas 'di thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad pas 'di thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Space is not a cause, because it does not make room for anything.🔽Space is

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa na yang rtsol ba mi mnga' bar sems can gyi don mdzad par rnam par gshegs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa na yang rtsol ba mi mnga' bar sems can gyi don mdzad par rnam par gshegs te /
translated: Likewise, when the Tathāgatas abide in the pure realm of the Tathāgata in the same way, they proceed to perform benefit for sentient beings without effort.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang ye shes dang sprul pa dang sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa thams cad kyi go 'byed kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang ye shes dang sprul pa dang sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa thams cad kyi go 'byed kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the realm of the Tathāgatas is the matrix of all the pure realm, exalted wisdom, emanations, and activities of sentient beings.

original: ye shes thams cad ni me lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes thams cad ni me lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: All exalted wisdoms are the exalted wisdom of fire, and so on.

original: sprul pa thams cad ni sku dang gsung dang / thugs sprul pa rnams so //
analyzed: sprul pa thams cad ni sku dang gsung dang / thugs sprul pa rnams so //
translated: All emanations are the emanations of body, speech, and mind.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba sgrub pa dag ni sems can gang gi bya ba ste dgos pa gang yin pa de sgrub cing grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba sgrub pa dag ni sems can gang gi bya ba ste dgos pa gang yin pa de sgrub cing grub par byed pa'o //
translated: The activities of all sentient beings are the activities of sentient beings, which are the purposes that are accomplished and achieved.

original: de dag go 'byed pa ni de dag skye ba la rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po @251b nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag go 'byed pa ni de dag skye ba la rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po @251b nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The matrix of those is the cause of their arising, because it is the basis of their signs.

original: rtsol ba yang med mngon par 'du byed pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba yang med mngon par 'du byed pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The absence of effort and the absence of manifest activity, etc. are mental attention.

original: sems dmigs pa las dmigs pa gzhan la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems dmigs pa las dmigs pa gzhan la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Mental attention is the movement of the mind from one object to another.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems kyi yongs su g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems kyi yongs su g-yo ba'o //
translated: Manifest activity is the mental movement.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na ye shes kyi sprul pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan thams cad kyi go 'byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na ye shes kyi sprul pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan thams cad kyi go 'byed ces bya ste /
translated: In another way, the intuition-exalted body, which is the embodiment of the perfect and the emanation bodies, is the reason for the accomplishment of the aims of beings.

original: mi zad pa nyid kyis rgya che ba'i phyir dang / thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi zad pa nyid kyis rgya che ba'i phyir dang / thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is called the universal ground because it is extensive due to its inexhaustibility and because it is unobstructed.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa bzhin du yang de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa bzhin du yang de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And like the nondiscriminating intuition, it is the cause of the arising of the other intuitions.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i skye ba'i go 'byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa rnams ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la rtsol ba la sogs pa'i spros pa med mod kyi 'on kyang bya ba'i bye brag thams cad mngon pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings la rnam pa thams cad du ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i skye ba'i go 'byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa rnams ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la rtsol ba la sogs pa'i spros pa med mod kyi 'on kyang bya ba'i bye brag thams cad mngon pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings la rnam pa thams cad du ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i
translated: This is saying that just as space and so forth engage in the action of providing the opportunity for the arising of form and so forth, they are devoid of the elaborations of striving in the apprehension of “I” and “mine” and so on.

original: rtsol ba'i spros pa dang bral ba rnams kyis ye shes dang sprul pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa thams cad kyang /
analyzed: rtsol ba'i spros pa dang bral ba rnams kyis ye shes dang sprul pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa thams cad kyang /
translated: Likewise, the tathāgatas, who are completely devoid of the elaborations of striving in the apprehension of “I” and “mine” in the uncontaminated realm, also accomplish all the actions of gnosis, emanations, and sentient beings

original: sngon mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: through the power of their previous aspirations.

original: gang mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i yo byad thams cad dang ldan par 'khor ba'i mtha'i bskal pa ji srid bzhugs shing chos kyi skur bzhugs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang /
analyzed: gang mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i yo byad thams cad dang ldan par 'khor ba'i mtha'i bskal pa ji srid bzhugs shing chos kyi skur bzhugs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang /
translated: Because he possesses all the major and minor marks of a buddha, he remains for as long as the world exists, abiding in the body of truth.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas ye shes kyi sprul pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi don byed pa 'di nyid de /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas ye shes kyi sprul pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi don byed pa 'di nyid de /
translated: Although he is free of conceptual thought, he benefits sentient beings through all the emanations of his exalted wisdom, which are generated by the power of his former aspirations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo yin no //🔽de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa las 'di ni mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo yin no // de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa las 'di ni mdzad do //
translated: This is the nature of the Tathagata's inconceivable supreme qualities.

original: 'di ni mi mdzad do snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni mi mdzad do snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: At that time, the Tathagata does not think, I will do this, I will not do that.

original: 'on kyang sngon 'phangs pa'i dbang gis bsam nas gnyid kyis log pa las sad pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba bzhin du ji skad bshad pa'i bya ba rnams kyang mngon te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon 'phangs pa'i dbang gis bsam nas gnyid kyis log pa las sad pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba bzhin du ji skad bshad pa'i bya ba rnams kyang mngon te /
translated: However, just as one who has fallen asleep after thinking and who awakens, or who rises from the meditative attainment of cessation, engages in the activities that were previously intended, so the Tathagata engages in the activities that were previously intended, such as teaching the Dharma.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos bstan pa las dper na dge slong gand'i brdung ba la bab kyi bar du byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos bstan pa las dper na dge slong gand'i brdung ba la bab kyi bar du byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: For example, it is like the explanation in the sutra of the teaching of Sagaramati:

original: 'gog pa la @252a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa la @252a * //
translated: “For example, a monk enters meditative attainment in cessation,

original: snyoms par zhugs pa de'i rna lam du gand'i'i sgra mi grag pa rnam par rtog pa yang mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa de'i rna lam du gand'i'i sgra mi grag pa rnam par rtog pa yang mi byed mod kyi /
translated: and the sound of the gavel does not reach his ears, and he does not conceptualize,

original: 'on kyang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: but he is still counted as a monk.”

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa shes bya thams cad kyi rjes su song zhing tha mi dad par 'dug pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa shes bya thams cad kyi rjes su song zhing tha mi dad par 'dug pa yin na /
translated: If the pure dharmadhatu pervades all objects of knowledge and is undifferentiated,

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then because it is undifferentiated from that, it too would arise and disintegrate in the same way.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it does not arise and disintegrate,

original: de shes bya dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de shes bya dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it would not be undifferentiated from objects of knowledge.

original: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi skye ba yang snang 'jig pa yang snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi skye ba yang snang 'jig pa yang snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example, it is said that in space, the arising of various aspects of form is seen and their destruction is seen.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa skye ba dang 'gag pa yod kyang /
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa skye ba dang 'gag pa yod kyang /
translated: This is saying that just as form and so on have arising and cessation,🔽the space that is not different from them and has the characteristic of their interstice has neither arising nor cessation.

original: de dang tha mi dad par 'dug cing de'i go 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' la ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dag med pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ye shes dang / sprul pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa thams cad kyi go 'byed pa la zhugs shing de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa la yang skye ba dang 'gag pa dag med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par 'dug cing de'i go 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' la ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dag med pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ye shes dang / sprul pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa thams cad kyi go 'byed pa la zhugs shing de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa la yang skye ba dang 'gag pa dag med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the pure dharmadhatu, which is not different from and is the interstice of all the activities of beings, emanations and wisdom, has neither arising nor cessation.

original: de nyid la dgongs nas 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid la dgongs nas 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With that intention, it is said that “the Tathāgata’s words are called ‘unborn’ and ‘ unceasing,’ ” and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa ni med kyi kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa ni med kyi kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Form and so on are also ultimately the nature of suchness, and therefore they are not born and so on, but are posited conventionally.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said that they appear.

original: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs te /
translated: The intention is that they are conventional, not ultimate.

original: ye shes kyi sprul pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sprul pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: All of this is similar to the emanations of wisdom and so on.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba yin na /
translated: If the dharmadhātu is omnipresent,
