original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang 'phel ba dang nub pa snang bas de yang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de kho na bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang 'phel ba dang nub pa snang bas de yang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de kho na bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: then the teachings of the Tathāgata would appear to increase and decrease, and therefore, because it is not different from them, it would increase and decrease in the same way.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it follows that there is no purification.

original: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs rnams kyi 'phel ba yang snang 'grib pa yang snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs rnams kyi 'phel ba yang snang 'grib pa yang snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For example, in space, the increase of various forms is seen, and their decrease is seen.

original: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i nying khu ni de bzhin gshegs pa bstan pa nyid de las gzhan pa mu stegs can gyi bstan pa la @252b ltos na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i nying khu ni de bzhin gshegs pa bstan pa nyid de las gzhan pa mu stegs can gyi bstan pa la @252b ltos na /
translated: In the same way, the essence of the teaching of the Tathagata is the teaching of the Tathagata itself. In comparison with the teachings of the tirthikas,

original: shin tu mchog tu gyur pa nyid kyis snying por gyur pa'i phyir snying khu yin te mar gyi snying khu bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mchog tu gyur pa nyid kyis snying por gyur pa'i phyir snying khu yin te mar gyi snying khu bzhin no //
translated: it is the essence because it is the most excellent, like the essence of ghee.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni 'phel ba yang med 'grib pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la yang don dam par na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag med do
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni 'phel ba yang med 'grib pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la yang don dam par na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag med do
translated: In the pure dharmadhatu, there is no increase and no decrease. In the teaching of the Tathagata, there is no increase or decrease ultimately, because it is the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: // kun rdzob kyi tshul du ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yod do //
analyzed: // kun rdzob kyi tshul du ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yod do //
translated: In the manner of the conventional, they exist like form, etc.

original: de dag kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rnams ni yang dag par na med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rnams ni yang dag par na med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag med do //
translated: Moreover, since they are by nature the dharma-realm, they are, like space, neither increased nor decreased, because their nature is ultimately non-existent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they appear.

original: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu snang ba yin gyi /
translated: They appear conventionally, because the consciousness that appears as them is produced.

original: yang dag par na chos kyi dbyings spros pa med pa'i ngo bo la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na chos kyi dbyings spros pa med pa'i ngo bo la ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not appear in the nature of the ultimate, the unelaborated dharma-realm.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yang sems can rnams la phan pa dang nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir bzhud cing byon na go chos kyi dbyings kyang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong bar thal bar 'gyur bas phal pa bzhin du rnam par dag
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yang sems can rnams la phan pa dang nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir bzhud cing byon na go chos kyi dbyings kyang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong bar thal bar 'gyur bas phal pa bzhin du rnam par dag
translated: If the Tathagatas go and come in order to benefit and assist sentient beings, then it follows, absurdly, that the dharma-realm goes and comes, because it is not different from them.🔽Therefore, like ordinary people, they are not to be praised as being

original: pa med pa dang / skye ba dang sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: pa med pa dang / skye ba dang sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: and the consequences of nonexistence, arising, etc.

original: de med na phyogs gzhan dag tu sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: de med na phyogs gzhan dag tu sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa yang med do zhe na /
translated: If that is not so, then there is no benefit or happiness for sentient beings in other realms.

original: dper na nam mkha' mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, space is infinite,

original: nam mkha' la phyogs bcu na gzugs su gyur pa g-yo ba rnams mtha' yas mu med kyang nam mkha' ni 'gro ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la phyogs bcu na gzugs su gyur pa g-yo ba rnams mtha' yas mu med kyang nam mkha' ni 'gro ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and although forms in the ten directions are infinite and limitless, space is not exhausted.

original: ji ltar na nam mkha' mtha' thug pa med pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kyang mtha' thug pa med do //
analyzed: ji ltar na nam mkha' mtha' thug pa med pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kyang mtha' thug pa med do //
translated: Just as space is infinite, so also world-realms are infinite.

original: de'i phyir gzugs su gyur pa gzugs kyi rnam pa rnams mtha' yas pa ni phyogs gcig gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs su gyur pa gzugs kyi rnam pa rnams mtha' yas pa ni phyogs gcig gi sgo nas so //
translated: Therefore, forms, i.e., aspects of form, are infinite from the point of view of one direction.

original: mu med pa ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: mu med pa ni thams cad du'o //
translated: They are limitless in all directions.

original: yang na dus sam yul gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: yang na dus sam yul gyi sgo nas so //
translated: Or, they are infinite and limitless from the point of view of time and place.

original: yang nam mkha' ni thams cad na yod pa'i phyir dang / byed pa med pa'i phyir sgo dbye ba'i phyir 'gro ba'am 'ong ba yang med do //🔽de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mtha' thug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang nam mkha' ni thams cad na yod pa'i phyir dang / byed pa med pa'i phyir sgo dbye ba'i phyir 'gro ba'am 'ong ba yang med do // de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mtha' thug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, space is not said to go or come because it is present everywhere and is inactive.🔽In the same way, the dharmadhatu is not said to go or come because it is infinite.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mu thug pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la sogs pa sems @253a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mu thug pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la sogs pa sems @253a * //
translated: The dharmadhatu is infinite because the purity of the dharmadhatu of the tathagatas is infinite.

original: can la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mu med pa de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: can la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mu med pa de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The activities of the tathagatas that are present for the benefit and welfare of sentient beings are also infinite, as before.

original: 'gro ba med kyang 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag tu sems can gyi don mdzad pa mtha' yas pa dag 'byung ngo //🔽'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'di nas gzhan du'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba med kyang 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag tu sems can gyi don mdzad pa mtha' yas pa dag 'byung ngo // 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'di nas gzhan du'o //
translated: Even though they do not go, infinite activities for the welfare of sentient beings occur in infinite world systems.🔽Going is from here to there.

original: 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan nas 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan nas 'dir ro //
translated: Coming is from there to here.

original: g-yo ba 'am 'gul ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang bshad pa dag go //
analyzed: g-yo ba 'am 'gul ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang bshad pa dag go //
translated: “Moving” or “shaking” refers to teaching and explaining.

original: de dag med pa ni chos kyi dbyings mu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag med pa ni chos kyi dbyings mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not exist because the realm of phenomena is limitless.

original: gang zhig lus yod pa de ni yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba'i phyir 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'thob kyi lus med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig lus yod pa de ni yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba'i phyir 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'thob kyi lus med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That which has a body is said to go to other places, and so on, but not that which is bodiless,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like space and so on.

original: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni don dam par chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin kho na yin la chos kyi dbyings kyang sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la sogs pas sems can de dag kyang rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa'i dbang dang /
analyzed: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni don dam par chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin kho na yin la chos kyi dbyings kyang sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la sogs pas sems can de dag kyang rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa'i dbang dang /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata is ultimately the realm of phenomena itself, and the realm of phenomena is in the mindstreams of all sentient beings.

original: de'i byin gyis de lta bu'i spyod par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skyes na gang gis na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa mdzad do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad 'dogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i byin gyis de lta bu'i spyod par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skyes na gang gis na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa mdzad do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad 'dogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: By the power of that, if the consciousness that appears as such conduct arises, then the convention “The Tathāgata performs deeds to benefit sentient beings” occurs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni byin tsam nyid ma gtogs par gang gis na de lta bu'i mdzad par 'gyur ba'i spyod pa gzhan mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni byin tsam nyid ma gtogs par gang gis na de lta bu'i mdzad par 'gyur ba'i spyod pa gzhan mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any other conduct apart from just the bestowal of that, by which he would perform such deeds.

original: ji skad du rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang du 'ang bzhugs pa'am byon pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang du 'ang bzhugs pa'am byon pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “Son of noble family, the Tathāgata does not abide or come anywhere.”

original: sprul pa'i sku las dgongs nas de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku las dgongs nas de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in saying that the Tathāgata goes and so on, intending the emanation body.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med na yang yul der 'gro ba med par ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med na yang yul der 'gro ba med par ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the pure dharmadhatu has no coming or going, how can there be perfect enlightenment and parinirvana in that place without going anywhere?

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod na ni de nyid nyes pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /🔽'jig rten gyi khams la yang 'jig pa dang chags pa dag yod kyang nam mkha' la med pa de dag med pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la gang gi na de'i don du der 'gro bar 'gyur ba mngon par rdzogs par byang chub
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod na ni de nyid nyes pa yin no zhe na ma yin te / 'jig rten gyi khams la yang 'jig pa dang chags pa dag yod kyang nam mkha' la med pa de dag med pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la gang gi na de'i don du der 'gro bar 'gyur ba mngon par rdzogs par byang chub
translated: If there is coming and going, that is a fault.🔽Reply: No, it is not a fault.

original: pa dang / mya @253b ngan las 'da' ba med de /
analyzed: pa dang / mya @253b ngan las 'da' ba med de /
translated: Just as the world systems have destruction and evolution but space does not, so too, in the pure dharmadhatu, there is no perfect enlightenment and no parinirvana for the sake of which one would go there.

original: dper na nam mkha' la 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa ste rnam par 'jig pa dang chags pa ste /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa ste rnam par 'jig pa dang chags pa ste /
translated: For example, in space, world systems are destroyed and evolve.

original: 'byung ba kun rdzob tu mngon gyi de dag kyang nam mkha' 'dra bar stong pa'i phyir yang dag par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'byung ba kun rdzob tu mngon gyi de dag kyang nam mkha' 'dra bar stong pa'i phyir yang dag par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The elements appear in a superficial way, but they are not real because they are empty like space.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dpag tu med pa snang ba yang kun rdzob tu mngon gyi yang dag par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dpag tu med pa snang ba yang kun rdzob tu mngon gyi yang dag par ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the complete enlightenment and the immeasurable parinirvāṇa of the pure dharmadhātu appear in a superficial way, but they are not real,

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa po dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba po dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa po dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba po dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no one who is completely enlightened and no one who enters parinirvāṇa.

original: phung po rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates are not the self because they are dependently arisen.

original: gal te de gnyis ka yang dag pa nyid du yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de gnyis ka yang dag pa nyid du yin no zhe na /
translated: If both of these are real,

original: yang dag pa ni rang gi ngo bo la ma nyams pa yin na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni rang gi ngo bo la ma nyams pa yin na /
translated: then reality would be impaired in its own nature.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs nyams na /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs nyams na /
translated: If the state of complete enlightenment is impaired,🔽then the state of parinirvāṇa would also be impaired.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub la yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i gnas skabs nyams na yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on te yang 'di snyam du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang nam yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ma yin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub la yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i gnas skabs nyams na yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // 'on te yang 'di snyam du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang nam yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ma yin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: because if the state of perfect buddhahood were to deteriorate, then it would follow that nirvana would also deteriorate.🔽But if you think that perfect buddhahood is never not perfect buddhahood,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang nam yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid yang dag pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang nam yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid yang dag pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: and that nirvana is never not nirvana,

original: 'di la yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /🔽'jig pa yang nam yang 'chags pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di la yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te / 'jig pa yang nam yang 'chags pa ma yin zhing /
translated: then the same applies to this case.🔽Destruction is never formation,

original: 'chags pa yang nam yang 'jig pa ma yin la bum pa la sogs pa yang nam yang bum pa la sogs pa ma yin ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chags pa yang nam yang 'jig pa ma yin la bum pa la sogs pa yang nam yang bum pa la sogs pa ma yin ba ma yin no //
translated: and formation is never destruction, and a pot, etc. is never not a pot, etc.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams me la sogs pas yongs su gang ba brgal te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams me la sogs pas yongs su gang ba brgal te /
translated: Therefore, yogis would not cross over the world systems filled with fire, etc.

original: 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: and go to other places.

original: de dag dang 'brel na tshig pa la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel na tshig pa la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir la /
translated: Because if they were connected with them, the fault of being burned, etc. would ensue.

original: mos pa'i dbang gis sa la sogs pa gser la sogs pa'i dngos por yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang gis sa la sogs pa gser la sogs pa'i dngos por yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And by the power of imagination, earth, etc. would not become gold, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ma yi par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ma yi par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And by the power of meditative concentration, they would not become fully enlightened.

original: de lta bas na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol dang / de'i tshe yang de bzhin @254a * //🔽nyid ma nyams pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang med /
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol dang / de'i tshe yang de bzhin @254a * // nyid ma nyams pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang med /
translated: Therefore, prior to the stage of full enlightenment and nirvana, and at that time,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang med do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang med do //
translated: the realm of phenomena is not fully enlightened and does not pass into nirvana, because its nature is undiminished suchness.

original: de gnyis ni de la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pas yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni de la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pas yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Since those two are the nature of superimposition on that, they are not real,

original: byed pa po dang bya ba dag ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bya ba dag ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the agent and action are the imagined nature and do not exist.

original: chos thams cad thugs su chud pa ni byang chub yin no zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang mi rtog pa'i ye shes las dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad thugs su chud pa ni byang chub yin no zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang mi rtog pa'i ye shes las dgongs pa yin te /
translated: With regard to the statement, “Enlightenment is the understanding of all phenomena,” that is also stated from the perspective of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes de yang gnyis su rnam par rtog pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir /🔽de'i tshe yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes de yang gnyis su rnam par rtog pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir / de'i tshe yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang ma yin la /
translated: That wisdom that observes suchness is also not the arising of all conceptions of duality.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, there is neither manifest perfect enlightenment nor parinirvāṇa.

original: de nyid la dgongs nas lha'i bu chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du thob pa med pa dang mngon par rdzogs pa med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid la dgongs nas lha'i bu chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du thob pa med pa dang mngon par rdzogs pa med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and similarly, “the non-attainment and non-manifestation” and so on.

original: kun brtags pa med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no imagination and because there is no conceptualization of arising and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu mi de gnyis ka mngon te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu mi de gnyis ka mngon te /
translated: Conventionally, both are manifest.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sprul pa'i skus de ltar kun du bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i sems can gyi ngor de gnyi ga ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sprul pa'i skus de ltar kun du bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i sems can gyi ngor de gnyi ga ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Tathagata, the emanation body, teaches in that way, and manifests both for the sake of those sentient beings who are to be disciplined.

original: gal te chos dbyings sems can thams cad dang ldan na /
analyzed: gal te chos dbyings sems can thams cad dang ldan na /
translated: If the realm of phenomena is endowed with all sentient beings,

original: de dag ji ltar log par sgrub pa yin chos kyi dbyings la ni log par sgrub pa dag med de yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar log par sgrub pa yin chos kyi dbyings la ni log par sgrub pa dag med de yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: how is it that they are wrongly imagined? There is no wrong imagination in the realm of phenomena, because it is completely pure.

original: de'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba don med par thal bar 'gyur te sems can rnams kyis log par sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba don med par thal bar 'gyur te sems can rnams kyis log par sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Therefore, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be pointless to set forth the bases of training, because sentient beings would not be able to misuse them.

original: nyan thos bzhin du yongs su skye ba dang / yongs su dag pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ma yin te nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos bzhin du yongs su skye ba dang / yongs su dag pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ma yin te nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Or else, like the sravakas, they would not be born and would not be purified.

original: dper na rtsva la sogs pa gzugs kyi rnam pa nam mkha' la brten pa rnams la snang ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba sna tshogs dmigs kyang nam mkha' ni de'i khongs su gtogs kyang nam mkha' ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag gi 'gyur ba yang
analyzed: dper na rtsva la sogs pa gzugs kyi rnam pa nam mkha' la brten pa rnams la snang ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba sna tshogs dmigs kyang nam mkha' ni de'i khongs su gtogs kyang nam mkha' ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag gi 'gyur ba yang
translated: For example, although the various changes of light and so on are observed in the forms of grass and so on that are based in space, space is not included in those changes, nor does space change.

original: med la snang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mi gnod pa'i phyir yongs su skyo ba yang med do //
analyzed: med la snang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mi gnod pa'i phyir yongs su skyo ba yang med do //
translated: And because it is not harmed by the suffering of light and so on, it is not wearied.

original: de @254b bzhin du sems can gyi khams chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la brten pa la chos kyi dbyings kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams la yang rang gi rnam par rtog pa kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi las log par sgrub pa mi dge ba la sogs pa la stsogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs khyim pa dang /
analyzed: de @254b bzhin du sems can gyi khams chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la brten pa la chos kyi dbyings kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams la yang rang gi rnam par rtog pa kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi las log par sgrub pa mi dge ba la sogs pa la stsogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs khyim pa dang /
translated: Likewise, in the realm of sentient beings, which is based on the pure expanse of reality, there are various kinds of wrong practice, such as the physical, verbal and mental actions of sentient beings, which are included in the expanse of reality, that are motivated by their own thoughts.🔽In order to stop these in householders and those gone forth, the bases of training are established conventionally.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams la ci rigs par dmigs pa de dag bzlog pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba dang / de las 'das pa'i ngo bo log par sgrub pa yang dmigs mod kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir log par sgrub pa de dag gis 'gyur ba yang med la mi gnod pa'i phyir yongs su skyo ba yang med
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams la ci rigs par dmigs pa de dag bzlog pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba dang / de las 'das pa'i ngo bo log par sgrub pa yang dmigs mod kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir log par sgrub pa de dag gis 'gyur ba yang med la mi gnod pa'i phyir yongs su skyo ba yang med
translated: Although the essence of transgressing those is wrong practice, since the pure expanse of reality does not change into something else, it is not changed by that wrong practice and since it is not harmed, it is not discouraged.

original: do // gang zhig sdug bsngal rnams kyis gnod pa ni de mi bzod pa nyid kyis nyan thos bzhin du yongs su skyo bar 'gyur gyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: do // gang zhig sdug bsngal rnams kyis gnod pa ni de mi bzod pa nyid kyis nyan thos bzhin du yongs su skyo bar 'gyur gyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One who is harmed by suffering, because of not being able to bear it, becomes weary like a śrāvaka, but not the purity of the dharma-dhātu.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the acceptance of all things as like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la gzugs la sogs pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yin gyi yang dag par ni mi 'dod pa de bzhin du bslab pa la sogs pa bca' ba dang / log par sgrub pa rnams kyang rnam par gzhag pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la de dag yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la gzugs la sogs pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yin gyi yang dag par ni mi 'dod pa de bzhin du bslab pa la sogs pa bca' ba dang / log par sgrub pa rnams kyang rnam par gzhag pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la de dag yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as one does not assert that space is harmed by forms, etc., in reality, but only conventionally, in the same way, the purity of the dharma-dhātu, which is the reality that is established, does not have such things as training and wrong practice.

original: 'di ltar lus la sogs pa'i las ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis mi dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus la sogs pa'i las ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis mi dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin zhing /
translated: Because bodily, etc., actions are nonvirtuous, etc., by the power of their concomitants and motivation, but not by their own nature.

original: des kun nas bslang ba'i bod ba la sogs pa nyid ni yang mi dge ba nyid du khas blang bar yang mi nus la /
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba'i bod ba la sogs pa nyid ni yang mi dge ba nyid du khas blang bar yang mi nus la /
translated: And it is not possible to accept that the body, etc. that are motivated by it are nonvirtuous.

original: lus kyang sa la sogs pa gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de dang chos mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyang sa la sogs pa gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de dang chos mthun pa yin no //
translated: And the body is similar to them, because it is composed of earth, etc.

original: ngag gi las kyang rnga bo che la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du mi dge ba la sogs pa nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: ngag gi las kyang rnga bo che la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du mi dge ba la sogs pa nyid mi srid do //
translated: Also, verbal action is not possible as nonvirtuous, etc., like the sound of a drum, etc.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de ltar gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de ltar gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that noninformative form does not exist in that way,

original: de ni mi byed pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi byed pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely the nonperformance of action.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa yang dag pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhin du mi dge ba la sogs pa nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa yang dag pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhin du mi dge ba la sogs pa nyid mi srid do //
translated: And intention concomitant with it is not possible as nonvirtuous, etc., like that concomitant with correct view, etc.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: And its result is similar to that.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni las dang 'bras bu dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni las dang 'bras bu dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the pure realm of phenomena, karma and its result do not exist,

original: de gnyis ni brtags pa yin pa'i @255a * //
analyzed: de gnyis ni brtags pa yin pa'i @255a * //
translated: because those two are imputed.

original: phyir ro // kun rdzob du der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skyes na mngon de ji ltar mngon pa de ltar yang rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: phyir ro // kun rdzob du der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skyes na mngon de ji ltar mngon pa de ltar yang rnam par bzhag go //
translated: If the relative appears as that, the consciousness arises in that aspect, and it is posited in that way.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa thams cad ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa thams cad ldan pa yin na /
translated: If the completely pure dharmadhātu is endowed with all,

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: it follows that it would have the characteristics of the aggregate of ethics and so on.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag kyang de kho na bzhin du phung po'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag kyang de kho na bzhin du phung po'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Or, because it is not different from them, they would also be just like it, not having the nature of aggregates.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is not so, like space.

original: dper na nam mkha' la brten pa'i sa chen po la sogs pa yang dmigs /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la brten pa'i sa chen po la sogs pa yang dmigs /
translated: For example, the great earth and so on that are based in space are observed.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa rgyu ba yang dmigs mod kyi nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa'i phung po dang 'brel pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ltar chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa dmigs pa yang de
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa rgyu ba yang dmigs mod kyi nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa'i phung po dang 'brel pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ltar chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa dmigs pa yang de
translated: The same is true of the pure dharmadhatu, where the aggregates of morality and so on are observed.

original: dang 'dra'o // de la tshul khrims kyi phung po ni zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po la /
analyzed: dang 'dra'o // de la tshul khrims kyi phung po ni zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po la /
translated: In this regard, the aggregate of morality is the aggregate of uncontaminated morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po dag ni zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po dag ni zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan dang / shes rab bo //
translated: The aggregates of meditative stabilization and wisdom are uncontaminated meditative stabilization and wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The aggregate of liberation is the liberation of no more learning.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The aggregate of the vision of the wisdom of liberation is the correct view of no more learning.

original: phung po lnga po 'di dag chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang ldan yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni de dag dang ldan du zin kyang de dag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga po 'di dag chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang ldan yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni de dag dang ldan du zin kyang de dag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Although these five aggregates are associated with the pure realm of the Dharma, the pure realm of the Dharma is not their characteristic.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of the aggregate of morality, etc.

original: de bzhin du nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, it should be said that it is not the nature of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos mthun pas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos mthun pas so //
translated: The mention of the aggregate of morality, etc. is for the sake of the concordance of the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: gal te sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: If all the Buddhas are of the nature of the pure realm of the Dharma,

original: khyod kyi nga'i zhes bya ba'i rtsol ba med par 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod kyi nga'i zhes bya ba'i rtsol ba med par 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how is it that there are different circles of retinue without the exertion of “mine” and “yours”?

original: rtsol ba yod na ni chos kyi dbyings ltar yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtsol ba yod na ni chos kyi dbyings ltar yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: If there is exertion, then the pure realm of the Dharma is not pure like space.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: because it is like space.

original: dper na nam mkha' la rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las yang dag par 'byung ba'i stong gsum la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su chud pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa dmigs kyang nam mkha' la ni nga yir 'dzin pa'i tha dad pa yang med la
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las yang dag par 'byung ba'i stong gsum la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su chud pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa dmigs kyang nam mkha' la ni nga yir 'dzin pa'i tha dad pa yang med la
translated: The sky has no differentiation of grasping “mine.”

original: de rnam par mi rtog @255b kyang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa rnams kyi go yang 'byed do //
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog @255b kyang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa rnams kyi go yang 'byed do //
translated: Although it is nonconceptual, it also divides the spaces of the different maṇḍalas of the world systems.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la rang gi las kyi dbang gis yang dag par byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa'i byang chub sems
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la rang gi las kyi dbang gis yang dag par byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa'i byang chub sems
translated: In the same way, in the pure realm of phenomena of the tathāgatas, one observes the maṇḍalas of the bodhisattvas’ own karma, which are the complete perfection of all aspects, the attainment of the consecration of omniscience, and the stage of the bodhisattvas.

original: dpa' rnams gcig tu 'dus pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag las byung ba rnams dmigs te sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gcig gi rgyu gang yin pa de nyid gnyis pa'am gsum pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dpa' rnams gcig tu 'dus pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag las byung ba rnams dmigs te sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gcig gi rgyu gang yin pa de nyid gnyis pa'am gsum pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of practicing through faith, having seen the circle of the Buddha’s retinue, which is the result of the coming together of many causes and conditions, thinks: “The cause of one circle of the Buddha’s retinue is the same as the cause of a second or a third.”

original: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas mdo gzhan las sangs rgyas de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nyid dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa nyid ni snang ba 'ba' zhig du zad do zhes gsungs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni ngar 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas mdo gzhan las sangs rgyas de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nyid dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa nyid ni snang ba 'ba' zhig du zad do zhes gsungs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni ngar 'dzin pa dang /
translated: With reference to this, in another sutra the Buddha said: “The difference in the Buddha’s fields and the difference in the circles of the Buddha’s retinue are only apparent.”

original: nga yir 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i rtsol ba dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i rtsol ba dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa yang med pa'o //
translated: In the pure realm of the Dharma, there is no effort that is the essence of the grasping of “I” and “mine,” nor is there the formation of the discrimination of subject and object.

original: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi skus tha mi dad cing spros pa med ngo bo rnams kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus tha dad pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rang gi 'du byed pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyang dmigs la /
analyzed: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi skus tha mi dad cing spros pa med ngo bo rnams kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus tha dad pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rang gi 'du byed pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyang dmigs la /
translated: It is said that the Tathāgatas, who are undifferentiated by way of the body of attributes, who are free of elaborations, and who are the nature of reality, are differentiated by way of the complete enjoyment body and the emanation body, and that the maṇḍalas of disciples of the Bhagavān Buddhas arise by the power of their own formative forces.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs kyi bkod pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyang dmigs so zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs kyi bkod pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyang dmigs so zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: It is said that the perfect abundance of all aspects is observed, and that the various arrays of various buddhafields are observed.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i bud med rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du de lta bu'i rnam par rig pa dag snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i bud med rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du de lta bu'i rnam par rig pa dag snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that such consciousnesses appear, just as the precious queen and so forth of a universal emperor do.

original: snga ma ni ye shes 'byung ba dang gzhan gyi don byed pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: snga ma ni ye shes 'byung ba dang gzhan gyi don byed pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: The former explains that the arising of exalted wisdom and the performance of others’ welfare are unfabricated.

original: 'di ni chos la rdzogs par longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni chos la rdzogs par longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is for the sake of perfect enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: rang gi las kyi 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs la tha dad par rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pas bye brag yod do //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs la tha dad par rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pas bye brag yod do //
translated: There is a difference in that the enjoyment body is not differentiated in the various circles of the retinue of the buddhas that arise from their own karma.

original: 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid zab pa dang / las zab pa dang / gnas zab pa bshad do //🔽de la mtshan nyid zab pa ni rnam par ma dag pa'i nyes pa bcu @256a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid zab pa dang / las zab pa dang / gnas zab pa bshad do // de la mtshan nyid zab pa ni rnam par ma dag pa'i nyes pa bcu @256a * //
translated: This explains the profound characteristic of the dharmadhatu, the profound karma, and the profound abode.

original: yongs su spang bar rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bcu kho nar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su spang bar rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bcu kho nar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Therein, the profound characteristic is to be seen as the ten characteristics of complete purity that abandon the ten faults of impurity.🔽The ten faults of impurity are:

original: rnam par ma dag pa'i nyes pa bcu ni sna tshogs kyi nyes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i nyes pa dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi nyes pa dang / 'phel ba dang zad pa'i nyes pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa'i nyes pa bcu ni sna tshogs kyi nyes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i nyes pa dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi nyes pa dang / 'phel ba dang zad pa'i nyes pa dang /
translated: the fault of variety, the fault of affliction, the fault of having compositional activity, the fault of the characteristic of the conditioned, the fault of increase and decrease,🔽the fault of the difference of the three times, the fault of the difference of the three realms, the fault of the difference of the two vehicles, the fault of the difference of the two obscurations, and the fault of the difference of the two obstructions.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i nyes pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i nyes pa dang / yongs su skyo ba'i nyes pa dang / ril po'i nyes pa dang / 'dzin pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i nyes pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i nyes pa dang / yongs su skyo ba'i nyes pa dang / ril po'i nyes pa dang / 'dzin pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The ten faults are the fault of coming and going, the fault of eternalism and nihilism, the fault of complete weariness, the fault of a whole, and the fault of grasping.

original: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bcu ni sna tshogs yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'phel ba med pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bcu ni sna tshogs yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'phel ba med pa dang /
translated: The ten characteristics of purity are the characteristic of variety, the characteristic of non-affliction, the characteristic of non-conditioning, the characteristic of the unconditioned, the characteristic of non-increase,

original: zad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su skyo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ril po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: zad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su skyo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ril po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: the characteristic of non-decrease, the characteristic of non-coming and non-going, the characteristic of non-eternality and non-annihilation, the characteristic of non-complete weariness, the characteristic of non-wholesomeness,

original: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: and the characteristic of non-grasping of “mine,” in order.

original: las zab pa ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las zab pa ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The profundity of action should be understood in terms of the action of emanation, and so on.

original: gnas zab pa ni 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba med pa'i sgo dang / rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas zab pa ni 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba med pa'i sgo dang / rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The profundity of the abode should be understood in terms of the absence of coming and going and in terms of the circle of the assembly of the buddhas who are endowed with all aspects of excellence.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam pa thams cad nam mkha' dang chos mthun par bstan pa'i phyir thams cad du nam mkha' dper mdzad de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam pa thams cad nam mkha' dang chos mthun par bstan pa'i phyir thams cad du nam mkha' dper mdzad de /
translated: In order to demonstrate the similarity of all aspects of the realm of truth to space, space is used as an analogy in all cases.

original: 'di skad du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: nam mkha' dpe gcig pu ma gtogs pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyi bar la 'jal bar byed pa'i dper bkod pa ji snyed pa'i dper dgod pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dpe gcig pu ma gtogs pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyi bar la 'jal bar byed pa'i dper bkod pa ji snyed pa'i dper dgod pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
translated: “Except for the single analogy of space, whatever analogies are set forth to measure the extent of the tathāgatas’ morality, up to and the extent of their gnosis, all those analogies are deprecations of the tathāgatas.

original: nam mkha' ji tsam pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyang de tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ji tsam pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyang de tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The sky is the extent of the Tathagata's morality, and so on.

original: spangs pa rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: spangs pa rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Having thus presented the abandonment,

original: ye shes rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: ye shes rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: in order to present the intuition,

original: shin tu 'dus me long lta bu'i ye shes ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu 'dus me long lta bu'i ye shes ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, The intuition of the buddhas is like a great lamp.

original: dpes ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ston par byed do //
analyzed: dpes ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ston par byed do //
translated: The example shows the reason for the operation of the mirror-intuition.

original: de bzhin @256b gshegs pa'i ye shes nyid me long gi dkyil 'khor lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin @256b gshegs pa'i ye shes nyid me long gi dkyil 'khor lta bu yin te /
translated: The intuition of the buddhas is like a mirror-disc,

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor dang chos mthun par shes ba'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor dang chos mthun par shes ba'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the reason for the arising of the reflection of the intuition of the buddhas, in the same way that a mirror-disc is the reason for the arising of the reflection of form.

original: skye mched rnams ni mig la sogs pa'i nang gi drug po rnams so //🔽de'i yul rnams ni de dag yul te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni mig la sogs pa'i nang gi drug po rnams so // de'i yul rnams ni de dag yul te /
translated: The sense-spheres are the six internal ones, eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa de dag gi yul gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i drug go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag gi yul gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i drug go //
translated: Their objects are the six external ones, form, etc.🔽The sense-spheres of the eye, etc. are the six internal ones, eye, etc. Their objects are the six external ones, form, etc.

original: skye mched rnams dang de'i yul rnams te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams dang de'i yul rnams te /
translated: The sense-fields and their objects.

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag ni gang dag dmigs pa des skye ba rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag ni gang dag dmigs pa des skye ba rnams so //
translated: The consciousnesses of those are the consciousnesses that arise with those as their objects.

original: de dag nyid gzugs brnyan dag yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid gzugs brnyan dag yin te /
translated: Those are the reflections.

original: thams cad du shes pa rgyu mtshan nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du shes pa rgyu mtshan nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that all are only the signs of consciousness.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po tsam gyis yul can me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po tsam gyis yul can me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of sameness has as its domain the mirror-like knowledge, which has as its object the mere thing that is dependently arisen.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can te /
translated: Discriminating knowledge has as its domain the general and particular characteristics.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Accomplishing activities is also like that.

original: skye mched dang de'i yul te /
analyzed: skye mched dang de'i yul te /
translated: The sense-fields and their objects.

original: gzung ba'i yul thams cad shes pa'i gzugs brnyan dang spyi'i mtshan nyid snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas byung ba 'di gsum snang ste yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul thams cad shes pa'i gzugs brnyan dang spyi'i mtshan nyid snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas byung ba 'di gsum snang ste yongs su gcod do //
translated: All apprehended objects appear as the reflection of consciousness and the universal characteristic in the maṇḍala of the tathāgata’s mirror-like pristine awareness, and these three are discerned.

original: sus she na /
analyzed: sus she na /
translated: By whom?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kho nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kho nas so //
translated: By the tathāgata himself.

original: yang na de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, since that pristine awareness is the nature of the pristine awareness of sameness and so forth,

original: de dag rang rig pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba na blos tha dad par phye nas /
analyzed: de dag rang rig pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba na blos tha dad par phye nas /
translated: when the consciousness that is self-knowing arises, it is differentiated by the intellect.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: It is said that the tathāgata fully knows it.

original: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis de dag rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis de dag rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Alternatively, it is fully known by the mirror-like pristine awareness,

original: de la brten nas gzugs brnyan tsam gyi tshul du 'byung ba de la snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas gzugs brnyan tsam gyi tshul du 'byung ba de la snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in the manner of a mere reflection in dependence on that.

original: yang na tshig gsum gyi zlas dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na tshig gsum gyi zlas dbye ba yin te /
translated: Alternatively, it is a threefold division.

original: skye mched rnams dang / de'i yul rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched rnams dang / de'i yul rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: the sense-spheres, their objects, and the consciousnesses.

original: de dag nyid gzugs brnyan dag yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid gzugs brnyan dag yin te /
translated: They are like reflections.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes la brten nas byung ba so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid du rab tu mkhyen te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes la brten nas byung ba so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid du rab tu mkhyen te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Tathāgata knows them as they are and as they are not, i.e., as existing in their diversity and as existing in their real nature, on the basis of the Tathāgata’s mirror-like knowledge, as before.

original: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes la brten nas rnyed nas rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes la brten nas rnyed nas rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Or else, having found them on the basis of the mirror-like knowledge, he knows them.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes skye ba na /🔽shes bya thams cad yul @257a * //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes skye ba na / shes bya thams cad yul @257a * //
translated: When the mirror-like knowledge arises,

original: gyi ngo bor gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: gyi ngo bor gyur pa yin la /
translated: all knowable things become its objective aspect.

original: de la skye mched la sogs pa gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba de dag me long lta bu'i ye shes de nyid kyis de'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med kyi 'on kyang me long lta bu'i ye shes de shes bya thams cad la
analyzed: de la skye mched la sogs pa gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba de dag me long lta bu'i ye shes de nyid kyis de'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med kyi 'on kyang me long lta bu'i ye shes de shes bya thams cad la
translated: The mirrorlike gnosis does not have the conception of apprehending the aspects of those reflections of sense bases and so on, but it is not the case that it does not know them.🔽When it arises, it is distinguished by knowing all objects of knowledge,

original: khyad par skye ba na de bzhin gshegs pa yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su song ba de dag rang rig pa'i rnam par rab tu
analyzed: khyad par skye ba na de bzhin gshegs pa yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su song ba de dag rang rig pa'i rnam par rab tu
translated: and because the Tathāgata is of the same nature as that, the Tathāgata knows those that accord with general and specific characteristics by means of reflexive awareness, free from the conception of apprehended and apprehender.

original: mkhyen to // de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid du rgyu ste /
analyzed: mkhyen to // de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid du rgyu ste /
translated: For that very reason, the Tathāgata is the cause of the reality of nonforgetfulness,

original: shes bya mtha' dag bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya mtha' dag bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is never forgetful of all objects of knowledge.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes mi mnga' na /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes mi mnga' na /
translated: if he did not possess mirrorlike gnosis,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin /
translated: How could a tathāgata be omniscient?

original: rgyun gyi spyod pa'i phyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyun gyi spyod pa'i phyir 'gyur te /
translated: He would be omniscient because he engages in continuous activity.

original: ji skad du /🔽dper na rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji skad du / dper na rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir //
translated: As it is said:🔽Just as fire is said to burn everything

original: me yis thams cad bsreg 'dod ltar //
analyzed: me yis thams cad bsreg 'dod ltar //
translated: Because it has the ability to burn continuously,

original: de bzhin thams cad mkhyen 'dod kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad mkhyen 'dod kyi //
translated: So too he is said to know everything

original: cig char thams cad mkhyen phyir min //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na /🔽de yang 'di lta ste /🔽gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa rdzas gcig 'dzin pa'i dus na /
analyzed: cig char thams cad mkhyen phyir min // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na / de yang 'di lta ste / gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa rdzas gcig 'dzin pa'i dus na /
translated: Because he knows everything continuously.🔽But that is not possible because it is impossible to apprehend a different substance at the time of apprehending one substance, such as knowledge of another’s mind.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rdzas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa kho nas 'das pas rgyun gyis kyang 'dzin par mi srid la thams cad mkhyen pa yang brtag par 'gyur gyis dngos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rdzas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa kho nas 'das pas rgyun gyis kyang 'dzin par mi srid la thams cad mkhyen pa yang brtag par 'gyur gyis dngos ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is impossible to apprehend by means of continuity alone.🔽Also, if he were omniscient, he would be omniscient by nature, not by imputation.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la thams cad mkhyen par nye bar brtags par ni thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la thams cad mkhyen par nye bar brtags par ni thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he were not omniscient, he would not become omniscient by imputation.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas /
translated: Or else, on the basis of the circle of the mirror-like wisdom of the Tathagata,

original: 'jig rten na 'am 'jig rten gyi rgyud gzhan dag la yang skye mched dang / de'i yul dang / rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams snang ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na 'am 'jig rten gyi rgyud gzhan dag la yang skye mched dang / de'i yul dang / rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams snang ste /
translated: the images of the sense-spheres, their objects and consciousnesses appear in the world or in other world-realms.

original: de med na de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if they did not exist, they would not appear.

original: 'byung ba'i dus nyid na rig pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dus nyid na rig pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is known that they arise at the very time,

original: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas skye mched dag de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas skye mched dag de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: therefore it is said that on the basis of the circle of the mirror-like wisdom of the Tathagata, the images of the sense-spheres, their objects and consciousnesses appear.

original: de'i dbang gis 'byung ngo snyam du dgongs pa ste /🔽sa bon yod kyang sa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'byung ngo snyam du dgongs pa ste / sa bon yod kyang sa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is thought that they arise by the power of that.🔽Because even though the seed exists, the sprout does not arise if there is no earth and so on,

original: myu gu mi skye ba lta bu dang / @257b gzugs yod kyang me long med na gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: myu gu mi skye ba lta bu dang / @257b gzugs yod kyang me long med na gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: and even though form exists, the reflection does not arise if there is no mirror.

original: 'bras bu thams cad skyed pa la de'i spyi'i rgyur khas blangs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lta ba dang lta ba mthun par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad skyed pa la de'i spyi'i rgyur khas blangs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lta ba dang lta ba mthun par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since it is accepted as the general cause of the generation of all effects, doesn’t it follow that the Bhagavat’s view is similar to the views of Īśvara and so on?

original: thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: It does not follow.

original: 'di ltar de skye ba la de'i bdag po'i rkyen tsam nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de skye ba la de'i bdag po'i rkyen tsam nyid yin gyi /
translated: Because it is merely the dominant condition of the generation of the effect,

original: byed pa po nyid ni ma yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po nyid ni ma yin la /
translated: it is not the agent.

original: de ni dus dpag tu med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstsags pa las yang dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni dus dpag tu med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstsags pa las yang dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: And because it is generated from the accumulation of the collections of merit and wisdom over immeasurable time,

original: mi rtag pa yang yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang yin /
translated: it is impermanent.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po yang yin la /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po yang yin la /
translated: It is the agent of Īśvara and so on,

original: ther zug gyi rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid kyang yin pas 'dir ni mi mthun no //
analyzed: ther zug gyi rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid kyang yin pas 'dir ni mi mthun no //
translated: but it is permanent because it is permanent by being immutable.

original: 'o na ni rang gi gzugs brnyan rdzas gzhan med pa'i ltar na /
analyzed: 'o na ni rang gi gzugs brnyan rdzas gzhan med pa'i ltar na /
translated: But if it is like its own reflection, which does not exist as a different substance,

original: de ji ltar dper rung ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar dper rung ste /
translated: how can it be a suitable example?

original: 'di ltar rgyu mtshan du gyur pa me long yod na gzugs nyid de lta bur snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu mtshan du gyur pa me long yod na gzugs nyid de lta bur snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is that when a mirror exists, the form itself appears in that way,

original: de la yang mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa nang na gnas pa nyid de ltar snang ste /
analyzed: de la yang mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa nang na gnas pa nyid de ltar snang ste /
translated: then it is consciousness itself that appears in that way due to the power of the maturation of the latent propensities of manifest clinging.

original: des na 'jig rten gzugs brnyan mthong ngo zhes de snyam du nga rgyal skye'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gzugs brnyan mthong ngo zhes de snyam du nga rgyal skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the world thinks, “I see a reflection.” Thus, pride arises.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snang ngo zhes bshad kyi skye'o zhes ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snang ngo zhes bshad kyi skye'o zhes ni ma bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it appears, but it is not said that it arises.

original: de bzhin du shes bya gzhan yang shes bya nang gi yin par lta ba de 'dra bar lta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya gzhan yang shes bya nang gi yin par lta ba de 'dra bar lta'o //
translated: In the same way, one should see that other objects of knowledge are like that, in that they are objects of knowledge that are internal.

original: 'dra ba mnyam pa ni mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba mnyam pa ni mnyam pa ste /
translated: Similarity is sameness.

original: me long dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor de dag gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam dang rnam par mi rtog pas mnyam mo //
analyzed: me long dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor de dag gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam dang rnam par mi rtog pas mnyam mo //
translated: The circle of the mirror and the circle of the Tathāgata’s mirror-like wisdom are the same, because they are merely the reasons for the arising of reflections and are nonconceptual.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gsum pa yin te /
translated: Therefore means the third cause.

original: de'i phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, it is called mirror wisdom.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nyid gnas yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nyid gnas yin te /
translated: The pure realm of the Dharma is the support,

original: de la dmigs pa'i sgo nas der gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sgo nas der gzhag pa yin no //
translated: because it is established as such by the fact that it is the objective support of that wisdom.

original: der gzhan pas rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: der gzhan pas rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is uninterrupted by other states,

original: 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun gyi rgyun mi 'chad par de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun gyi rgyun mi 'chad par de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is uninterrupted by other states, and it is continuous, because it is continuous as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo mi 'gul te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo mi 'gul te /
translated: It is unmoving and unfluctuating,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i g-yo ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu rgyun gyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i g-yo ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu rgyun gyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: because it is free from all the fluctuations of conceptualization, and because it is always continuous.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa gsum res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir g-yo ba dag yin no //🔽ci'i phyir gzhag ce na sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa @258a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa gsum res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir g-yo ba dag yin no // ci'i phyir gzhag ce na sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa @258a * //
translated: The other three wisdoms are fluctuating, because they are intermittent.

original: dang rnam par byang ba la so sor rtog par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: dang rnam par byang ba la so sor rtog par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: Why is it established? In order to discriminate the addictions and the purification of beings.

original: ci'i phyir so sor brtag ce na sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba bstsal zhing skyed pa'i phyir te kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir so sor brtag ce na sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba bstsal zhing skyed pa'i phyir te kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Why does he investigate? In order to eliminate and generate the afflictions and purification of sentient beings. Affliction is characterized by the afflictions, karma, and birth.

original: de bsal ba ni 'jig pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis dus re zhig dang gtan du spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba ni 'jig pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis dus re zhig dang gtan du spangs pa'o //
translated: Its elimination is its temporary or permanent abandonment by the paths of spiritual practice and the transworldly path.

original: rnam par byang ba ni dge ba gang gis sems can rnams kyi sems rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni dge ba gang gis sems can rnams kyi sems rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Purification is the virtue by which the minds of sentient beings are purified.

original: de bskyed pa ni ji ltar smon pa'i theg pas sa bon 'jog pa dang / gsos 'debs pa dang yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol ba dag tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni ji ltar smon pa'i theg pas sa bon 'jog pa dang / gsos 'debs pa dang yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol ba dag tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Its generation is the planting of the seed of the vehicle in accordance with the aspiration, its nurturing, its maturation, and its liberation.

original: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon par byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na sems can gyi don mdzad pa rnam pa thams cad 'grub par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud kyis
analyzed: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon par byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na sems can gyi don mdzad pa rnam pa thams cad 'grub par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud kyis
translated: They say, “When the tathāgatas were in the state of being bodhisattvas, they had the intention to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings in order to accomplish all the aims of sentient beings.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ji ltar bstsags pa rnams yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pas chos kyi dbyings su 'jog ste /🔽des na de dag spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid du gnas kyang de dag gi dbang gis ji ltar smon lam btab pa bzhin du theg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing 'jug pa'i sems can rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ji ltar bstsags pa rnams yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pas chos kyi dbyings su 'jog ste / des na de dag spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid du gnas kyang de dag gi dbang gis ji ltar smon lam btab pa bzhin du theg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing 'jug pa'i sems can rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon bskyed pa dang /
translated: With that motivation, they were skilled in dedicating the accumulations of merit and wisdom that they gathered to the realm of reality.

original: gsos 'debs pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba dag bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gsos 'debs pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba dag bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although they abide in a state that is free of conceptual elaboration, by their power, in accordance with the prayers that they made, they explain the planting of the seeds of the roots of virtue, their growth, their maturation, and their liberation for sentient beings who follow and engage in the teachings of the vehicles.

original: gsal ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par dag pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral bas khyad par du rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro // rnam par dag pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral bas khyad par du rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear because it is pure by nature.🔽It is pure because it is especially pure, being free from adventitious stains.

original: g-yo ba med pa ni kun nas dri ma rnam par dag pas gnyi ga rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ni kun nas dri ma rnam par dag pas gnyi ga rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unmoving because it is pure in both respects, being pure from the stain of the obscurations.

original: lam ni rnam par dag pa'i dang po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni rnam par dag pa'i dang po'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the path because it is the first of the purities.

original: thal le ni rnam par dang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal le ni rnam par dang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is radiant because it is pure.

original: lhang nge ni g-ya' med pas gnyi ga rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhang nge ni g-ya' med pas gnyi ga rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is bright because it is pure in both respects, being free from the stain of the obscurations.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi dri ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi dri ma yin no //
translated: The obscurations of the afflictions are the stain of the Buddha's gnosis.

original: de bsal ba ni bral ba dang spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de bsal ba ni bral ba dang spangs pa ste /
translated: Its removal is the freedom from and abandonment of that.

original: de'i phyir ram 'di la dri ma bsal ba de yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ram 'di la dri ma bsal ba de yod na /
translated: Therefore, or because that removal of stain exists in it,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes shin tu sbyangs pa yin no zhes bya bar @258b sbyar ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes shin tu sbyangs pa yin no zhes bya bar @258b sbyar ro //
translated: the mirror-like gnosis is extremely purified.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs rtag tu kun du 'byung ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs rtag tu kun du 'byung ba rnams yin te /
translated: This obscuration of the mental afflictions is the constant occurrence of the mental afflictions such as passion, the entanglements, and the latent propensities in a manner that overwhelms them.

original: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an obscuration because it obstructs the arising of the ārya path.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
translated: The obscuration to knowledge is a non-afflicted nescience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bgegs yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bgegs yin no //
