translated: It is an obscuration because it obstructs the knowledge of everything.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not an obscuration to nirvāṇa,

original: de yod kyang nyan thos la sogs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang nyan thos la sogs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one can see that śrāvakas and so on attain nirvāṇa even though it exists.

original: sgrib pa de nyid dri ma yin te ye shes rnam par dag pa skye ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa de nyid dri ma yin te ye shes rnam par dag pa skye ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very obscuration is a stain because it obstructs the arising of pure knowledge.

original: de bsal ba ni bral ba ste /
analyzed: de bsal ba ni bral ba ste /
translated: Its removal is freedom,

original: gnyen po rnyed pas glo bur ba yang gtan du mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen po rnyed pas glo bur ba yang gtan du mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: because the adventitious is forever destroyed by the attainment of the antidote.

original: sgrib pa de dang bral bas de'i tshe me long lta bu'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag cing shin tu sbyangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa de dang bral bas de'i tshe me long lta bu'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag cing shin tu sbyangs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is free from that obstruction, at that time mirror-like wisdom is extremely pure and extremely purified.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: der brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su bzung ba de de la brten pa ni der brten pa'o //
analyzed: der brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su bzung ba de de la brten pa ni der brten pa'o //
translated: That meditative stabilization which is based on that is based on that.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes de la ste /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes de la ste /
translated: That is mirror-like wisdom.

original: de la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises in dependence on that.

original: 'di na re brten pa yang yin la ting nge 'dzin yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di na re brten pa yang yin la ting nge 'dzin yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Here, it is a compound: it is based on and it is meditative stabilization.

original: yang na ye shes ting nge 'dzin de la brten pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ye shes ting nge 'dzin de la brten pa ste /
translated: Or, that wisdom is based on meditative stabilization,

original: de'i mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba'i lam ches rnam par dag pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba'i lam ches rnam par dag pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path of liberation which is extremely pure arises immediately after that.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par de ni rdo rje lta bu yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par de ni rdo rje lta bu yin te /
translated: That special meditative stabilization is like a vajra,

original: de'i stobs kyis sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir ro //🔽de yongs su gzung ba'am des ye shes te /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir ro // de yongs su gzung ba'am des ye shes te /
translated: because it abandons obstructions by the power of that.

original: yongs su gzung ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba ste /
translated: That is the retention, or the wisdom of that retention.

original: de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises immediately after that.

original: de'i stobs kyis me long lta bu'i ye shes shin tu yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis me long lta bu'i ye shes shin tu yongs su dag pa /
translated: By its power, the mirror-­like wisdom, which is very pure,

original: rnam par rtog par gyur pa'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par gyur pa'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: arises, free from conceptual thought, and having the nature of the reflection of all things.

original: gsal ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gsal ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: It is clear by its very nature.

original: rnam par dang ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dang ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it is free from the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: rnyog pa med pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unclouded because it is free from the obscurations of the knowable.

original: lam me ba ni gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lam me ba ni gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is radiant because it is clear,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pure by its very nature.

original: thal le lhang nge ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thal le lhang nge ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is bright and shining because it is free from the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable,

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: respectively.🔽It is proper to say that the mirror is radiant because it is clear,

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor gdong gi skyon dang / yon tan kun ston pa'i phyir legs par phyis pa ni snang ba'i phyir lam me zhes byar rung na /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor gdong gi skyon dang / yon tan kun ston pa'i phyir legs par phyis pa ni snang ba'i phyir lam me zhes byar rung na /
translated: since it reflects the good and bad aspects of the face.

original: de go mi snang ba yin na ji ltar shin tu sbyangs pa @259a * //🔽lam me zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de go mi snang ba yin na ji ltar shin tu sbyangs pa @259a * // lam me zhes bya zhe na /
translated: clear?

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because it accomplishes all the activities of all sentient beings.🔽Even though it is not apparent, it is clear because the emanation body

original: de mi snang du zin kyang de'i dbang gis 'byung ba sprul pa'i skus sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad sgrub pas de snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de mi snang du zin kyang de'i dbang gis 'byung ba sprul pa'i skus sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad sgrub pas de snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: that arises from it accomplishes all the activities of all sentient beings.

original: des na 'bras bu'i sgo nas de la lam me thal le lhang nge'o //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i sgo nas de la lam me thal le lhang nge'o //
translated: Therefore, from the point of view of the effect, it is very clear, bright, and🔽radiant.🔽The surface of a mirror is the basis for the arising of a consciousness

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor yang de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ba kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor yang de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ba kho na'i phyir te /
translated: that has its aspect, but it is not the cause of the arising of that consciousness.

original: de skad du tha snyad gdags kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //🔽gal te shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin na /
analyzed: de skad du tha snyad gdags kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // gal te shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin na /
translated: This is the way that it is conventionally designated, but not otherwise.🔽If it is the basis for the arising of a consciousness, then why does it not

original: de'i rnam pa tha dad par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur rgyu mtshan rtag tu nye ba'i phyir de la rag lus te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa tha dad par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur rgyu mtshan rtag tu nye ba'i phyir de la rag lus te /
translated: always arise, since the basis is always there?

original: skye ba'i shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams srog chags thams cad la cig car dang rtag tu skye bar thal bar yang ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams srog chags thams cad la cig car dang rtag tu skye bar thal bar yang ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the case that the reflections of consciousnesses that arise would arise simultaneously and always for all sentient beings?

original: 'di lta ste dper na /🔽me long gi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs kyi rkyen la ltos nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na / me long gi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs kyi rkyen la ltos nas /
translated: It is like this.

original: gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur /🔽yang gzugs brnyan tha dad par yang mi 'gyur la /🔽gzugs brnyan rtag tu 'byung bar yang mi byed de /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur / yang gzugs brnyan tha dad par yang mi 'gyur la / gzugs brnyan rtag tu 'byung bar yang mi byed de /
translated: The surface of a mirror is the cause for the arising of various reflections in dependence on the conditions of form.

original: gzugs kyi rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the reflections do not become different and it does not cause the arising of reflections all the time because it depends on the conditions of form.

original: de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang sems can gyi dus kyi rkyen la ltos nas shes bya'i gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur yang sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang sems can gyi dus kyi rkyen la ltos nas shes bya'i gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur yang sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, mirrorlike wisdom is the cause for the arising of various reflections of objects of knowledge in dependence on the conditions of sentient beings, but it is not different from them, like blue and so on.

original: de tha dad pas rnam pa yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de tha dad pas rnam pa yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because it is not different, its aspects do not change.

original: sems can rnams kyi shes pa skye ba'i dus kyi rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir thams cad la shes pa'i gzugs brnyan cig car dang rtag tu skyed par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi shes pa skye ba'i dus kyi rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir thams cad la shes pa'i gzugs brnyan cig car dang rtag tu skyed par yang mi byed do //
translated: because they depend on the conditions of the arising of the consciousnesses of sentient beings, they do not produce the reflections of consciousnesses simultaneously and constantly in all things.

original: gal te shes pa de dag yong na ni ji ltar na de la brten te skye /
analyzed: gal te shes pa de dag yong na ni ji ltar na de la brten te skye /
translated: If those consciousnesses exist, how can they arise in dependence on them?

original: 'on te med na ni shes pa med pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis ye shes ji ltar rtsol ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te med na ni shes pa med pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis ye shes ji ltar rtsol ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if they do not exist, how can the transcendent awareness be effortless, since it has as its causal ground the arising of a consciousness that does not exist?

original: bum pa la sogs pa med pa'i skye ba'i rgyu mtshan rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i shes pa rtsol ba nyid ni mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa med pa'i skye ba'i rgyu mtshan rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i shes pa rtsol ba nyid ni mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: We see that the consciousnesses of potters, etc., are not effortless, since they have as their causal ground the arising of pots, etc., that do not exist.

original: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor rgyu mtshan du gyur pa la rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma nyid yin pa'o //🔽rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rigs tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor rgyu mtshan du gyur pa la rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma nyid yin pa'o // rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rigs tha dad pa ste /
translated: In a mirror, etc., the many aspects are the many forms, and the variety of aspects is the variety of types.

original: rigs mthun pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The variety of types is the variety of kinds, since they are dependent on the same kind.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba ni grangs phal che bas so //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba ni grangs phal che bas so //
translated: Again, many is in terms of the majority.🔽Having eliminated singularity, it is called many.

original: gcig nyid rnam par bcad nas rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba smos la rigs tha dad pa dang / @259b phal che ba la ltos nas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gcig nyid rnam par bcad nas rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba smos la rigs tha dad pa dang / @259b phal che ba la ltos nas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In terms of different types and the majority, it is called various.

original: gzugs brnyan skye ba de la me long gi dkyil 'khor de rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan skye ba de la me long gi dkyil 'khor de rtsol ba ste /
translated: In that arising of the reflection, the surface of the mirror is the cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang med do //
translated: It is also without conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes rgyu mtshan du gyur pa la rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa dang / grangs phal che ba la ltos nas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes rgyu mtshan du gyur pa la rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa dang / grangs phal che ba la ltos nas te /
translated: Similarly, in mirror-like wisdom, which is the cause, the various aspects and so on are in terms of being of the same type, being of different types, and the majority.

original: de ltar med pa kho na'i shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams 'byung yang /
analyzed: de ltar med pa kho na'i shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams 'byung yang /
translated: Although those non-existent appearances of consciousness arise,

original: de rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: de rtsol ba ste /
translated: that is the cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang med do //
translated: It is also without conceptualization.

original: 'di skad du dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor rnam par rtog pa med par gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtsol ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor rnam par rtog pa med par gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtsol ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is said that just as the surface of a mirror is the cause of the appearance of various reflections without conceptualization, so also mirror-like intuition is the cause of the appearance of various reflections of objects of knowledge without the conditioning of conceptualization, such as the postulation of “I” and “mine” and the postulation of objective and subjective.

original: gal te shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams dang 'brel na de'i phyir de dag tha dad na de ji ltar tha dad pa ma yin /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams dang 'brel na de'i phyir de dag tha dad na de ji ltar tha dad pa ma yin /
translated: If it is related to the reflections of objects of knowledge, then, since they are different, how can it be non-different?

original: 'on te ma 'brel na ni ji ltar na ni rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma 'brel na ni ji ltar na ni rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin te /
translated: But if it is not related, how can it be the cause of them?

original: 'bras bu dang ma 'brel ba'i sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin pa yang ma mthong la rdo thal la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyang de dag bsal ba thabs kyi dngos por mi🔽'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ma 'brel ba'i sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin pa yang ma mthong la rdo thal la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyang de dag bsal ba thabs kyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Nor do the sun’s rays, which are not associated with molten iron and so on, become the things that are the means of removing them.

original: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin yang de dag 'byung ba'i sngon rol na med pa nyid kyis mi nye ba'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin yang de dag 'byung ba'i sngon rol na med pa nyid kyis mi nye ba'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: For example, the surface of a mirror is the reason for the appearance of a reflection, but it is not associated with it because it does not exist prior to the appearance of the reflection.

original: nye ba dang mi nye ba gnyis ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi nye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba dang mi nye ba gnyis ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro // mi nye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with it because it is neither near nor far.

original: de dag 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not far because it is the thing that is the reason for the appearance of the reflection.

original: de yod na de dag yod pa gang yin pa de nyid 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: de yod na de dag yod pa gang yin pa de nyid 'brel ba yin te /
translated: That which exists when it exists is precisely the connection.

original: de dag gi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por gyur pas de tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por gyur pas de tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not different from it because it becomes the thing that is the reason for it.

original: de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin yang /
translated: Likewise, mirror wisdom is the cause of the arising of reflections of consciousness,

original: de dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: but it is neither endowed with them nor not endowed with them.

original: de dag dang mi nye ba dag dang bsnyil ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang mi nye ba dag dang bsnyil ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of phenomena to be neither near nor distant and to be free of forgetfulness.

original: de dag 'byung ba'i sngon rol na med pa nyid kyis mi nye ba'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin la /🔽bsnyel ba mi mnga' @260a * //
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba'i sngon rol na med pa nyid kyis mi nye ba'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin la / bsnyel ba mi mnga' @260a * //
translated: It is not endowed with them because they are not near it, since they do not exist prior to their arising.

original: ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not not endowed with them because it is the nature of phenomena to be free of forgetfulness.

original: de yod na de dag gi shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams 'byung la med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de dag gi shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams 'byung la med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when it exists, the reflections of consciousness of those arise and when it does not exist, they do not.

original: bsnyel ba ni 'jigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsnyel ba ni 'jigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Forgetfulness is the absence of fear.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of forgetfulness is existence.

original: yang na dmigs pa mi brjed pa ni bsnyel pa mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa mi brjed pa ni bsnyel pa mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: Or, the absence of forgetfulness of the focal object.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i tshogs mtha' dag rang gi ngo bo bzhin pa de la rab tu gsal te srog chags thams cad kyi dus gsum pa'i shes pa yang des thugs su ma chud par mi skye'i /🔽thugs su chud pa kho nas skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i tshogs mtha' dag rang gi ngo bo bzhin pa de la rab tu gsal te srog chags thams cad kyi dus gsum pa'i shes pa yang des thugs su ma chud par mi skye'i / thugs su chud pa kho nas skye'o //
translated: Thus, the entire collection of objects of knowledge is clearly manifest to it, just as they are in themselves. The consciousnesses of all living beings arise only through understanding it, not without understanding it.

original: de'i phyir shes bya mtha' dag bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya mtha' dag bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is not endowed with them, because it is the nature of the nonloss of all objects of knowledge.

original: de dag 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por gyur pas tha dad par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por gyur pas tha dad par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it becomes different through being the basis of the appearance of those.

original: me long lta bu kho nar tha dad pa med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu kho nar tha dad pa med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is only like a mirror, because it appears without difference.

original: 'di skad du dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor gzugs brnyan rnams dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i bye brag gis 'dus te reg pas dben yang dag 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ba de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang de gnyis
analyzed: 'di skad du dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor gzugs brnyan rnams dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i bye brag gis 'dus te reg pas dben yang dag 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ba de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang de gnyis
translated: In this way, just as a mirror is the basis of the appearance of reflections without being differentiated by the distinction of being endowed with or not being endowed with reflections, in the same way, mirrorlike wisdom is the basis of the appearance of all objects of knowledge without being differentiated by the distinction of being endowed with or not being endowed with them.

original: ka'i ngo bo'i bye brag gis 'dus te reg pas dben yang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ka'i ngo bo'i bye brag gis 'dus te reg pas dben yang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that even though they are devoid of contact in the sense of a coming together of the entities that are the causes of the appearance of the reflections of objects in consciousness, they are still entities in the sense of being the causes of the arising of effects.

original: sa bon la sogs pa yang 'bras bu dang gnyis kar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag ste 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur la /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa yang 'bras bu dang gnyis kar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag ste 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur la /
translated: Seeds, etc., are also entities in the sense of being the causes of the arising of effects, even though they are not described as being both cause and effect.

original: snang ba'i yan lag kyang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i yan lag kyang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The factor of illumination is not even associated with form, etc.,

original: de nye ba las gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i blo dag rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: de nye ba las gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i blo dag rab tu skye'o //
translated: but the cognition that has the aspect of form, etc., arises from its presence.

original: de bas na thams cad du yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i 'dus te reg pas dben par rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por mthong gi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phrad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa ni med do //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad du yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i 'dus te reg pas dben par rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por mthong gi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phrad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa ni med do //
translated: Thus, in all cases, the entities that are causes are seen to be devoid of contact in the sense of a coming together of the entities that are the causes and effects, but they are not devoid of the quality of being causes. There is no association in the sense of a cause and effect having contact with each other.

original: ngos thams cad nas legs par phyis pa ni dngos po yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sgrub pa'i thabs kyis ngos thams cad nas legs par phyis pa'o //🔽kun nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni 'dun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngos thams cad nas legs par phyis pa ni dngos po yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sgrub pa'i thabs kyis ngos thams cad nas legs par phyis pa'o // kun nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni 'dun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is purified, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unobscured, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unlimited, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is purified, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unobscured, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unlimited, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is purified, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unobscured, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unlimited, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is purified, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unobscured, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.

original: rnam pa yongs su ma chad cing tshad med pa shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa yongs su chad pa ni yul gyi sgo nas yongs @260b su chad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa yongs su ma chad cing tshad med pa shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa yongs su chad pa ni yul gyi sgo nas yongs @260b su chad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unlimited, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is purified, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unobscured, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.

original: rnam pa tshad med pa'i dus kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: rnam pa tshad med pa'i dus kyi sgo nas te /
translated: It is unlimited, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is purified, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unobscured, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.🔽It is unlimited, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all knowables.

original: thams cad du dang rtag tu dri ma'i rnyog pa thams cad las dben pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du dang rtag tu dri ma'i rnyog pa thams cad las dben pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is purified, because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection of all know

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Extreme Agility is the cause of the elimination of all obscurations by the special meditative concentration as previously explained.

original: nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni rang gi theg pas nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir la /🔽ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni theg pa chen po'am /
analyzed: nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni rang gi theg pas nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir la / ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni theg pa chen po'am /
translated: Those of the definite lineage are caused to go forth by their own vehicle.

original: cig shos kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: cig shos kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Those of the indefinite lineage are caused to attain complete nirvana by the universal vehicle or by the other vehicle.

original: mngon sum dang brgyud nas rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i khyad par gyis 'byung ba'i lam skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang brgyud nas rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i khyad par gyis 'byung ba'i lam skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of the path of progress is the special maturation of one's own roots of virtue, whether direct or indirect.

original: kun nas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: The word all refers to the extreme agility of all meditative concentrations.

original: yang na phyogs thams cad na ste /
analyzed: yang na phyogs thams cad na ste /
translated: Alternatively, it refers to all directions,

original: de la phyogs gang gis shes pa'i gzugs brnyan skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs 'ga' yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs gang gis shes pa'i gzugs brnyan skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs 'ga' yang med pa'o //
translated: since there is no direction whatsoever that is not the cause of the appearance of the image of knowledge.

original: 'o na me long lta bu kho nar gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na me long lta bu kho nar gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the mirror is the reason that reflections arise,

original: tshad yongs su chad par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshad yongs su chad par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: it follows that the mirror would have a limited size.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: dper na me long sa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin yang me long chung ngu la yang ri la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan chen po dang mang po dag dmigs pas /
analyzed: dper na me long sa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin yang me long chung ngu la yang ri la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan chen po dang mang po dag dmigs pas /
translated: for example, although a mirror is the basis for the arising of reflections of forms such as mountains, a large reflection of a mountain and many reflections can be seen in a small mirror.

original: de dag gi tshad kyang med la me long gi dkyil 'khor yang /
analyzed: de dag gi tshad kyang med la me long gi dkyil 'khor yang /
translated: The size of those reflections is not the size of the mirror’s surface.

original: grangs kyi tshad dam lus kyi tshad de dag tshad du mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs brnyan thams cad skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin yang /
analyzed: grangs kyi tshad dam lus kyi tshad de dag tshad du mi 'gyur ro // de bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs brnyan thams cad skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin yang /
translated: The number of reflections is not the number of the bodies of those reflected.🔽Similarly, mirrorlike wisdom is the basis for the arising of all mundane and transcendent reflections,

original: yul gyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: yul gyi sgo nas sam /
translated: but it is not the case that it has the number of objects or the size of those objects.

original: grangs kyi sgo nas tshad yongs su chad pa 'ga' yang med de lus tshad med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i grangs kyi bye brag tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs kyi sgo nas tshad yongs su chad pa 'ga' yang med de lus tshad med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i grangs kyi bye brag tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no limit to the number of bodies, because there is no limit to the number of bodies, and because the number of bodies does not vary according to the number of causes.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pas sangs rgyas rnams ni shes pa'i 'byung gnas chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pas sangs rgyas rnams ni shes pa'i 'byung gnas chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the Buddhas are called the great source of knowledge, because they are the source of mundane and supramundane knowledge.

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi gnas kyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir shes pa'i 'byung gnas chen po zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi gnas kyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir shes pa'i 'byung gnas chen po zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are called the great source of knowledge because they possess the knowledge which is the basis of all forms of knowledge.”

original: gal te de theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin na de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nye ba'i @261a * //
analyzed: gal te de theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin na de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nye ba'i @261a * //
translated: If the Buddhas are the basis for the arising of knowledge, because they cause the three vehicles to go forth, then why is it that knowledge does not arise when one sees a Pratyekabuddha or a Buddha?

original: phyir mu stegs can rnams la yang dag pa'i shes pa ji ltar mi skye de'i phyir de dag la phyin ci log med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir mu stegs can rnams la yang dag pa'i shes pa ji ltar mi skye de'i phyir de dag la phyin ci log med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Why do correct cognitions not arise for tīrthikas? Therefore, it follows that they would not have error.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the reason for that.

original: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor ni rtsig pa la sogs pa gzugs gzhan gyis bsgribs pa'i gzugs rnams la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang sems can grogs po ngan pas yongs su zin pa dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pas bsgribs pa dag la dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i phyir shes pa'am gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du
analyzed: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor ni rtsig pa la sogs pa gzugs gzhan gyis bsgribs pa'i gzugs rnams la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro // de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang sems can grogs po ngan pas yongs su zin pa dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pas bsgribs pa dag la dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i phyir shes pa'am gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du
translated: For example, a mirror does not become the reason for the arising of reflections of forms that are obscured by other forms such as walls.

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the tathāgatas’ mirrorlike gnosis does not become the reason for the arising of knowledge or reflections of the sublime Dharma for sentient beings who are seized by bad friends and obscured by listening to the non-Dharma.

original: de'i mu stegs can rnams la 'phags pa'i lam mi skye bas phyin ci log rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i mu stegs can rnams la 'phags pa'i lam mi skye bas phyin ci log rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the ārya path does not arise for tīrthikas, errors arise.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi rkyen gyis bsgribs pa dag ni mi 'byung ba ltar nang gi ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa dag la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi rkyen gyis bsgribs pa dag ni mi 'byung ba ltar nang gi ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa dag la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when the external conditions are obscured, they do not occur. It is the same for those obscured by the darkness of internal ignorance.

original: de bzhin du rkyen gnyis ka'i stobs kyis dam pa'i chos spong ba'i lam gang yin pa de ni dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkyen gnyis ka'i stobs kyis dam pa'i chos spong ba'i lam gang yin pa de ni dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las yin no //
translated: Similarly, the karma that leads to the loss of the true Dharma through the power of both conditions is the karma that leads to the loss of the true Dharma.

original: des bsgribs na yun ring por yang dam pa'i chos mnyan pa mi rnyed de des bsgribs pa de nyid phongs pa yin no //
analyzed: des bsgribs na yun ring por yang dam pa'i chos mnyan pa mi rnyed de des bsgribs pa de nyid phongs pa yin no //
translated: When obscured by that, one does not obtain the hearing of the true Dharma for a long time. That obscuration itself is the loss.

original: ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu dam pa'i chos mnyan pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu dam pa'i chos mnyan pa med pa yin /
translated: How is the result of that the non-existence of hearing the true Dharma?

original: mnyan pa med pa ni brjod par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mnyan pa med pa ni brjod par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is nothing to be expressed in the non-existence of hearing, it is said.

original: de nyid 'bras bu yin no zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu yin no zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that is itself the result.

original: 'on kyang dam pa'i chos mnyan mi nus pa'i lus thob ste dbang po ma tshang ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dam pa'i chos mnyan mi nus pa'i lus thob ste dbang po ma tshang ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: However, one obtains a body that is unable to hear the true Dharma, with incomplete faculties and so on.

original: 'dod pa can ma yin pa dag ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can sa bon med pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa can ma yin pa dag ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can sa bon med pa rnams te /
translated: Those who are not desirous are those who are not subject to complete nirvana, those who are seedless.

original: de dag thams cad kyang rgyud yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir /🔽dus re zhig dang / gtan du snod ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rgyud yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir / dus re zhig dang / gtan du snod ma yin pa dag go //
translated: And all of them are temporarily or permanently unfit vessels, because their mindstreams are impure.🔽Just as the reflection of the orb of the moon does not appear in a vessel of water that is disturbed by wind, so also the image of the Dharma does not appear in the minds of those who are disturbed by the wind of distraction.🔽Just as the reflection of the orb of the moon does not appear in a vessel of water that is covered by mud, so also the image of the Dharma does not appear in the minds of those who are covered by the mud of error.

original: dper na 'dam rdzab la sogs pas rnyog par byas pa'i chu'i snod kyi nang du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin du ye shes de yang de dag la shes pa skye'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na 'dam rdzab la sogs pas rnyog par byas pa'i chu'i snod kyi nang du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin du ye shes de yang de dag la shes pa skye'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the reflection of the orb of the moon does not appear in a vessel of water that is covered by thick darkness, so also the image of the Dharma does not appear in the minds of those who are covered by the darkness of nescience.🔽Just as the reflection of the orb of the moon does not appear in a vessel of water that is covered by frost, so also the image of the Dharma does not appear in the minds of those who are covered by the frost of heedlessness.🔽Just as the reflection of the orb of the moon does not appear in a vessel of water that is broken, so also the image of the Dharma does not appear in the minds of those who are broken by the faults of immorality.🔽Just as the reflection of the orb of the moon does not appear in a vessel of water that is small, so also the image of the Dharma does not appear in the minds of those who are smallminded.🔽Just as the reflection of the orb of the moon does not appear in a vessel of water that is polluted by impurities, so also the image of the Dharma does not appear in the minds of those who are polluted by the impurities of passion, etc.

original: 'dis ni de ma yin pa'i shes pa dag las me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi khyad par rnam pa brgyad bshad de /
analyzed: 'dis ni de ma yin pa'i shes pa dag las me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi khyad par rnam pa brgyad bshad de /
translated: This explains the eight specific distinctions of mirror wisdom from other kinds of knowledge.

original: nges pa'i tshig dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / sgrib @261b pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / nga'i yongs su 'dzin par med pa dang shes bya thams cad bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba dang /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / sgrib @261b pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / nga'i yongs su 'dzin par med pa dang shes bya thams cad bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba dang /
translated: the etymological definition, the absence of conceptualization, the purification of obscurations, the reason for the arising of the reflection of knowledge, the absence of my appropriation, the nonforgetting of all objects of knowledge,

original: thams cad du rtag tu 'byung ba dang / shes pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas dang / snod ma yin pa dag la 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rtag tu 'byung ba dang / shes pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas dang / snod ma yin pa dag la 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ma yin pa'o //
translated: the constant arising everywhere, the source of all knowledge, and the nonexistence of the reason for arising in those who are not vessels.

original: snod ma yin pa de dag kyang gsum yin te /
analyzed: snod ma yin pa de dag kyang gsum yin te /
translated: Those who are not vessels are of three types.

original: mi dge ba'i grogs po dang phrad pas dam pa ma yin pa'i chos ma nyan pas bsgribs pas dus de dag tu snod ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gang dag nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa rnams dang / gang dag las kyi sgrib pa mi bzad pas bsgribs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i grogs po dang phrad pas dam pa ma yin pa'i chos ma nyan pas bsgribs pas dus de dag tu snod ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gang dag nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa rnams dang / gang dag las kyi sgrib pa mi bzad pas bsgribs pa rnams dang /
translated: Those who are not vessels at those times due to the obscuration of not listening to the teaching of the sublime ones due to encountering nonvirtuous friends, those who are obscured by the obscuration of affliction, and those who are obscured by the unbearable obscuration of karma.

original: sa bon med pa rnams yun ring po dang dus thams cad du snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon med pa rnams yun ring po dang dus thams cad du snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who lack the seed are not a proper vessel for a long time and at all times.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni sa bcu bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa rnam pa bcu las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni sa bcu bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa rnam pa bcu las rig par bya'o //
translated: The gnosis of sameness should be known as the result of cultivating the ten stages, from the ten aspects of perfect accomplishment.

original: mtshan rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan thams cad kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dben par mnyam par skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gang dag yin pa de dag mtshan med par de bzhin gshegs pas bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan thams cad kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dben par mnyam par skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gang dag yin pa de dag mtshan med par de bzhin gshegs pas bstan te /
translated: The sameness of the marks is that all the marks of a great being are the same in being devoid of the imaginary characteristics of marks. The Tathāgata has taught that those marks of a great being are without marks.

original: des na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore they are called the marks of a great being.

original: bdag po ni dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: bdag po ni dbang phyug ste /
translated: The master is the almighty one.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni so sor dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni so sor dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The aggregates of form and so on are not each almighty.

original: chos rnams ni rang bzhin mi 'dor bas de dag 'dus pa yang de'i bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams ni rang bzhin mi 'dor bas de dag 'dus pa yang de'i bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since things do not abandon their intrinsic nature, it is not tenable that their collection has that nature.

original: de dag lam gtogs pa'i gang zag gi rdzas kyang med pas de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag pos dben pa thams cad kyi bdag pa mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag lam gtogs pa'i gang zag gi rdzas kyang med pas de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag pos dben pa thams cad kyi bdag pa mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Since there is no substance of a person included in the path, therefore, it is the sameness of nature of all things, which are devoid of the imagined self.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das de la bdag ni phyug pa'am dbul ba gang yang ma mchis so snyam bgyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das de la bdag ni phyug pa'am dbul ba gang yang ma mchis so snyam bgyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “Blessed One, I think that I am neither rich nor poor.”

original: dga' ba ni yid bde ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid bde ba ste /
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction.

original: de'i gnas kyi chos rnams la ni kun du rtog pa'i dbang gis dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi chos rnams la ni kun du rtog pa'i dbang gis dga' ba skye'o //
translated: The dharmas that are its basis give rise to joy through the power of imagination.

original: de las bzlog pa dag la ni yid mi bde ba skye'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dag la ni yid mi bde ba skye'o //
translated: The opposite of that gives rise to mental dissatisfaction.

original: de dag med pas sems can thams cad la kun brtags pa'i dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir dga' ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag med pas sems can thams cad la kun brtags pa'i dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir dga' ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Since those do not exist, it is the sameness of joy because all sentient beings are devoid of imagined joy.

original: mtshan dang bdag po dang dga' ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan dang bdag po dang dga' ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of characteristics, nature, and joy.

original: khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: Comprehension is realization.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po kho na la de @262a * //🔽khong du chud do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po kho na la de @262a * // khong du chud do //
translated: It is comprehended just on the first bodhisattva stage.🔽It is comprehended on the higher stages by the method of the distinction of cultivation.

original: sa gong ma gong ma bsgom par khyad zhugs pa'i tshul gyis mtha' sangs rgyas kyi sa la phul du phyin pa brnyes te /
analyzed: sa gong ma gong ma bsgom par khyad zhugs pa'i tshul gyis mtha' sangs rgyas kyi sa la phul du phyin pa brnyes te /
translated: The ultimate is attained on the Buddha stage.

original: de las lhag pa yongs su grub pa ni med pas yongs su grub pa des mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las lhag pa yongs su grub pa ni med pas yongs su grub pa des mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since there is no further perfection beyond that, one should know that the perfection of the knowledge of sameness is perfected by that perfection.

original: yongs su grub pa las ni yongs su grub pas te thams cad du gsum pa'i gnas su mnga' bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa las ni yongs su grub pas te thams cad du gsum pa'i gnas su mnga' bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of the knowledge of achieving activities is perfected by the perfection of the knowledge of achieving activities, because it is employed everywhere in the third stage.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te nang gi dang phyi'i'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te nang gi dang phyi'i'o //
translated: Dependent origination is twofold: internal and external.

original: nang gi ni ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: nang gi ni ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The internal is the twelve members beginning with ignorance.

original: phyi'i ni 'di yod na ni 'di 'byung 'di med na 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyu yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba de /
analyzed: phyi'i ni 'di yod na ni 'di 'byung 'di med na 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyu yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba de /
translated: The external is the principle that when this exists, that comes to be, and when this does not exist, that does not come to be.

original: 'di lta ste sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: For example, if there is a seed, a sprout arises.

original: nang gi ni lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rnam par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i yan lag rnams la nye bar btags te bsgoms la phyi'i yang rgyu yod na 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgoms te /
analyzed: nang gi ni lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rnam par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i yan lag rnams la nye bar btags te bsgoms la phyi'i yang rgyu yod na 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgoms te /
translated: The internal is cultivated by way of the limbs of affliction and purification in the forward and reverse orders. The external is cultivated by way of the statement, “If a cause exists, an effect arises.”

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad la yang gang gi tshe g-yo ba med pa'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don dang / stong ba'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don du mthong ba de'i tshe 'di de'i ngo bor nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad la yang gang gi tshe g-yo ba med pa'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don dang / stong ba'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don du mthong ba de'i tshe 'di de'i ngo bor nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: When one sees all dependent originations as the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of emptiness, and the meaning of the absence of a person, one experiences them as their nature.

original: myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one experiences them.

original: de mnyam pa nyid ni g-yo ba med pa nyid dang gang zag med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas dben pa nyid de /
analyzed: de mnyam pa nyid ni g-yo ba med pa nyid dang gang zag med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas dben pa nyid de /
translated: Its sameness is its non-fluctuation, its non-personhood, its emptiness, its selflessness, and its isolation as the imagined dependent origination.

original: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid de lta bur khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid de lta bur khong du chud pa'o //
translated: It is the reality of dependent origination of all things, and it is the comprehension of that.

original: yongs su grub pa las ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa las ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The perfected nature is as before.

original: ji skad du tshangs pa chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du tshangs pa chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: As it is said, “Brahman, all things are dependently arisen.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud pa ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud pa ni byang chub ste /
translated: The comprehension of dependent origination is enlightenment.🔽Brahman, all things are just as they are seen by the Tathagata. ”

original: tshangs pa de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ji lta bur gzigs pa ltar chos rnams ni de lta bu lo na yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgrar btags nas rten
analyzed: tshangs pa de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ji lta bur gzigs pa ltar chos rnams ni de lta bu lo na yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgrar btags nas rten
translated: And, “The reality of dependent origination is designated by the term dependent origination.

original: cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni cung zad kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa lta @262b bu'o //
analyzed: cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni cung zad kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa lta @262b bu'o //
translated: I do not see any dharma that is not included in dependent origination.

original: de nyid la dgongs nas sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba des chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nyid la dgongs nas sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba des chos mthong ngo //
translated: With that in mind, it is said, “Whoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: sus chos mthong bas sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sus chos mthong bas sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma sees the Buddha.”

original: don dam pa'i chos dang don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos dang don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the ultimate Dharma and the ultimate Buddha.

original: de ni thams cad du tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du tha dad pa med do //
translated: It is not differentiated in any way.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung bas ni gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid dben par gyur cing ma 'brel pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung bas ni gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid dben par gyur cing ma 'brel pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The general characteristics of those are the characteristics of form and so on, which are distinct and unrelated, such as “Form is characterized by being suitable as form,” and so on.

original: de la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the nature of superimposition, it is not the specific characteristic.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid dang mi mthun zhing mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid dang mi mthun zhing mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra ba dag yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not in accordance with the characteristics and are not similar to the characteristics.

original: yang de dag gi mtshan nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de dag gi mtshan nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: mtshan nyid med pa nyid mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa nyid mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The absence of characteristics is the characteristic.

original: chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “All dharmas are of one characteristic, the absence of characteristics.”

original: chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i mtshan kyis dben par mnyam pa khong du chud pa yongs su grub pa las so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i mtshan kyis dben par mnyam pa khong du chud pa yongs su grub pa las so //
translated: The realization of the equality of all dharmas, which is the emptiness of all conceptually elaborated signs, is the perfected nature.

original: byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Loving kindness is threefold:

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: that which has sentient beings as its object, that which has the dharmas as its object, and that which has no object.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa rnams kyi byams pa ni sems can rnams la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa rnams kyi byams pa ni sems can rnams la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The loving kindness of the bodhisattvas who have generated the first generation of the thought of enlightenment has sentient beings as its object.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: It is contaminated because it has as its object the conventional.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni chos la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni chos la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The objective support of bodhisattvas who have entered the stage of action is the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po bstan pa'i chos kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bstan pa'i chos kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
translated: It is only impure because it has the Dharma that teaches the Mahayana as its object.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: The objective support of bodhisattvas who have attained the receptivity to the nonarising of all things is nonapprehended.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par smin par gyur pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par smin par gyur pa /
translated: It is like the eye, etc., in being the maturation of karma.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa chos kyi dbyings kyi yul can dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa chos kyi dbyings kyi yul can dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: It is the objective support of the knowledge of sameness that occurs without prior mental effort. It is nonapprehended because it has the realm of Dharma as its object and is devoid of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called nonapprehended because it is devoid of conceptualization and because it does not apprehend any thing.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i byams pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyis la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la rnam pa thams cad yongs su grub cing rtag tu ldan pa @263a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i byams pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyis la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la rnam pa thams cad yongs su grub cing rtag tu ldan pa @263a * //
translated: That very love associated with the gnosis of sameness is fully accomplished in the Buddha and is always present in the Tathagatas.

original: yin no // byams pa gzhan gnyis ma smos kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la 'grub bo //
analyzed: yin no // byams pa gzhan gnyis ma smos kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la 'grub bo //
translated: Although the other two kinds of love are not mentioned, they are accomplished in the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byams pa rnam pa gsum ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i rnam pa yin gyi bde ba nye bar sgrub pa ni rnam pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byams pa rnam pa gsum ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i rnam pa yin gyi bde ba nye bar sgrub pa ni rnam pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: The three kinds of love of the Tathagata are of the aspect of protecting all sentient beings, not just of the aspect of bringing about their happiness.

original: sems can mthun pa dag dang mi mthun pa dag dang / mthun pa dang mi mthun pa thams cad la snyoms pa dang rtag tu ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can mthun pa dag dang mi mthun pa dag dang / mthun pa dang mi mthun pa thams cad la snyoms pa dang rtag tu ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: It is always present in the Tathagata, being equal toward all sentient beings, whether they are agreeable, disagreeable, or neither.

original: nyan thos dag gi lta bur res 'ga' ba dang / nyi tshe bar 'byung ba dang yongs su mi skyob pa'i rnam pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dag gi lta bur res 'ga' ba dang / nyi tshe bar 'byung ba dang yongs su mi skyob pa'i rnam pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not of the aspect of occasionally occurring and being limited, like that of the Sravakas, nor is it of the aspect of not protecting.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i byams pa dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir chen po nyid yin pas yongs su skyob pa'i rnam pa'i byams pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i byams pa dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir chen po nyid yin pas yongs su skyob pa'i rnam pa'i byams pa chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, it is great love in the aspect of complete protection, because it is superior to the loves of the sravakas, etc.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid ni thams cad du khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid ni thams cad du khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Its equality is its occurrence without distinction in all.

original: de'i chos nyid do zhes tha dad par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid do zhes tha dad par brjod do //
translated: Its reality is its non-differentiation.

original: yang na yongs su skyob pa'i rnam pa'i byams pa chen po de nyid mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang na yongs su skyob pa'i rnam pa'i byams pa chen po de nyid mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Or else, that very great love in the aspect of complete protection is equality,

original: mnyam pa de nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa de nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the objective reference to that very equality.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
translated: It is from the accomplishment of that equality.

original: nyan thos rnam pa'i snying rje ni sems can 'don pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: nyan thos rnam pa'i snying rje ni sems can 'don pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa /
translated: The compassion of the sravakas is not in the aspect of deliverance of sentient beings,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa nyi tshe bar 'gyur ba res 'ga' yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa nyi tshe bar 'gyur ba res 'ga' yin gyi /
translated: and it is limited, being the objective reference to sentient beings in the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni khams gsum pa'i sems can gyi yul can yal bar mi 'dor ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni khams gsum pa'i sems can gyi yul can yal bar mi 'dor ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The great compassion of the transcendent lords has as its object the sentient beings of the three world realms and it is not indifferent to them.

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyis ci rigs par sdug bsngal ba'i sems can yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyis ci rigs par sdug bsngal ba'i sems can yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a protection for sentient beings who are suffering in any of the three kinds of suffering.

original: 'byung zhing sems can thams cad la tshong dpon bu gcig pa la byams pa bzhin du snyoms par 'byung ba'i phyir yal bar mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'byung zhing sems can thams cad la tshong dpon bu gcig pa la byams pa bzhin du snyoms par 'byung ba'i phyir yal bar mi 'dor ro //
translated: It is not indifferent because it arises in all sentient beings equally, like the love of a merchant for his only son.

original: rtag tu ldan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu ldan pa yang yin te /
translated: It is always present,

original: sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus rnams kyang rgyun mi 'chad la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus rnams kyang rgyun mi 'chad la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the times for the evolutionary development of sentient beings are uninterrupted, since the realm of sentient beings is infinite, and because the transcendent lords never miss the time for the evolutionary development of sentient beings.

original: / de dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: / de dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin te /
translated: The transcendent lords are so called because they are endowed with that compassion.

original: ji skad du rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni sems can rnams la skye'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni sems can rnams la skye'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, the great compassion of the blessed buddhas arises for sentient beings.

original: mi 'byung ngo zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'byung ngo zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: It is not the case that it does not arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni rtag tu 'byung ba kho na ste @263b zhes bya ba nas de bzhin gshegs pas ni rtsa ba med pa gzhi med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na sems can 'di dag chos
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni rtag tu 'byung ba kho na ste @263b zhes bya ba nas de bzhin gshegs pas ni rtsa ba med pa gzhi med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na sems can 'di dag chos
translated: Why is that?🔽The great compassion of the blessed buddhas always arises, and so on up to:

original: 'di dag thams cad rtsa ba med pa dang / gzhi med pas khong du mi chud kyis de dag khong du chud par bya'o zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rtsa ba med pa dang / gzhi med pas khong du mi chud kyis de dag khong du chud par bya'o zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the enlightenment that is rootless and groundless. Therefore, since these sentient beings do not understand that all these phenomena are rootless and groundless, the great compassion of the Tathāgata arises for sentient beings, thinking, ‘I will help them understand that.’

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa nyin dus gsum mtshan dus gsum du 'jig rten la gzigs par mdzad do //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa nyin dus gsum mtshan dus gsum du 'jig rten la gzigs par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata sees the world with his buddha-eye three times during the night and three times during the day.

original: 'o na ji ltar rtag tu ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rtag tu ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how is he always in meditative equipoise?

original: mdzad pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir bshad pas 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir bshad pas 'gal ba med de /
translated: Because his performance is uninterrupted, there is no contradiction in saying that he is always in meditative equipoise.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
translated: This is due to the perfection of his sameness.

original: sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku kun du bstan pas ji ltar mos pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa spros pa mi mnga' bar bzhugs kyang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku kun du bstan pas ji ltar mos pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa spros pa mi mnga' bar bzhugs kyang /
translated: Those sentient beings who are inspired by the vision of the Tathāgata’s form body see the Tathāgata’s form body, which is like beryl, etc.,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku bee d'urya'i rang bzhin la sogs pa lta bur mthong ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku bee d'urya'i rang bzhin la sogs pa lta bur mthong ste /
translated: by the power of his knowledge of sameness, even though the Tathāgata is free of conceptualization.

original: ji skad du lha dang mi kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog lta bur mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du lha dang mi kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog lta bur mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “Some gods and humans see the Tathāgata as the color of gold.”

original: de'i rnam pa kun du ston pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa kun du ston pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las te /
translated: It is from the perfected nature of sameness that he displays all those forms.

original: ji skad du nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i gzugs kun nas ston pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i mdog tu ston pa la thogs pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o
analyzed: ji skad du nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i gzugs kun nas ston pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i mdog tu ston pa la thogs pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o
translated: As is said, “The tathāgatas are unimpeded in displaying the color of a precious sapphire to those sentient beings who are to be guided by the display of the form of a precious sapphire gem.”

original: // tshig gzung bar 'os pas ni gsung pa'i phrin las ji lta bus sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba thob par 'gyur ba de kho na lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis thos pa ste /
analyzed: // tshig gzung bar 'os pas ni gsung pa'i phrin las ji lta bus sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba thob par 'gyur ba de kho na lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis thos pa ste /
translated: By means of speech that is worthy of retention, sentient beings hear the tathāgatas’ speech just as it is, in accordance with their own inclinations, by means of the kind of speech activity that brings sentient beings to full maturity, and that causes them to attain joy, faith, and supreme delight.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa mi mnga' ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtog par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa mi mnga' ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtog par mi mdzad do //
translated: The tathāgatas do not conceptualize, because their nature is free of elaborations.

original: de ltar na lha'am mi 'ga' yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' las mi 'da' bas tshig gzung bar 'os pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na lha'am mi 'ga' yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' las mi 'da' bas tshig gzung bar 'os pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, since no god or human can transgress the word of the Tathāgata, it is worthy of being taken to heart.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bka' bzhin du 'gyur ba mi mnga' bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bka' bzhin du 'gyur ba mi mnga' bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: For this very reason, since it is like the word of the Buddha, it is said that the Blessed Buddhas speak without error.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
translated: It is from the establishment of the equality of that.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po dag ste 'jig pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nye bar zhi ba ni gang @264a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po dag ste 'jig pa'i phyir ro // de nye bar zhi ba ni gang @264a * //
translated: The world is the five aggregates, because they are destroyed.

original: gis dang gang du ste lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gis dang gang du ste lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Its pacification is by means of which and where, i.e., by the path and in nirvana.

original: de gnyis ro gcig pa ni kun brtags pa med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de gnyis ro gcig pa ni kun brtags pa med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The sameness of those two is the perfected nature, because of the non-existence of the imagined.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, it is because of natural pacification,

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
translated: from the establishment of the equality of that.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos ni rnyed pa dang me rnyed pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos ni rnyed pa dang me rnyed pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: The worldly dharmas are the eight: gain, loss, pleasure, pain, fame, disgrace, and praise and censure.

original: de dag ro gcig pa ni rnyed pas dregs pa med pa dang ma rnyed pas sro shi ba med pa nas /
analyzed: de dag ro gcig pa ni rnyed pas dregs pa med pa dang ma rnyed pas sro shi ba med pa nas /
translated: They are of one taste, because he is not puffed up by gain nor depressed by loss,

original: de bzhin bde bas rjes su chags pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis khong khro ba med pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin bde bas rjes su chags pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis khong khro ba med pa'i bar du ste /
translated: and so on up to: he is not attached by pleasure nor averse to pain.

original: 'phags pa rnams la ni ste'u dang tsandan du mtshungs so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ni ste'u dang tsandan du mtshungs so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that for the noble ones, a saw and sandalwood are the same.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos kyis dben pa ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos kyis dben pa ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is detached from the worldly dharmas that are imagined, because they are of one taste everywhere.

original: ro gcig pa de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
analyzed: ro gcig pa de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa las so //
translated: That one taste is perfected in equality.

original: yon tan ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The virtues are the dharmas such as the factors of awakening.

original: de dag gi sa bon 'jog pa dang / gsos 'debs pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sgo nas bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi sa bon 'jog pa dang / gsos 'debs pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sgo nas bskyed pa ste /
translated: They are generated by means of planting their seeds, nourishing them, ripening them, and liberating them.

original: de bzhin gyi nor bu ltar rnam par mi rtog kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gyi nor bu ltar rnam par mi rtog kyang /
translated: Likewise, it is nonconceptual like a gem,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis rgyud gzhan dag la de rnams skye bas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis rgyud gzhan dag la de rnams skye bas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: but it is so called because it generates those in other continuums through the power of the Tathagata.
