original: shin tu zhes bya ba smos pa ni bskyed ma thag pa gsum gyis thar pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba smos pa ni bskyed ma thag pa gsum gyis thar pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word “extremely” is used because the three that are generated immediately are the signs of liberation.

original: gzhan ni ma smos kyang grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma smos kyang grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Even though the others are not mentioned, they are definitely generated.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa la sogs so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bcu kas blangs nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa la sogs so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bcu kas blangs nas rig par bya ste /
translated: The wisdom of discernment of the perfection of sameness and so on should be understood as being generated by the tenfold classification of causes.

original: rgyu rnam pa bcu ni gnas kyi rgyu dang / skye ba'i rgyu dang / dga' ba'i rgyu dang / rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu dang / 'gro ba dang khams gsum yongs su gcod pa'i bye brag gis /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa bcu ni gnas kyi rgyu dang / skye ba'i rgyu dang / dga' ba'i rgyu dang / rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu dang / 'gro ba dang khams gsum yongs su gcod pa'i bye brag gis /
translated: The ten causes are the cause of the basis, the cause of birth, the cause of delight, the cause of thorough differentiation, the cause of perfect enjoyment, the cause of the three realms and migration, the cause of the three vehicles, the cause of the three bodies, the cause of the three times and the cause of the three doors of perfect liberation.

original: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis dang / chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pa'i rgyu dang / phyir rgol ba nges par 'joms pa'i rgyu dang / the tshom thams cad rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis dang / chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pa'i rgyu dang / phyir rgol ba nges par 'joms pa'i rgyu dang / the tshom thams cad rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.

original: de la gnas kyi rgyu ni gzungs kyi sgo thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzungs ni mi zad pa'i za ma tog la sogs pa ste /🔽rnam pa gcig tu chos thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i za ma tog ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas kyi rgyu ni gzungs kyi sgo thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // gzungs ni mi zad pa'i za ma tog la sogs pa ste / rnam pa gcig tu chos thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i za ma tog ces bya ste /
translated: The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.

original: tshig dang don gyi gzungs gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig dang don gyi gzungs gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.

original: ting nge 'dzin dag ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs @264b pa'o //🔽'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad thibs kyis gnon la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dag ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs @264b pa'o //🔽'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad thibs kyis gnon la /
translated: The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of the teaching is the retention of the words of the teaching.🔽The cause of the retention of

original: gzhan dag gis thibs kyis gnon mi nus pas dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis thibs kyis gnon mi nus pas dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
translated: It is called the concentration of heroic valor since it cannot be overcome by others.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin dag kyang mdo dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //🔽gzugs dang ting nge 'dzin dag nyid sgo yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin dag kyang mdo dang mthun par brjod par bya'o // gzugs dang ting nge 'dzin dag nyid sgo yin te /
translated: The concentrations should be explained in accordance with the sutras.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhin no //
translated: The doors of form and concentration are like the doors of liberation.

original: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word all is applied to each.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dag ni chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams so //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dag ni chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams so // sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The correct knowledges are the correct knowledge of phenomena, meaning, etymological explanation, and prowess.🔽The buddhadharmas are the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: yang na gzungs la sogs pa de de dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzungs la sogs pa de de dag nyid yin te /
translated: Alternatively, those dharanis and so on are the buddhadharmas

original: de dag yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they correctly retain them.

original: skye ba'i rgyu ni shes bya thams cad la cig car rig pa rnam par rig pa sna tshogs can skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu ni shes bya thams cad la cig car rig pa rnam par rig pa sna tshogs can skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of birth is the sign of the simultaneous knowledge of all objects of knowledge, since it is the cause of the generation of the various cognitions.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams so //🔽ji ltar gzugs sna tshogs rnam par rig pa rnam pa sna tshogs can skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du rgyu yin pa de ltar so so'i ye shes kyang shes bya thams cad la cig car kho nar nam mkha' ltar thogs pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa rnam
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams so // ji ltar gzugs sna tshogs rnam par rig pa rnam pa sna tshogs can skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du rgyu yin pa de ltar so so'i ye shes kyang shes bya thams cad la cig car kho nar nam mkha' ltar thogs pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa rnam
translated: The world means the world of the physical cosmos.

original: pa sna tshogs can ngo bo sna tshogs la dmigs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: pa sna tshogs can ngo bo sna tshogs la dmigs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Just as form is the cause of the arising of the various kinds of consciousness, in the same way, the individual intuitive wisdom is the cause of the various kinds of consciousnesses that are directed toward the various natures of all objects of knowledge, which are like space, and which are unobstructed.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of their arising.

original: ji skad du sna tshogs kyi ngo bo dang / cig shos te /
analyzed: ji skad du sna tshogs kyi ngo bo dang / cig shos te /
translated: As it is said, “The various natures and the other,

original: shes bya tha dad pa'i dngos po ma lus pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes lan cig 'byung ba'i gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: shes bya tha dad pa'i dngos po ma lus pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes lan cig 'byung ba'i gzung ba yin te /
translated: all the different things that are objects of knowledge are the objects of the Tathāgatas’ intuitive wisdom, which arises only once,

original: sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir gzugs sna tshogs bzhin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir gzugs sna tshogs bzhin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: because they are various, like the various forms.”

original: dga' ba'i rgyu ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gyis nyams dga' ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu rnam par mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyu ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gyis nyams dga' ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu rnam par mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of delight is the various delights in the teachings of the perfections, etc. , because they are the cause of the bodhisattvas' great delight.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kun du dga' bas so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kun du dga' bas so //
translated: For, the bodhisattvas are delighted with them.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos sna tshogs rab tu ston pas /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos sna tshogs rab tu ston pas /
translated: For this very reason, by teaching the various teachings of the perfections, etc.

original: lam me thal le lhang nge'o //
analyzed: lam me thal le lhang nge'o //
translated: , they are radiant, clear, and bright.

original: rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ni shin tu rnam par nges pa'i rnam pa ste ;
analyzed: rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ni shin tu rnam par nges pa'i rnam pa ste ;
translated: The cause of complete differentiation is the aspect of complete determination,

original: chos de dag ji ltar ma 'dres pa'i rnam par che ba de bzhin dum 'dres pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag ji ltar ma 'dres pa'i rnam par che ba de bzhin dum 'dres pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those teachings are completely differentiated in their individual natures just as they are in their unmixed natures.

original: rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'byor pa sna tshogs pa kun du bstan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'byor pa sna tshogs pa kun du bstan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The cause of perfect enjoyment is the enjoyment body, because it is manifested by the display of various enjoyments.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa so sor sku nyams su @265a * //🔽bstar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa so sor sku nyams su @265a * // bstar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the determination of the realm is the three realms, because the three realms are its object.🔽The three realms are the object of the appearance of the realm, but not its basis.

original: 'gro ba yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ni 'gro ba lnga po yul yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gro ba yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ni 'gro ba lnga po yul yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of the determination of the world is the five world systems, because the five world systems are its object.

original: 'gro ba lnga po de la snang ba ni yul nyid du snang gi rten nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga po de la snang ba ni yul nyid du snang gi rten nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: The five world systems are the object of the appearance of the world, but not its basis.

original: khams yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ni khams gsum pa yul yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khams yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ni khams gsum pa yul yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of the determination of the realm is the three realms, because the three realms are its object.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world realm is the receptacle world.

original: ji rigs par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gyis bsdus pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: ji rigs par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gyis bsdus pa rnams yin te /
translated: It is included in the world systems of desire, etc., as they occur, and in the world of sentient beings.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dag gi rten yin no //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dag gi rten yin no //
translated: The receptacle world is the basis of the sentient beings and the receptacle world.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi yin no //
translated: The world of sentient beings is the basis of the sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med pa'i khams snang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med pa'i khams snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the formless realm appears in the formless realm.

original: khams gsum pa rnam pa rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa dag snang ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la yul nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa rnam pa rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa dag snang ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la yul nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of the limitless divisions of the three realms is the appearance as objects for the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang /
analyzed: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang /
translated: This is what is being said: although the tathāgatas do not have the conception of object and apprehender,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dbang gis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes las /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dbang gis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes las /
translated: due to mirrorlike wisdom, the wisdom of individual investigation

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas 'grub par 'gyur ba'i 'du byed yongs su smin pas 'phangs pa mtha' yas pa snang ba 'byung ste /🔽'di ltar de'i dbang gis rtogs pa po rnams smon lam gyi shes pa yongs su gzung bas sam /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas 'grub par 'gyur ba'i 'du byed yongs su smin pas 'phangs pa mtha' yas pa snang ba 'byung ste / 'di ltar de'i dbang gis rtogs pa po rnams smon lam gyi shes pa yongs su gzung bas sam /
translated: appears to have the limitless appearances of the elements, reincarnating beings, and birth processes that are included in the causes and results of mind and mental factors, which are projected by the ripening of formative factors.

original: shes pa'i khyad par gzhan gyis de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar 'god do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par gzhan gyis de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar 'god do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In this way, due to that, those who realize it posit such conceptions by the power of the knowledge of aspiration or by another special knowledge.

original: ye shes de nyid nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rnyog pa thams cad las dben pa yin te /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rnyog pa thams cad las dben pa yin te /
translated: That very intuition is isolated from all the defilement-related and objective obscurations.

original: des na shes bya'i dngos po mtha' dag me long yongs su dag pa'i dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan bzhin du de la snang ngo //
analyzed: des na shes bya'i dngos po mtha' dag me long yongs su dag pa'i dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan bzhin du de la snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, all things that are objects of knowledge appear in it like reflections in the center of a clear mirror.

original: de me long lta bu'i ye shes dang khyad par med pa yang thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de me long lta bu'i ye shes dang khyad par med pa yang thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not follow that it is not different from mirror intuition,

original: de rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa mi srid la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa mi srid la /
translated: In conceptualization, discrimination of cause, effect, etc. is not possible.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar bshad do //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar bshad do //
translated: It has been explained that mirror intuition is only non-conceptual.

original: chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pa'i rgyu ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pa'i rgyu ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the great rain of Dharma is the demonstration of the power of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu ni ston pa gang dag gis na dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu ni ston pa gang dag gis na dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /
translated: The power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas is the teacher, which is called “mastery.”

original: de dang ldan pa de dang 'brel pa de las rab tu byung ba de dag snang ngo //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa de dang 'brel pa de las rab tu byung ba de dag snang ngo //
translated: Those who have it, those who are connected with it, and those who have gone forth from it appear.

original: phyir rgol ba nges par 'joms pa'i rgyu ni chos kyi dbyings zab mo @265b ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba nges par 'joms pa'i rgyu ni chos kyi dbyings zab mo @265b ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the certain destruction of adversaries is the teaching of the profound Dharma-dhātu.

original: gzhan mu ste gas can rnams ni lta ba la gnas pa dag yin la stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las dben pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan mu ste gas can rnams ni lta ba la gnas pa dag yin la stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las dben pa yin te /
translated: Others, who are tīrthikas, are established in views, but emptiness is isolated from all views.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid bstan pa gzhan dag gis gting mi dpogs pa'i phyir zab la dkrugs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid bstan pa gzhan dag gis gting mi dpogs pa'i phyir zab la dkrugs par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, because others cannot fathom the teaching of emptiness, it is profound and cannot be disturbed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snga ma las khyad par yod do /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snga ma las khyad par yod do /
translated: For that very reason, it is different from the previous one.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la zhes rgyu'i bdun pa bstan te /
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la zhes rgyu'i bdun pa bstan te /
translated: The reason for the statement “because it is the reason for the correct teaching of all aspects of objects of knowledge” is the seventh, the cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ye shes kyi nyi ma chen po zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: rnam par grol bar mdzad pa ni khams gsum pa dang ngan song las te /

original: bde 'gro la dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro la dgod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: skye ba kun du ston pas ni skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du cig car skye ba kun ston pa las rig par bya'o //

analyzed: yongs su spyod pa ni dbang po rnams rang gi yul dang phrad pa'o //

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes nyid skye ba nyid du ston pa yongs su spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir yongs su spyod par 'gyur ba yin no //🔽skye ba'i skye mched ji snyed pa'i skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du ste /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes nyid skye ba nyid du ston pa yongs su spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir yongs su spyod par 'gyur ba yin no // skye ba'i skye mched ji snyed pa'i skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du ste /
translated: The sign of enjoyment is the enjoyment because the very knowledge of the accomplishment of action is the manifestation of birth.🔽In all the places of birth, in all the continents and all the divine species, he manifests birth in the same class as those beings, such as the warrior class, etc.,

original: gling thams cad dang lha'i rigs thams cad du rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs su de dag dang / skye ba mnyam pa nyid du de dag dang 'dra ba nyid du nye bar ston par mdzad de de dag dang 'dra bar kun du bstan pas /

translated: and he manifests himself as similar to them, in order to teach them through his similarity to them.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to bring about the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: 'dzud par mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dzud par mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par bshad do //
translated: The words “to engage” and so on are explained in the same way as above.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa kun du ston pa ni las kyi rnam pa kun du ston pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa kun du ston pa ni las kyi rnam pa kun du ston pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The display of the maturation of karma should be understood from the display of the aspects of karma.

original: lus nyid la yin pas lus kyi las te /
analyzed: lus nyid la yin pas lus kyi las te /
translated: It is the karma of the body, because it is in the body itself.

original: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu ni las kyi lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu ni las kyi lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body is the result of previous karma.

original: nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ni las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ni las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the experience, because it is the reason for the enjoyment of the results of karma that are desired and not desired.

original: lus kyi tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The pleasant and painful feelings of the body are the results of previous karma.

original: de la brtan nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la brtan nas 'byung ngo //
translated: They arise in dependence on that.

original: bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye @266b shes nyid sku nyams su bstar ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye @266b shes nyid sku nyams su bstar ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The knowledge that accomplishes what is to be done is the reason for the display of the body.

original: sku nyams su bstar bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sku nyams su bstar bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the display of the body.

original: sku sprul pa'i phrin las ni sku ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de lta bur byung ba'i sde ni sngon gyi gtam nges par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sku sprul pa'i phrin las ni sku ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro // de lta bur byung ba'i sde ni sngon gyi gtam nges par bstan pa'o //
translated: The emanation body is the cause of the appearance of the consciousness that appears as the body.🔽The Jataka Tales are the stories of former births.

original: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde ni kun gyi mchog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde ni kun gyi mchog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Avadanas are the stories of the past lives of the disciples.

original: dka' ba spyod pa ni byang chub kyi sngon rol du'o //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa ni byang chub kyi sngon rol du'o //
translated: The “difficult to conquer” is the period prior to enlightenment.

original: de thams cad ni sprul pa'i skus ston te /🔽srog chags rnams dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang / bzlog par bya ba'i phyir de dag dang skal ba mnyam par kun du bstan pas gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad ni sprul pa'i skus ston te / srog chags rnams dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang / bzlog par bya ba'i phyir de dag dang skal ba mnyam par kun du bstan pas gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these are taught by the emanation body.🔽The emanation body teaches the Dharma in order to cause living beings to enter the path of virtue and to turn away from the path of non-virtue, by demonstrating the same fortune as that of those to be converted.

original: dka' ba spyod pa kun du ston pa ni de lta bu kun du bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba rnams gdul ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis dag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa kun du ston pa ni de lta bu kun du bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba rnams gdul ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis dag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The demonstration of the difficult to conquer is for the sake of converting those who are to be converted by that demonstration, and for the sake of showing that purity is not by mere morality and asceticism.

original: ye shes kyis 'dag go zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyis 'dag go zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that it is purified by transcendent wisdom.

original: dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod byang chub ni mchog tu dka' ba yin no zhes byas pa de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bka' stsal pa ni dag gis nyes par spyod pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod byang chub ni mchog tu dka' ba yin no zhes byas pa de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bka' stsal pa ni dag gis nyes par spyod pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Buddha declared that the result of his action was that the monk had said, “How can an ascetic with matted hair attain enlightenment? Enlightenment is extremely difficult to attain.”🔽The Buddha said this in order to prevent others from engaging in negative actions.

original: de lta ma yin na skye ba gcig gis thogs pa sangs rgyas du ma bsnyen bkur byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa la ngag gis nyes par spyod pa rnam pa de lta bu ji ltar srid par nus /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skye ba gcig gis thogs pa sangs rgyas du ma bsnyen bkur byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa la ngag gis nyes par spyod pa rnam pa de lta bu ji ltar srid par nus /
translated: Otherwise, how could one who was impeded by only one birth, who had served many buddhas, who naturally remembered his past lives, and who had such negative speech, have been able to do so?

original: de la de skad du smras pa ni tshig de lta bus 'dul bar 'gyur ba rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de skad du smras pa ni tshig de lta bus 'dul bar 'gyur ba rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha said this in order to discipline those who could be disciplined by such words, so that they would approach the Tathāgata.

original: gsung sprul pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gsung sprul pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Emanations of speech are also of three types:

original: yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la yang dag par dga' ba ni mgu ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la yang dag par dga' ba ni mgu ba ste /
translated: Those that cause delight. Delight means satisfaction.

original: rangs pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rangs pa'i bye brag go //
translated: and the specific delight.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yin pas yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yin pas yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the cause of that, and so it is the true delight.

original: gang zhig thos nas phan tshun mgu ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig thos nas phan tshun mgu ba skye ba'o //
translated: It is that hearing which produces mutual delight.

original: don bzang po ni tshig gi don grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bzang po ni tshig gi don grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The good meaning is because the meaning of the words is well known.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po ni gsal ba nyid kyis mnyan par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po ni gsal ba nyid kyis mnyan par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The good words are because they are clear and so are worthy to be heard.

original: thos pa tsam kho nas kyang /
analyzed: thos pa tsam kho nas kyang /
translated: Even by merely hearing it,🔽sentient beings of childish understanding,

original: sems can byis pa'i shes rab can dang ces bya ba ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can byis pa'i shes rab can dang ces bya ba ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has the sixty aspects,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung byis pa'i shes rab can rnams kyis kyang thos nas dad pa skyes na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung byis pa'i shes rab can rnams kyis kyang thos nas dad pa skyes na /
translated: the speech of the Tathāgata, even when heard by those of childish understanding, produces faith.

original: don shes pa gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o //
analyzed: don shes pa gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o //
translated: What need is there to mention others who understand the meaning?

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes nyid yang dag par dga' @267a * //🔽bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes nyid yang dag par dga' @267a * // bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The wisdom that accomplishes activities is the true delight.

original: sems can rnams rangs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams rangs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the delight of sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyis tshig kyang gang gis na chos kyi gting ma dpogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi gsung gis ston pa zab mor 'jug par byed pa de lta bur sprul pa mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis tshig kyang gang gis na chos kyi gting ma dpogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi gsung gis ston pa zab mor 'jug par byed pa de lta bur sprul pa mdzad de /
translated: And by the words of others, those who have not fathomed the depths of the Dharma are caused to enter the profound teaching of the Buddha.

original: dper na gnas brtan rab 'byor la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gnas brtan rab 'byor la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the elder Subhuti and so on.

original: de bzhin du sil snyan gyi rnam pa thams cad dang / gzugs su snang ba thams cad dang / nam mkha' las kyang zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sil snyan gyi rnam pa thams cad dang / gzugs su snang ba thams cad dang / nam mkha' las kyang zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be said that all kinds of musical instruments, all appearances of form, and also from space.

original: sbyor bar 'gyur ba ni che ge mo zhig bya ba rnams la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar 'gyur ba ni che ge mo zhig bya ba rnams la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application means engaging in activities such as do this and that.

original: sems can bag med pa la sogs pa de dag nyid kyis don gyis sam /
analyzed: sems can bag med pa la sogs pa de dag nyid kyis don gyis sam /
translated: Those sentient beings who are heedless and so on, by their own meaning,

original: thugs rjes de bzhin gshegs pa bslab pa'i gzhi la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir sbyor ba la /
analyzed: thugs rjes de bzhin gshegs pa bslab pa'i gzhi la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir sbyor ba la /
translated: or by compassion, the Tathagata applies himself to the establishment of the bases of training and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang de dag 'bras bu 'jug pa dang / ldog pa can gyi bya ba dag la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang de dag 'bras bu 'jug pa dang / ldog pa can gyi bya ba dag la sbyor ba'o //
translated: And the Tathagata also applies himself to the activities of engaging and disengaging in those results.

original: de'i mtshan nyid rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir sbyor bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir sbyor bar gyur pa ste /
translated: It is a connection because it is the reason for the characteristic.

original: mi 'dod pa la ldog pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa la ldog pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a connection because it is the reason for turning away from what is undesirable, engaging in virtue, and the distinctions of the occasion of the noble path.

original: yang dag par go bar 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: yang dag par go bar 'gyur ba yang /
translated: It is correct understanding

original: don go ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don go ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the reason for understanding the meaning.

original: des na sems can bsam pa tha dad pa don sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa'i blo can rnams sgra gcig lan gcig brjod pas don yang dag par go bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na sems can bsam pa tha dad pa don sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa'i blo can rnams sgra gcig lan gcig brjod pas don yang dag par go bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because sentient beings with different intentions and confused minds understand the meaning correctly from a single utterance,

original: the tshom thams cad sel ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad sel ba ste /
translated: it removes all doubts.🔽As it is said:

original: ji skad gcig ni bka' stsal na /
analyzed: ji skad gcig ni bka' stsal na /
translated: When one thing is said,

original: gsung la du mar go ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsung la du mar go ba yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: many meanings are understood.

original: thugs sprul pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thugs sprul pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The emanation of mind is fourfold:

original: rnam par nges par 'gyur ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa rnam par nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par nges par 'gyur ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa rnam par nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is definite because it is the reason for the definite conduct of sentient beings.

original: mngon par 'du mdzad par 'gyur ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du yon tan dang nges pa skyed pa dang / dor ba'i gnyen po mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad par 'gyur ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du yon tan dang nges pa skyed pa dang / dor ba'i gnyen po mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reason for the manifest activity is the generation of the qualities and certainty in accordance with the conduct of sentient beings and the manifest activity of the antidote to the discards.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rtsol ba mi mnga' ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rtsol ba mi mnga' ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although all the tathagatas are free from effort,

original: 'on kyang gzhan dag gi rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul bshad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan dag gi rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul bshad do //
translated: nevertheless, the way in which the appearance of each individual consciousness is apprehended is explained.

original: kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba la kun nas slong ba ni kun nas ldang ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba la kun nas slong ba ni kun nas ldang ba ste /
translated: The reason for the motivation is the motivation,

original: lus dang dag gi bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang dag gi bya ba ste /
translated: which is the activity of body and speech.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the reason for that.

original: yang na shes pa gang gis de kun nas slong bar byed @267b pa de ni kun nas slong ba ste /
analyzed: yang na shes pa gang gis de kun nas slong bar byed @267b pa de ni kun nas slong ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, the motivation is that by which it is motivated,

original: de las byung ba'i phyir kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and the reason for the motivation is that it arises from that.

original: de'i gnyen po bstan pa ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa de'i'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po bstan pa ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa de'i'o //
translated: The teaching of the antidote to that is the conduct of all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir ming gi tshogs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ming gi tshogs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the collection of names, etc.

original: bstan pa'i chos ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are the Dharma of teaching, because they are the essence of that.

original: gdul ba rnams la ming gi tshogs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul ba rnams la ming gi tshogs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the reason for the appearance of the consciousnesses of the collections of names, etc. to those to be trained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dga' bar mdzad de la dga' ba bskyed par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dga' bar mdzad de la dga' ba bskyed par mdzad do //
translated: The Tathagatas rejoice in that, and they generate joy in that.

original: nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la nyams su myong ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang dag par tshor ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la nyams su myong ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang dag par tshor ba'o //
translated: The experience is the correct feeling of pleasure and pain.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because it is the reason for that, it is the experience.🔽The wisdom of accomplishing activities is the reason for the experience of the body of the meaning of the answers to questions.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes nyid 'dri ba lung bstan pa'i don sku nyams su bstar pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir thugs sprul pa'i phrin las sku nyams su bstar bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes nyid 'dri ba lung bstan pa'i don sku nyams su bstar pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir thugs sprul pa'i phrin las sku nyams su bstar bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The activity of emanation of mind is the experience of the body.

original: 'dri ba lung bstan par bya ba bzhi po dag la ci rigs par 'di ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dri ba lung bstan par bya ba bzhi po dag la ci rigs par 'di ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The four kinds of questions are to be answered respectively by a single statement, by distinguishing, by asking a counter-question, and by setting aside.

original: gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar mkhyen nas /
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar mkhyen nas /
translated: Having understood the four kinds of questions,

original: re re'i 'dri ba'i yul du gyur pa dus gsum pa'i don rnams ci rigs par don gang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid sku nyams su bstar zhing rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: re re'i 'dri ba'i yul du gyur pa dus gsum pa'i don rnams ci rigs par don gang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid sku nyams su bstar zhing rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: he knows, in the manner of a reflection, the nature of each object in the three times, according to its reality.

original: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du lung ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du lung ston par mdzad do //
translated: And having understood, he answers accordingly.

original: de la sku gsung thugs sprul pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi lus 'brel pa dang lus ma 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sku gsung thugs sprul pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi lus 'brel pa dang lus ma 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The emanations of body, speech, and mind are related to the bodies of others and to one's own body.

original: thugs sprul pa ni rang dang gzhan dang 'brel pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: thugs sprul pa ni rang dang gzhan dang 'brel pa kho na yin no //
translated: The emanation of mind is related to oneself and to others.

original: 'dis ni cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum po rdzu 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum po rdzu 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the three kinds of miracles: the miracle of supernatural power, the miracle of reading others' minds, and the miracle of edifying instruction.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du rtag tu ldan pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du rtag tu ldan pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya ste /
translated: And that emanation of the Buddha should be known as always and everywhere present, and as inconceivable.

original: mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / grangs dang zhing gi bye brag gi sgo nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i nyams pa mi mnga' bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / grangs dang zhing gi bye brag gi sgo nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i nyams pa mi mnga' bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the inconceivability of the performance of action, of number, and of the variety of fields, and because of the non-interruption of the performance of benefit for sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul ba rnam pa gsum char yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir thabs kyi dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul ba rnam pa gsum char yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir thabs kyi dam pa yin no //
translated: And because the three kinds of emanation of the Tathagatas are the best means for the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas bcom @268a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas bcom @268a * //
translated: For this very reason, the Blessed Buddhas are called the great physicians,

original: ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they completely cure all the sicknesses of the addictions.

original: ye shes kyi sman chen po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sman chen po zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are called the great physicians of wisdom.

original: ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa'i bye brag gi dbang du byas nas zhu ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa'i bye brag gi dbang du byas nas zhu ba ste /
translated: The question is asked from the point of view of the enjoyment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shin tu 'dus sangs rgyas kyis rab tu dbye ba la me long gi dpes de la rtsol ba yang med mngon par 'du byed pa yang med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shin tu 'dus sangs rgyas kyis rab tu dbye ba la me long gi dpes de la rtsol ba yang med mngon par 'du byed pa yang med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The mirror-like meditative stabilization of bodhisattvas is like a mirror, for it is neither effortful nor active.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtsol ba mi mnga' ba rnams kyi ro gcig pa 'dres pa ngo bo nyid gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung ste bshad pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtsol ba mi mnga' ba rnams kyi ro gcig pa 'dres pa ngo bo nyid gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung ste bshad pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi
translated: The enjoyment of the perfect pristine wisdom of the single taste, the single essence, of the effortless tathagatas is the tathagatas alone.

original: yang yin par 'dod do snyam du sems shing bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba yin no //
analyzed: yang yin par 'dod do snyam du sems shing bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas think, “Is it also the case that it is the enjoyment of the bodhisattvas?” and they ask the Bhagavat.🔽Alternatively, the five dharmas are subsumed within the buddha level.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na chos lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bshad pa la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa med pa me long lta bu'i ye shes ni ngo bo gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na chos lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bshad pa la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa med pa me long lta bu'i ye shes ni ngo bo gcig pa yin la /
translated: The mirror-like pristine wisdom that focuses on the pure expanse of reality is of a single essence.

original: de la brten te byung ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes de yang de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ngo bo gcig pa kho na yin te gnyis su rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten te byung ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes de yang de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ngo bo gcig pa kho na yin te gnyis su rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the gnosis of equality that arises in dependence on that is also of one nature with it, because it has the same object as suchness, because it is free from the discrimination of duality.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan gnyis ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gcig tu gces par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan gnyis ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gcig tu gces par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other two consciousnesses are cherished as being solely for the benefit of others.

original: gcig pa yang yin la de dag kyang sangs rgyas rnams kho na yin zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir zhu ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa yang yin la de dag kyang sangs rgyas rnams kho na yin zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir zhu ba yin no //
translated: They are also buddhas, and they are cherished as being of one nature with the gnosis of equality.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa na 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan ni ro gcig pa ma yin par mngon no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa na 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan ni ro gcig pa ma yin par mngon no //
translated: Since it says that in the pure realm of phenomena, the buddhas are mixed and thoroughly mixed, and they enjoy the enjoyment of perfect gnosis with a single taste, it is clear that others do not have a single taste.

original: 'dres pa ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Mixed means becoming one.

original: gcig tu gyur kyang res 'ga' tha dad du bya ba yod na de ni nams kyang tha dad du bya ba med pas nye bar 'dres pa ste dmigs par byas pa dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis shin tu 'dres pas mnyam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur kyang res 'ga' tha dad du bya ba yod na de ni nams kyang tha dad du bya ba med pas nye bar 'dres pa ste dmigs par byas pa dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis shin tu 'dres pas mnyam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although they are one, if there is sometimes a difference in function, then they are always not different in function, and thus they are mixed, because the object and the subject are completely mixed and become the same.

original: 'bras bu ro gcig pa zhes bya ba la ro ni snying po ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ro gcig pa zhes bya ba la ro ni snying po ste /
translated: The result is of one taste. Taste is the essence,

original: ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the intrinsic reality.

original: ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa ni yul te /
analyzed: ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa ni yul te /
translated: The perfect enjoyment of intuition is the object,

original: rdzogs par spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs par spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the perfect enjoyment.

original: des na ye shes ni 'dir me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yin par dgongs @268b pa'o //
analyzed: des na ye shes ni 'dir me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yin par dgongs @268b pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intuition here is the mirror-like intuition and the equalizing intuition.

original: de'i yul ni chos kyi dbyings te ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa gang la 'bras bu dgos pa ro gcig pa yod pa zhes bya bas rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni chos kyi dbyings te ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa gang la 'bras bu dgos pa ro gcig pa yod pa zhes bya bas rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Its object is the reality realm, because the result is of one taste in the perfect enjoyment of intuition.

original: yang na ye shes de nyid ro gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na ye shes de nyid ro gcig pa yin te /
translated: Or, that intuition itself is of one taste,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-conceptual.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi 'bras bu yang yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi 'bras bu yang yin te /
translated: It is also the result of the dharma-dhātu,

original: de la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises by taking that as its object.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rdzogs par longs spyod pa ni kun du spyad pa ste tshor ba'o de ni des kun du spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ni de'i rdzogs par longs spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rdzogs par longs spyod pa ni kun du spyad pa ste tshor ba'o de ni des kun du spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ni de'i rdzogs par longs spyod pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, complete enjoyment is experience, which is feeling. That is the complete enjoyment of that, because it is what is to be experienced by that.

original: de yang btang snyoms te de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi bye brag med pas ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang btang snyoms te de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi bye brag med pas ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro gcig pa'o //
translated: That is also equanimity, because it is a single nature, since there is no distinction of pleasure and pain in that.

original: de yang de'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de yang de'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: That is also its result,

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du de'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du de'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises through the power of that, in association with that.

original: yang na 'du byed pa btang snyoms pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'du byed pa btang snyoms pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the formative forces are equanimity,

original: thams cad rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du ngo bo nyid gcig par 'jug pa'i phyir 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du ngo bo nyid gcig par 'jug pa'i phyir 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa'o //
translated: because they function as a single nature, characterized by the absence of exertion in all things. The result is the single taste of the enjoyment of the perfected wisdom.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na ye shes nyid rdzogs par longs spyad pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na ye shes nyid rdzogs par longs spyad pa yin te /
translated: In one sense, it is the enjoyment of the perfection of intuition itself.

original: rang rig pa'i rnam par rdzogs par longs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rnam par rdzogs par longs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object of the enjoyment of the perfection of the intuition of self-awareness.

original: ye shes de ni ro gcig pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ye shes de ni ro gcig pa yang yin te /
translated: That intuition is also of one taste,

original: bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the discrimination of duality, such as self and other.

original: 'bras bu yang yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang yin te /
translated: It is also the result,

original: rtag tu las gnyis su 'du shes pa las dben par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu las gnyis su 'du shes pa las dben par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always free from the discrimination of the two actions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kho na ni yin no zhes de ltar nges par bzung ba ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kho na ni yin no zhes de ltar nges par bzung ba ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The word “also” in the line “of the bodhisattvas” is not meant to imply that it is only of the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang de lta bu yin no //
translated: It is also like that for the bodhisattvas.

original: 'o na ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa chos lngas bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa chos lngas bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well, if that is so, how can the stage of the buddhas be included in the five dharmas?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni chos lnga kho nas zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kho na'i 'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni chos lnga kho nas zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kho na'i 'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin pas /
translated: Since it is ascertained that the stage of a buddha is only by means of the five dharmas, it is not said to be only of a buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyang 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyang 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bodhisattva stages are also included in these.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'byung ba'i lam la gnas pa rnams la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'byung ba'i lam la gnas pa rnams la /
translated: For bodhisattvas abiding on the path of creation and emergence,

original: 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa med pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa med pas /
translated: there is no enjoyment of the single taste of the result, the complete enjoyment of wisdom.

original: gang dag gi lags zhes zhu'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi lags zhes zhu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is asked, “Whose is it?”

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Those who have attained forbearance regarding nonarising dharmas. Bodhisattvas are of three types:

original: @269a * // byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pas sems dang po bskyed pa rnams dang / sa gong ma drug po dag tu bsgom pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams dang / sa gong ma gsum dag tu bsgom pa'i lam kho na ste /
analyzed: @269a * // byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pas sems dang po bskyed pa rnams dang / sa gong ma drug po dag tu bsgom pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams dang / sa gong ma gsum dag tu bsgom pa'i lam kho na ste /
translated: Those who have entered the faultless state of the bodhisattva are those who have generated the first generation of the mind of enlightenment.🔽Those who have entered the practice are those who have attained the path of cultivation in the first six stages.

original: phyir mi ldog pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are irreversible are those who are in the three higher stages, who are on the path of cultivation alone.

original: de la sa brgyad pa la chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ba gzod ma nas ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i bzod pa chen po gcig tu yongs su dag pas zad pa med pa lhun gyis grub pa 'byung bar skye'o //
analyzed: de la sa brgyad pa la chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ba gzod ma nas ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i bzod pa chen po gcig tu yongs su dag pas zad pa med pa lhun gyis grub pa 'byung bar skye'o //
translated: On the eighth stage, the great acceptance that all phenomena are originally unborn and originally non-arisen arises as the non-arising of the inexhaustible and spontaneous.

original: de thob pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dag ces bya ste /
translated: Because they attain that, they are called those who have attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: sa brgyad las 'di skad du de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' gnyis su 'du shes pa dang bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad las 'di skad du de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' gnyis su 'du shes pa dang bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The eighth stage is stated in this way: “Beyond that, the bodhisattva is free from the discriminations of duality.”

original: gnyis ni nga dang nga'i dang / yod pa dang med pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / byung ba dang ma byung ba dang / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni nga dang nga'i dang / yod pa dang med pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / byung ba dang ma byung ba dang / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two are the notions of “I” and “mine,” of existence and nonexistence, of permanence and impermanence, of origination and nonorigination, of production and nonproduction, of self and other, and so forth.

original: de dag gi gnyen por thams cad du sems mnyam pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por thams cad du sems mnyam pa nyid thob ste /
translated: The remedy for these is the attainment of the sameness of mind with regard to all.

original: de yan chad gnyis su 'du shes pa dang bral bas tshor ba thams cad dang bral ba zag pa med pa gcig tu yongs su dag pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes
analyzed: de yan chad gnyis su 'du shes pa dang bral bas tshor ba thams cad dang bral ba zag pa med pa gcig tu yongs su dag pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes
translated: From that point on, because of being free from the notion of duality and free from all feelings, because of attaining the nonconceptual intuition that is uncontaminated, completely pure, and spontaneously present, there is the single taste of the fruit, which is the intuition

original: rdzogs par longs spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs par longs spyod pa yin no //
translated: of perfect enjoyment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po kho na la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang rtsol ba dang bcas par 'byung ba nyid kyis yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po kho na la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang rtsol ba dang bcas par 'byung ba nyid kyis yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag par mi gzhag go //
translated: Although the bodhisattva attains equality of self and others on the first stage alone, it is not posited as pure because it occurs with effort and is not completely pure.

original: don de bstan pa'i phyir 'dres pa'i tshal gyi dpe ste /
analyzed: don de bstan pa'i phyir 'dres pa'i tshal gyi dpe ste /
translated: To demonstrate that meaning, there is the example of the pleasure grove.

original: ji srid du 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs par ma gyur pa de srid du lha'i longs spyod 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa rnams kun du mi gnas kyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji srid du 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs par ma gyur pa de srid du lha'i longs spyod 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa rnams kun du mi gnas kyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Until one enters the pleasure grove, the mixed and thoroughly mixed divine enjoyments do not remain.

original: dngos po'i sgo nas tha dad pa ni gzhal med khang dang / rgyan la sogs pas tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgo nas tha dad pa ni gzhal med khang dang / rgyan la sogs pas tha dad pa'o //
translated: They are different in terms of substance, such as the palaces, ornaments and so on.

original: nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha dad pa dang rab dang rab mchog tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha dad pa dang rab dang rab mchog tha dad pa'o //
translated: They are different in terms of experience, such as the differences of pleasure and pain and the differences of good and excellent.

original: nga yir 'dzin pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ni 'di ni khyod kyi 'di ni nga zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ni 'di ni khyod kyi 'di ni nga zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are different in terms of ownership, such as this is yours and this is mine.

original: der zhugs pa rnams la de dag med do //
analyzed: der zhugs pa rnams la de dag med do //
translated: Those who enter there do not have those.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dres pa'i tshal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dres pa'i tshal zhes bya ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is called the forest of mixing.

original: der zhugs pa'i lha rnams kyi longs spyod 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der zhugs pa'i lha rnams kyi longs spyod 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the enjoyments of the gods who enter there are mixed.

original: 'dres pa ni @269b tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni @269b tshol ba yin no //
translated: Mixing is seeking.

original: ji srid du thob par ma gyur pa de srid du mi 'thob po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ji srid du thob par ma gyur pa de srid du mi 'thob po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: As long as one does not attain, one does not attain.

original: sa 'og ma pa rnams kyi lam ni rtsol ba dang bcas par 'byung ba'i phyir btang snyoms yongs su ma dag pa yin pas gnyis su 'du shes pa dang bral bas kun du mi gnas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa rnams kyi lam ni rtsol ba dang bcas par 'byung ba'i phyir btang snyoms yongs su ma dag pa yin pas gnyis su 'du shes pa dang bral bas kun du mi gnas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because the path of those in lower levels arises with effort, equanimity is not completely pure. Therefore, since they are free from the perception of duality, they do not abide.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni theg pa dman pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'og ma pa rnams la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni theg pa dman pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'og ma pa rnams la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not shared because it does not exist for those of the lower vehicle and for bodhisattvas on lower levels.

original: gal te 'bras bu tshul gcig pa'i ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa sangs rgyas rnams kho na'i yin no zhes nges par bzung du zin kyang de lta na yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir rgya chen po'i dpe ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad rnam pa thams cad du bya ba la mkhas pa'i phyir 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa de dag kho
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu tshul gcig pa'i ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa sangs rgyas rnams kho na'i yin no zhes nges par bzung du zin kyang de lta na yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir rgya chen po'i dpe ste / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad rnam pa thams cad du bya ba la mkhas pa'i phyir 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyad pa de dag kho
translated: Even if it is definitely asserted that the enjoyment of the gnosis of the single taste of the result is only for the buddhas, still there is no fault.🔽In order to demonstrate that, there is the analogy of the vast.

original: na'i yin par rnam par gzhag par rigs pa dang ldan gyi /
analyzed: na'i yin par rnam par gzhag par rigs pa dang ldan gyi /
translated: The gnosis of the tathāgatas is completely pure in every way, and because they are skilled in performing the benefit of all sentient beings in every way, it is reasonable to posit that the enjoyment of the gnosis of the single taste of the result is only for them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the bodhisattvas

original: sgrib pa lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their gnosis is not completely pure, since they still have residual obscurations.

original: 'o na 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi yin no zhes 'byung ba ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa 'bras bu ro gcig pa ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pa byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi yin no zhes 'byung ba ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: “The mixing of the great river Ganges with the great ocean is the mixing of the bodhisattvas who have attained forbearance regarding the teaching of nonproduction.”

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes la spyir dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes la spyir dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction, because this passage speaks in general about the spontaneous wisdom.

original: gzhan du yang nges par gzung du rung bar bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan du yang nges par gzung du rung bar bshad do //
translated: It is also explained that it is suitable to interpret this passage in another way.

original: chu bo ni gang g'a la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: chu bo ni gang g'a la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The great rivers are the four great rivers such as the Ganges.

original: chu bran ni de las gzhan pa dag go //
analyzed: chu bran ni de las gzhan pa dag go //
translated: The small rivers are those other than the four great rivers.

original: gnas tha dad pa ni sa phyogs tha dad pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa ni sa phyogs tha dad pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have different locations because they are based on different places.

original: chu chen tha dad pa ni rnyog pa can dang / kha dog skya bo dang / lan tshva bro ba dang chu mngar ba tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: chu chen tha dad pa ni rnyog pa can dang / kha dog skya bo dang / lan tshva bro ba dang chu mngar ba tha dad pa'o //
translated: The great rivers are different in that some are turbid, some are pale, some taste salty, and some taste sweet.

original: chu chung ba ni rgya mtsho chen po la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu chung ba ni rgya mtsho chen po la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The small rivers are small in comparison to the great ocean.

original: chu skye 'bri yod pa ni char che ba dang / char chung ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: chu skye 'bri yod pa ni char che ba dang / char chung ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The decrease of the lotus is due to the heavy rains and the lack of rain.

original: so so rang gi bya ba sgrub pa'i las can gyi chu ni ro bro ba dang / mthu dang rnam par smin pa tha dad pas so //
analyzed: so so rang gi bya ba sgrub pa'i las can gyi chu ni ro bro ba dang / mthu dang rnam par smin pa tha dad pas so //
translated: The water that performs its own function is different in taste, potency, and ripening.

original: nyung ngu dag ces bya ba ni grangs nyung ba nyid dang bong chung ba nyid kyis nyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyung ngu dag ces bya ba ni grangs nyung ba nyid dang bong chung ba nyid kyis nyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The few are so called because of their small number and small size.

original: gnas tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni ji skad bshad pa las bzlog ste /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni ji skad bshad pa las bzlog ste /
translated: The opposite of all this is the case with the great many.

original: brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as it is explained.

original: phal po che chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni grangs phal che ba dang / bong che ba'i dbang @270a * //🔽du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: phal po che chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni grangs phal che ba dang / bong che ba'i dbang @270a * // du mdzad nas so //
translated: The great many are so called because of their great number and great size.

original: gnas tha dad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The different locations are due to the different Tathagatas.

original: ye shes tha dad pa ni rnam par grol ba tha dad pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes tha dad pa ni rnam par grol ba tha dad pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The different wisdoms are due to the different liberations.

original: ye shes chung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la ltos nas so //
analyzed: ye shes chung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la ltos nas so //
translated: Minor intuition is in relation to the intuition of the Tathagata.

original: ye shes 'phel 'grib yod pa ni sa gong nas gong du khyad zhugs pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin khyad zhugs pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes 'phel 'grib yod pa ni sa gong nas gong du khyad zhugs pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin khyad zhugs pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The increase and decrease of intuition is in relation to the superiority of the stages, and in relation to the superiority of the concentrations.

original: so so rang gi bya ba sgrub pa'i las can gyi ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so so rang gi bya ba sgrub pa'i las can gyi ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: The intuition which has the function of accomplishing one's own aim is that of the bodhisattva, because of the diversity of functions of the bodhisattva's concentrations.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar ba gang gi yul sems can gyi khams ji snyed cig yin pa de las phan tshun mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar ba gang gi yul sems can gyi khams ji snyed cig yin pa de las phan tshun mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The realm of sentient beings is the domain of the bodhisattva's liberation, and there is no mutual interference.

original: nyung ngu dag ces bya ba ni grangs nyung ba nyid la dgongs pa yin gyi bong chung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyung ngu dag ces bya ba ni grangs nyung ba nyid la dgongs pa yin gyi bong chung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase a few sentient beings is intended to refer to a small number, not to a small size.

original: de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de'i gnas yin te /
translated: It is the basis of the root of their maturation.

original: de'i dbang gis de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, by virtue of that, they are completely matured.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ltos na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ltos na /
translated: In comparison with the samadhi of the Tathagata,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam grangs dpag tu yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam grangs dpag tu yod pa'i phyir /
translated: the bodhisattva's samadhi is finite in terms of its enumeration,

original: sems can dpag tu yod pa rnams kyi don byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu yod pa rnams kyi don byed pa yin no //
translated: and it serves the purpose of finite sentient beings.

original: nam de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgya mtsho chen por zhugs par gyur pa na sangs rgyas kyis sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir gnas tha dad pa ma yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: nam de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgya mtsho chen por zhugs par gyur pa na sangs rgyas kyis sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir gnas tha dad pa ma yin pa dag ste /
translated: When the Tathagatas enter into the great ocean of the pure dharmadhatu, they are not in different places because they manifest the stainlessness of all buddha-dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnas de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnas de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the place of all Tathagatas, the pure tathata, is not different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zag pa med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas rnams du ma nyid du rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zag pa med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas rnams du ma nyid du rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: For this very reason, the Buddhas are not established as multiple in the undefiled realm.

original: ye shes tha dad pa ma yin pa ni thams cad kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa mi mnga' bas mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes tha dad pa ma yin pa ni thams cad kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa mi mnga' bas mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-differentiation of intuition is because all are equal in the mirror-like intuition, which is not differentiated into self and other.

original: ye shes tshad med pa ni ye shes bya tshad med pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes tshad med pa ni ye shes bya tshad med pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The intuition without measure is because it is the subject of the immeasurable intuition-object.

original: ye shes 'phel 'grib med pa ni yongs su dag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / yul nyung ngu dang / ches mang po la ma khyab pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes 'phel 'grib med pa ni yongs su dag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / yul nyung ngu dang / ches mang po la ma khyab pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The intuition without increase or decrease is because of the equality of purification and because it is not the case that it does not pervade a small or a large domain.

original: 'dres pa nye bar 'dres par mdzad pa ro gcig pa'i ye shes ni thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa'i mdzad pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa nye bar 'dres par mdzad pa ro gcig pa'i ye shes ni thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa'i mdzad pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intuition of a single taste in the performance of the interpenetration of all is because all are equal in the performance of the intuition of sameness, etc.

original: tshad med pa dag ni grangs tshad med pa'i @270b phyir te /
analyzed: tshad med pa dag ni grangs tshad med pa'i @270b phyir te /
translated: The immeasurables are so called because their number is immeasurable.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zad mi shes pa mtshungs pa'i phyir chos kyi skus 'khor ba ji srid par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zad mi shes pa mtshungs pa'i phyir chos kyi skus 'khor ba ji srid par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the inexhaustibility of the accumulations of merit and knowledge, the Dharma Body becomes the basis of the roots of virtue which bring sentient beings to maturity for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mdor bsdus nas ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mdor bsdus nas ston par mdzad de /
