translated: Four verses on the summary of the characteristic of the purification of the realm of the Dharma:

original: chos rnams kun gyi de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi de bzhin nyid //
translated: 1. The reality of all things

original: sgrib gnyis ldan dag mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: sgrib gnyis ldan dag mtshan nyid can //
translated: is characterized by the possession of the two obscurations.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la yan lag gnyis yod pa'o //🔽de nyid sgrib pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la yan lag gnyis yod pa'o // de nyid sgrib pa gnyis te /
translated: This has two parts.🔽The reality of all things is characterized by the possession of the two obscurations.

original: spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the general indication.🔽The obscurations are the obscurations.

original: sgrib par byed pa ni sgrib pa ste 'di la gnyis yod pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa ni sgrib pa ste 'di la gnyis yod pa'o //
translated: This has two parts.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid gyi sgra dang gzhi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid gyi sgra dang gzhi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word “reality” is used in common with the word “obscuration.”

original: 'di la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid sgrib gnyis dang ldan de dag rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid sgrib gnyis dang ldan de dag rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the reality of all contaminated and uncontaminated dharmas is associated with the two obscurations, and since the characteristic of their purification exists, the phrase is to be analyzed in this way.

original: don ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin du yod pa ni de bzhin du yod pa ni de bzhin nyid de /🔽chos thams cad kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo de kho na nyid dang / stong pa nyid yin la chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: don ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin du yod pa ni de bzhin du yod pa ni de bzhin nyid de / chos thams cad kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo de kho na nyid dang / stong pa nyid yin la chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The meaning is this: The reality of all dharmas is suchness, i.e., the suchness of all dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis las rnam par dag cing de las dben pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis las rnam par dag cing de las dben pa ste /
translated: It is the nonerroneous nature of all dharmas, thatness, and emptiness. The suchness of all dharmas is the dharmadhatu, since it is purified of the two obscurations, i.e., the addictive and the objective, and is isolated from them.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni de'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni de'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Its characteristic is that it is the dharmadhatu.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid gnas yongs su gyur pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid gnas yongs su gyur pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the reality transformation of suchness.

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pas sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gtan du bral na chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pas sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gtan du bral na chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, when one obtains the path of supramundane, pure transcendent knowledge, and is forever free from the seeds of the two obstructions, then the realm of the Dharma is pure.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: After the vajra-like concentration, suchness is said to be transformed.

original: dngos po shes pa de dmigs pa//
analyzed: dngos po shes pa de dmigs pa//
translated: The knowledge of things is its objective support.

original: dbang zad mi shes mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: dbang zad mi shes mtshan nyid can //
translated: The mastery of that is characterized by inexhaustibility.

original: zhes bya ba la dngos po ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dngos po ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Things refers to the other-dependent pattern.

original: dngos po de shes pa ni dngos po shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po de shes pa ni dngos po shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of things is the knowledge of that thing.

original: de yang me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de yang me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
translated: Moreover, it is mirror-like knowledge.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Its objective support is the other-dependent pattern.

original: dmigs pa ni dmigs par bya bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dmigs par bya bar bya ba'o //
translated: Objective support means that which is to be supported as an object.

original: 'di la dmigs pa de yod pas na de dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la dmigs pa de yod pas na de dmigs pa ste /
translated: Since this has that as its objective support, it is said to have that as its objective support.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos kyi dbyings dang sbyar gyi dngos po shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos kyi dbyings dang sbyar gyi dngos po shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The word that is connected with the realm of the Dharma, not with the knowledge of things.

original: rab tu mchod pa la yang 'brel ba ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab tu mchod pa la yang 'brel ba ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: because no connection is seen with the highest worship.🔽For example,

original: dper na / autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma 'dra ba'i spyan mnga' ba //
analyzed: dper na / autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma 'dra ba'i spyan mnga' ba //
translated: Your face is like a blue lotus petal,

original: khyod kyi zhal ras de yi ngad dang dri mtshungs 'dri //🔽zhes bya ba lta @271a * //
analyzed: khyod kyi zhal ras de yi ngad dang dri mtshungs 'dri // zhes bya ba lta @271a * //
translated: Its fragrance and scent are similar.

original: bu'o // me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyang yin te /
analyzed: bu'o // me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyang yin te /
translated: The objective support of mirror-like awareness is also the dharma-sphere,

original: so so rang rig pa nyid du de la dmigs pa'i 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so rang rig pa nyid du de la dmigs pa'i 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the objective support for that which is individually intuited, and it endures as long as cyclic existence.

original: de ni dngos po shes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni dngos po shes pa yang yin la /
translated: It is both the awareness of things and

original: de dmigs pa yang yin pas zhes gzhi mthun par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa yang yin pas zhes gzhi mthun par bsdu'o //
translated: their objective support, so it is included in a common locus.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad me longs lta bu'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad me longs lta bu'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, all things are shown to be the objective supports of mirror-like awareness,

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is focused on their general and particular characteristics.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dngos po shes pa dang / de dmigs pa zhes bya ba bzlas dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dngos po shes pa dang / de dmigs pa zhes bya ba bzlas dbye ba yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase “the awareness of things and their objective support” is a metrical expansion.

original: gnas ngan len mtha' dag gi gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyen po'i stobs kyi sa gnas ngan len ma lus pa dang bral bas yongs su gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya ba gzhan gyi dbang dag pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa sems
analyzed: gnas ngan len mtha' dag gi gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyen po'i stobs kyi sa gnas ngan len ma lus pa dang bral bas yongs su gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya ba gzhan gyi dbang dag pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa sems
translated: The “mirror-like pristine awareness” is the transformation of the consciousness of the ground-of-all, which is the basis of all negative tendencies, by the power of the antidote, the complete elimination of all negative tendencies.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the absence of all conceptual thoughts, is designated as “pure dependent nature.”

original: kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa'i ngo bo la 'di ni dngos po tsam mo zhes spyi'i rnam par sgro btags nas /
analyzed: kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa'i ngo bo la 'di ni dngos po tsam mo zhes spyi'i rnam par sgro btags nas /
translated: It is a mere entity, and it is imputed in a general way by the thought “This is a mere entity.”

original: dngos po'i sgra brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgra brjod do //
translated: The term “entity” is used to describe it.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa mnyam pa'i rnam pa yang gnas ngan len gyi gnas yongs su gyur na de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa mnyam pa'i rnam pa yang gnas ngan len gyi gnas yongs su gyur na de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The mirror-like pristine awareness is posited in this way when the basis of negative tendencies is transformed, and it is the object of observation and the aspect of observation that are equal.

original: dngos po de shes pa ni dngos po shes pa ste /🔽de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po de shes pa ni dngos po shes pa ste / de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The knowledge of that entity is the knowledge of entity.🔽It is the same as the object of observation.

original: de yang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yin no //
analyzed: de yang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yin no //
translated: It is also the pristine awareness of equality.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa dag la 'jig rten pa rang gi rtog pa yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de'i spyod yul yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa dag la 'jig rten pa rang gi rtog pa yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de'i spyod yul yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The object of the latter, which is the aspect of the thorough discrimination of one's own conceptualization in the world, is also the transformation of the other-dependent nature.

original: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kho na yin te /
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kho na yin te /
translated: This subsequently acquired knowledge is only the knowledge of discernment.

original: de rang gis rtogs pa la so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de rang gis rtogs pa la so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: When one discerns one's own realization,

original: de gnyis yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is the object of those two.

original: de la'am de gnyis la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: de la'am de gnyis la dbang ba ste /
translated: It is mastery over that or those two,

original: 'di de la zad mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di de la zad mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of inexhaustibility.

original: 'dis mtshon par byed shes par byed pas na zhes byed pa'i byed pa por byas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed shes par byed pas na zhes byed pa'i byed pa por byas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because it is the agent of the action of making known, making manifest.

original: ; dngos po shes pa de dmigs pa //
analyzed: ; dngos po shes pa de dmigs pa //
translated: The knowledge of things and the object of that🔽are also the knowledge of things and the object of that.

original: de la'ang dngos po shes pa dang // de dmigs pa de gnyis la dbang zad mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la'ang dngos po shes pa dang // de dmigs pa de gnyis la dbang zad mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Mastery over those two is said to have the characteristic of inexhaustibility.

original: 'dis ni lam gnas yongs su gyur pa yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam gnas yongs su gyur pa yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also shows the transformation of the state of the path.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yongs su gyur na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yongs su gyur na /
translated: When the afflicted mind is transformed,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes @271b chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa la dmigs nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes skye ste /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes @271b chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa la dmigs nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes skye ste /
translated: the mirror-like awareness arises, observing the objective realm.

original: de bzhin yongs su dag na de la yang dbang zad mi shes pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin yongs su dag na de la yang dbang zad mi shes pa 'thob bo //
translated: When it is completely purified, one obtains inexhaustible mastery over it.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni rgyun gyis rtag pa nyid kyis 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir dbang zad mi shes pa thob pa'i yang rigs na /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni rgyun gyis rtag pa nyid kyis 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir dbang zad mi shes pa thob pa'i yang rigs na /
translated: Since the mirror-like awareness is eternal by nature, it lasts as long as cyclic existence, and so it is reasonable that one obtain inexhaustible mastery over it.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so ;
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so ;
translated: But how can the awareness of equality be inexhaustible?🔽Is it because it is eternal in the same way?

original: ; ci de kho na dang 'dra bar rtag pa'i phyir mi zad pa nyid gcig yin nam zhe na ma yin no //
analyzed: ; ci de kho na dang 'dra bar rtag pa'i phyir mi zad pa nyid gcig yin nam zhe na ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na bzhed dgur mngon par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na bzhed dgur mngon par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: How then? Because it manifests as one wishes.

original: rtsol ba mi mnga' bas bzhed pa tsam gyis mngon sum du mdzad pa gang yin pa de nyid de la mi zad pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba mi mnga' bas bzhed pa tsam gyis mngon sum du mdzad pa gang yin pa de nyid de la mi zad pa de nyid yin no //
translated: That very inexhaustible power is the power over the very intuition that is directly experienced by mere wish, since it is not accompanied by effort.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyang de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dag pa dngos po tsam de la dbang zad mi shes pa 'thob po ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyang de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dag pa dngos po tsam de la dbang zad mi shes pa 'thob po ji lta zhe na /
translated: Also, the subsequently attained intuition is the power over the mere thing, the pure relative reality, which is inexhaustible.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i don gyis te /
translated: How is that? It is the meaning of non-error.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dag dngos te phyin ci log thams cad med pa'i ngo bo yin pa ltar de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dag dngos te phyin ci log thams cad med pa'i ngo bo yin pa ltar de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the pure relative reality is the mere thing, the reality free from all error, so also is the subsequently attained intuition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i phyir de ni de la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i phyir de ni de la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the objective support of that intuition, because it is the perfected reality free from error.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'jig rten pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'jig rten pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be mundane?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the aspect of conceptual differentiation.

original: 'o na ji lta de la dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta de la dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be the objective support of that?

original: rang rig pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: The aspect of self-awareness is the experience.

original: ji skad du rang rig pa dang mthun par skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du rang rig pa dang mthun par skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises in conformity with self-awareness,

original: rang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa phyin ci ma log par snang ste /
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa phyin ci ma log par snang ste /
translated: the unmistaken aspect of the determination of self-realization appears.

original: des na de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'thob po //
analyzed: des na de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, it is given the designation of objective.

original: de bzhin nyid shes thams cad nas //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid shes thams cad nas //
translated: The knowledge of reality is cultivated in all

original: bsgoms pas yang dag grub pa can //
analyzed: bsgoms pas yang dag grub pa can //
translated: and is perfected through meditation.

original: de la de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes bsgom pa gang yin pa de las yang dag par 'grub pa yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes bsgom pa gang yin pa de las yang dag par 'grub pa yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The knowledge of reality is cultivated in all and is perfected through meditation.

original: de bzhin nyid ces ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The knowledge of reality is non-discriminating knowledge.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i tshe thob pa yin no //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i tshe thob pa yin no //
translated: It is attained when the first stage is attained.

original: de bsgoms pa ni sa lhag ma rnams te /
analyzed: de bsgoms pa ni sa lhag ma rnams te /
translated: Its cultivation is the remaining stages.

original: de bzhin nyid shes pa de thams cad nas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thams cad nas thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ji lta ji ltar /🔽bsgoms pa de lta de ltar sa re re la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mun pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid shes pa de thams cad nas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thams cad nas thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ji lta ji ltar / bsgoms pa de lta de ltar sa re re la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mun pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of reality is the cause of the purification of the dharma-dhātu in every way, in every situation of practice, such as listening, reflection, and meditation, etc.,🔽in every way, through the stages of listening, reflection, and meditation, etc., on this entire Dharma teaching.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la chos kyi dbyings rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag @272a * //🔽pa gsal ba'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽'dis ni mnyam nyid kyi ye shes bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la chos kyi dbyings rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag @272a * // pa gsal ba'i bar du 'gyur ro // 'dis ni mnyam nyid kyi ye shes bstan te /
translated: It becomes the cause of the purification of the dharma-dhātu in every way on the Buddha-stage, up to the manifestation of the complete purification of the dharma-dhātu.

original: de yang de yongs su dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de yongs su dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows the knowledge of equality, and it is the cause of its complete purification.

original: sems can kun gyi gnyis bskyed pa //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi gnyis bskyed pa //
translated: It generates the two in all sentient beings

original: gtan du mi zad 'bras bu can //
analyzed: gtan du mi zad 'bras bu can //
translated: and has an inexhaustible result forever.

original: 'di la sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang / bde ba gnyis bskyed pa mi zad pa'i 'bras bu yod pas zhes bya bar rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang / bde ba gnyis bskyed pa mi zad pa'i 'bras bu yod pas zhes bya bar rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Here, the inexhaustible result is to be supplied: it is the generation of both benefit and happiness for all sentient beings in every way.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa skyed pa ni dge ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa skyed pa ni dge ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of benefit for all sentient beings is the generation of virtue.

original: bde ba bskyed pa ni 'phral du'o //🔽de gnyis ni 'di'i stobs kyis 'khor ba ji srid par mdzad pas 'di gnyis mi zad pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: bde ba bskyed pa ni 'phral du'o // de gnyis ni 'di'i stobs kyis 'khor ba ji srid par mdzad pas 'di gnyis mi zad pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The generation of happiness is immediate.

original: chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa ni de'i phyed yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dis ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa ni de'i phyed yin pa'i phyir ro // 'dis ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes bstan te /
translated: Since these two are performed by the power of this, they are its inexhaustible result, because they are the result of the purity of the realm of Dharma.

original: de yang de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This teaches the discernment wisdom, and that is its result.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa //
translated: The activity of the emanation of body, speech, and mind

original: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi phrin las can /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi phrin las can /
translated: is the means of application.

original: 'di la sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa rnams sbyor bar byed pa'i thabs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phrin las mnga' bas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa rnams sbyor bar byed pa'i thabs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phrin las mnga' bas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The method by which the emanations of body, speech, and mind are applied is the very activity of the Buddha.

original: de'i thabs yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i thabs yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he knows the method,

original: de'i phrin las can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phrin las can zhes bya'o //
translated: he is said to have that activity.

original: sku sprul pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sku sprul pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The emanation of body is threefold:

original: rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba dang ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba dang ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: related to one’s own body and to the bodies of others, and unrelated.

original: rang gi lus dang 'brel ba 'di bdag nyid 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang 'brel ba 'di bdag nyid 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su kun du ston pa'o //
translated: Related to one’s own body is the manifestation of one’s own body in the form of a universal monarch, etc.

original: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni bdud la sogs pa sangs rgyas pa'i gzugs su kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni bdud la sogs pa sangs rgyas pa'i gzugs su kun du ston pa'o //
translated: Related to the bodies of others is the manifestation of the bodies of others, such as Māra, in the form of a Buddha.

original: ma 'brel ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rin po ches na bdun gyi rang bzhin du kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rin po ches na bdun gyi rang bzhin du kun du ston pa'o //
translated: Unrelated is the manifestation of the seven precious things of a world-ruling monarch, such as land, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su gzung ba dpag tu med pa kun du ston pa gang yin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su gzung ba dpag tu med pa kun du ston pa gang yin pa yang yin te /
translated: The manifestation of the immeasurable retention of the body of a Buddha is also the emanation of body.

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As was explained earlier.

original: 'od zer rab tu dgye bas 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa snang ba mdzad pa gang yin pa de yang sku sprul pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'od zer rab tu dgye bas 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa snang ba mdzad pa gang yin pa de yang sku sprul pa kho na yin te /
translated: The manifestation of light rays that illuminate infinite world-realms is also a transformation body,

original: des kyang sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it acts for the sake of sentient beings.

original: skye ba la sogs pa kun du ston pa gang yin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa kun du ston pa gang yin pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also the manifestation of birth, etc.

original: de bzhin du gsung sprul pa yang rang gi lus dang 'brel ba ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par go bar mdzad pa'o //🔽gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni gang gis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung sprul pa yang rang gi lus dang 'brel ba ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par go bar mdzad pa'o // gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni gang gis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i yang /
translated: Similarly, a transformation of speech is also related to one's own body, such as the understanding of infinite world-realms through the voice of Brahma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung dbyangs kyis theg pa @272b chen po'i chos bstan par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung dbyangs kyis theg pa @272b chen po'i chos bstan par mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is related to another's body, such as the teaching of the Mahāyāna Dharma through the Buddha's voice to śrāvakas, etc.

original: ma 'brel ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dag las chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dag las chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is unrelated, such as the sound that teaches the Dharma from space, etc.

original: thugs sprul pa ni bdag dang gzhan dang 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: thugs sprul pa ni bdag dang gzhan dang 'brel ba ste /
translated: The emanation of mind is related to oneself and others.

original: bdag nyid chos thams cad thugs su chud la /
analyzed: bdag nyid chos thams cad thugs su chud la /
translated: It is related to oneself because the mind of the Buddha penetrates all things.

original: gzhan yang gang gis na shes rab chung ngus kyang chos zab mo yang khong du chud par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems nges par 'dzin par mdzad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa rnams kyang dran pa slar rnyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gis na shes rab chung ngus kyang chos zab mo yang khong du chud par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems nges par 'dzin par mdzad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa rnams kyang dran pa slar rnyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is related to others because it causes the minds of others to be concentrated in such a way that even those of little intelligence can penetrate the profound Dharma, and because it causes the memory of the Dharma to be retained.

original: 'di ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching of the knowledge of achieving activity,

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as it was explained above.🔽The knowledge of the Buddha is endowed with the doors of concentration and retention,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang // dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang // dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan /
translated: and with the two kinds of inexhaustibility.

original: sgo ni sgo mo'o //
analyzed: sgo ni sgo mo'o //
translated: The doors are the doors of entry.

original: dpag tu med pa gnyis ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag go //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa gnyis ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag go //
translated: The two kinds of inexhaustibility are the inexhaustibility of the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa ste yang dag par ldan pa dang 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa ste yang dag par ldan pa dang 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.🔽The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.🔽The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.🔽The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.🔽The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.

original: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sprul pas tha dad 'jug pa can /
analyzed: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sprul pas tha dad 'jug pa can /
translated: The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.

original: 'di la rang bzhin pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku dag gis tha snyad du 'jug pa yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la rang bzhin pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku dag gis tha snyad du 'jug pa yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.🔽The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.

original: 'on kyang sku gsum gyi bye brag gis 'jug pa'i phyir 'di la tha dad du 'jug pa yod pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sku gsum gyi bye brag gis 'jug pa'i phyir 'di la tha dad du 'jug pa yod pas zhes bya'o //
translated: The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.

original: sku gsum po 'di dag gis ni rang dang gzhan gyi don rten dang bcas pa ston te /
analyzed: sku gsum po 'di dag gis ni rang dang gzhan gyi don rten dang bcas pa ston te /
translated: The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.🔽The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the major and minor marks.🔽The Emanation Body is characterized by the acts of the twelve kinds of buddhas.🔽The Essence Body is characterized by the purification of the realm of Dharma.🔽The Enjoyment Body

original: de la rang bzhin pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The natural body is the Dharma Body.

original: gnas yongs su gyur ba'i mtshan nyid 'byor ba thams cad kyi gnas chos dkar po thams cad la mnga' mdzad pa /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur ba'i mtshan nyid 'byor ba thams cad kyi gnas chos dkar po thams cad la mnga' mdzad pa /
translated: It is the basis of all mastery, having the characteristic of the revolution of the basis, and it is the basis of all good qualities, the mastery of all good qualities.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku'i gnas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshungs pa phra zhing shes par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku'i gnas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshungs pa phra zhing shes par dka' ba yin no //
translated: It is the body of all Buddhas, the equality of all Tathāgatas, subtle and difficult to know.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas gzhan las brtags par bya ba ma yin pa rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa rtog ge'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas gzhan las brtags par bya ba ma yin pa rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa rtog ge'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to that, it is said in another sūtra, “It is not to be examined by another, not the domain of sophists, perfectly beyond the path of sophists.”

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i shes rab rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i shes rab rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa ste /
translated: The beatific body is the post-knowledge intuition of the nondiscriminative intuition that arises by the power of that [Dharma Body].

original: shel la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs @273a * //
analyzed: shel la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs @273a * //
translated: It is the various circles of retinue in the Buddha-lands, which are of the nature of crystal and so forth.

original: kyi nang dag tu sar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang thabs gcig tu chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: kyi nang dag tu sar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang thabs gcig tu chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: It is the reason for the enjoyment of the Dharma by the great bodhisattvas who have entered the stages, together with the Buddhas in the Pure Lands.

original: sprul pa du ma gdul ba'i sems can ji lta ba rnams la gzugs kyi sku la sogs pa kun du bstan pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa du ma gdul ba'i sems can ji lta ba rnams la gzugs kyi sku la sogs pa kun du bstan pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The emanation body is the body of the Buddha that is seen by those sentient beings who are to be converted by the many emanations, and it is the cause for their maturation.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes rab kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes rab kho na yin no //
translated: It is the wisdom that is attained subsequently to the supramundane wisdom.

original: sprul pa pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul yin gyi longs spyod rdzogs pa pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul yin gyi longs spyod rdzogs pa pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The emanation body is the object of the disciples, but not the enjoyment body.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi don chen po ste /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi don chen po ste /
translated: And that is the great purpose of the Tathāgatas.

original: gzugs sna tshogs kun du ston pas rtag tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs kun du ston pas rtag tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is the body that is always present for the maturation of sentient beings, by manifesting various forms.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa pa ni rang gi don mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa pa ni rang gi don mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: The enjoyment body is the body that accomplishes the aims of oneself,

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi don mdzad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi don mdzad pa kho na yin no //
translated: but the emanation body is the body that accomplishes the aims of others.

original: gzhan nas sa sangs rgyas kyi rab tu dbye ba bcu gsungs pa gang dag yin pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas dang / smon lam gyi sangs rgyas dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: gzhan nas sa sangs rgyas kyi rab tu dbye ba bcu gsungs pa gang dag yin pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas dang / smon lam gyi sangs rgyas dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi sangs rgyas dang /
translated: The ten types of buddha explained in other sūtras are the buddha of manifest complete enlightenment, the buddha of aspiration, the buddha of the ripening of karma, the buddha of consecration,🔽the buddha of emanation, the buddha of the dharmadhātu, the buddha of mind, the buddha of meditative concentration, the buddha of nature and the buddha of the fulfillment of wishes.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sangs rgyas dang / sems kyi sangs rgyas dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas dang / rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba de dag kyang gsum po 'di dag kho na'i khongs su 'dus te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sangs rgyas dang / sems kyi sangs rgyas dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas dang / rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba de dag kyang gsum po 'di dag kho na'i khongs su 'dus te /
translated: These are included in the three mentioned above.

original: de la dang po lnga ni kun rdzob kyi sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po lnga ni kun rdzob kyi sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: The first five are conventional buddhas.

original: 'og ma lnga ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: 'og ma lnga ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: The latter five are ultimate buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings //
translated: The dharmadhātu of the buddhas

original: rnam dag 'di ni yang dag brjod //🔽yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pas sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings su yongs su dag pa gang yin pa 'di ni yang dag par brjod zin par tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni go rims bzhin du rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang rgyu dag
analyzed: rnam dag 'di ni yang dag brjod // yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pas sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings su yongs su dag pa gang yin pa 'di ni yang dag par brjod zin par tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni go rims bzhin du rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang rgyu dag
translated: This is the purity.🔽The purity of the realm of the buddhas, which is explained as having the characteristic of complete purification, is called the ultimate reality.🔽In four verses, he teaches in brief the classification of the stage of the buddhas by way of the meaning of nature, cause,

original: dang phrin las dang ldan pa dang 'jug pa'i don gyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par dbye ba de mdor bsdus te ston par byed do //
analyzed: dang phrin las dang ldan pa dang 'jug pa'i don gyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par dbye ba de mdor bsdus te ston par byed do //
translated: effect, and function.

original: mdo sde rnam par bshad byas nas //
analyzed: mdo sde rnam par bshad byas nas //
translated: Having explained the sutra,

original: bsod nams bdag gis gang bskyed pa //
analyzed: bsod nams bdag gis gang bskyed pa //
translated: whatever merit I have produced,

original: des ni 'jig rten sangs rgyas sa //
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten sangs rgyas sa //
translated: by that, may the world attain🔽the supreme, highest enlightenment.

original: dam pa mchog ni thob par shog / slob dpon ngang tshul bzang pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dam pa mchog ni thob par shog / slob dpon ngang tshul bzang pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The work of the master Bhadra is finished.
